translations.zh: 1937年12月，八路军第129师以教导团部分干部组成挺进支队，进入冀南地区开展活动。
translations.en: In December 1937,some officers of the 129th Division of the Eighth Route Army formed the Advance Detachment and entered the Southern Hebei region to carry out activities.

translations.zh: 刘伯承等关于翼南的严重形势及相关战略方针给朱德、彭德怀等的报告（1938年1月18日）
translations.en: Liu Bocheng and others' report to Zhu De, Peng Dehuai, and others on the serious situation in southern Hebei and related strategic policies (January 18, 1938)

translations.zh: 1938年4月，八路军第129师主力及第115师344旅689团等部粉碎日军针对根据地的九路围攻，歼灭日军4000余人。
translations.en: In April 1938, the main force of the Eighth Route Army's 129th Division,along with the 689th Regiment,344th Brigade 115th Division, crushed the Japanese army's Nine-Front Encirclement of the resistance base, annihilating over 4,000 Japanese soldiers.

translations.zh: 图为缴获的部分战利品。
translations.en: The photo shows part of the seized spoils of war.

translations.zh: 1938年3月16日，八路军第129师在山西神头岭地区设伏，毙伤日军1500余人。
translations.en: On March 16,1938,the 129th Division of the Eighth Route Army ambushed Japanese forces in the Shentouling area of Shanxi, inflicting over 1,500 casualties on the enemy.

translations.zh: 图为战前动员大会。
translations.en: The picture shows the pre-battle mobilization meeting.

translations.zh: 第三单元运动抗日救亡运动空前高涨。
translations.en: Section 3 Campaigns to Resist Japanese Aggression and Save the Nation Surged Up Unprecedentedly.

translations.zh: 在中国共产党倡导建立的以国共合作为基础的抗日民族统一战线旗帜下，海内外中华儿女万众一心、众志成城，以强烈的家国情怀，空前团结起来，地不分南北，人不分老幼，义无反顾投身到抗击日本侵略者的斗争之中，谱写下惊天地、泣鬼神的爱国主义篇章。
translations.en: Under the banner of the Chinese united front against Japanese aggression initiated by the CPC and based on the KMT-CPC cooperation, Chinese people both at home and abroad united with one heart to fight their common enemy, showing unprecedented patriotism and solidarity.

translations.zh: 中国海军在长江布设的水雷给日本军舰造成很大威胁。
translations.en: The naval mines laid by the Chinese Navy in the Yangtze River posed a significant threat to Japanese warships.

translations.zh: 图为中国海军布雷队。
translations.en: The image shows the Chinese Navy mine-laying team.

translations.zh: 训练中的中国飞行员在武汉会战中，中国海军中山舰被日机击沉，1937年8月，中国海军与日军在江舰长萨师俊及部分官兵壮烈殉国。
translations.en: Chinese pilots in training.

translations.zh: 图为中山舰和阴血战。
translations.en: During the Battle of Wuhan, the Chinese Navy ship Zhongshan was In August 1937, the Chinese Navy engaged in a bloody battle sunk by Japanese planes, with Captain Sa Shijun and some crew members against Japanese forces in Jiangyin.

translations.zh: 图为江阴作战中，应瑞舰官兵萨师俊。
translations.en: The image shows officers and heroically sacrificing themselves.

translations.zh: 猛烈反击敌机。
translations.en: sailors of the Yingrui Ship fiercely counterattacking enemy planes.

translations.zh: 参加江阴对日作战的中国海军宁海舰
translations.en: The Chinese Navy ship Ninghai, which participated in the Jiangyin Campaign against Japanese forces during the Jiangyin Campaign.

translations.zh: 八路军第3纵队兼冀中军区自成立至1938年7月，先后进行大小战斗100余次，给日、伪军以有力打击。
translations.en: From its establishment to the end of October 1938, the Eighth Route Army's 3rd Column, concurrently the Central Hebei Military Region, carried out more than 100 battles of various scales, delivering powerful blows to the Japanese and puppet troops.

translations.zh: 图为第3纵队部分指战员。
translations.en: The picture shows some commanders and soldiers of the 3rd Column.

translations.zh: 1938年4月，八路军第129师副师长徐向前率部挺进冀南。
translations.en: In April 1938, Xu Xiangqian, Deputy Commander of the Eighth Route Army's 129th Division, led his troops into Southern Hebei.

translations.zh: 图为东进纵队司令员陈再道（左）、政治委员宋任穷（中）与第386旅参谋长李聚奎（右）。
translations.en: The picture shows Chen Zaidao (left), Song Renqiong (middle) and Li Jukui (right).

translations.zh: 1938年5月下旬，进抵平西的八路军第120师宋时轮支队，与晋察冀军区邓华支队合编为八路军第4纵队，开辟平西抗日根据地。
translations.en: In late May 1938, the Eighth Route Army's Fourth Column was established, opening up the Western Beiping Resistance Base.

translations.zh: 图为向平西挺进的第4纵队收复斋堂。
translations.en: The photo shows the Fourth Column advancing towards Western Beiping recapturing Zhaitang Town, Beiping.

translations.zh: 1938年7月，八路军第4纵队配合中共冀热边特委发动和领导了冀东22个县及开滦煤矿共20余万人的武装暴动，沉重打击了日、伪军和伪政权。
translations.en: In July 1938, the Eighth Route Army's Fourth Column coordinated with the CPC Hebei-Rehe Border Region Special Committee to initiate and lead an armed uprising involving over 200,000 people across 22 counties in Eastern Hebei and the Kailuan Coal Mines.

translations.zh: 图为参加暴动的部分战士。
translations.en: The photo shows some participants of the uprising.

translations.zh: 1938年5月4日，活跃在冀中地区的人民自卫军与河北游击军合编为八路军第3纵队兼冀中军区，吕正操任纵队兼军区司令员。
translations.en: On May 4, 1938, the People's Self-Defense Army in the Central Hebei region merged with the Hebei Guerrilla Army to form the Eighth Route Army's 3rd Column and concurrently the Central Hebei Military Region.

translations.zh: 图为吕正操（中）与第3纵队部分指战员。
translations.en: Lyu Zhengcao was appointed as Captain of column and Commander of the military region. The photo shows Lyu Zhengcao (middle) with some officers and soldiers of the 3rd Column.

translations.zh: 1938年中共河北省委关于八路军东进建立抗日根据地给各级党组织的通知
translations.en: A notice from the Hebei Provincial Committee of the Communist Party of China in 1938 regarding the Eighth Route Army's eastward advance to establish a resistance base issued to various Party organizations.

translations.zh: 毛泽东等关于创建冀热察根据地给聂荣臻、宋时轮等的电报（1938年9月26日）
translations.en: Mao Zedong and other telegrams to Nie Rongzhen, Song Shilun, and others regarding the creation of the Hebei-Rehe-Chahar Resistance Base (September 26, 1938)

translations.zh: 1938年4月21日，中共中央作出重要战略决策：令原在山西山区的八路军三大主力分别向河北和山东的平原地区挺进。
translations.en: On April 21, 1938, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China issued directives on guerrilla warfare in the plain areas.

translations.zh: 第三部分砥柱中流中国共产竞坚定不移站在抗战最前线中国共产党在波澜壮阔的抗日战争进程中始终发挥中流砥柱作用。
translations.en: PART3 The CPC Stood Firm on the Front Line as the Backbone in the War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression During the magnificent course of the War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression, the Communist Party of China (CPC) consistently played a pivotal role.

translations.zh: 全民族抗战爆发后，中国共产党提出和实施持久战的战略总方针和一整套人民战争的战略战术。
translations.en: Following the outbreak of the whole-nation resistance war against Japanese aggression, the CPC formulated and implemented the general strategy of protracted war and a complete set of strategies and tactics for people's war.

translations.zh: 进入战略相持阶段后，中国共产党放手发动人民群众，广泛开展抗日游击战争，广阔的敌后战场逐渐成为中国抗战的主战场。
translations.en: As the war entered the strategic stalemate stage, the CPC mobilized the people extensively and led widespread guerrilla warfare against Japanese forces, gradually turning the vast backstage battlefield into the main theater of Chinese People's War of Resistance.

translations.zh: 中国共产党始终坚持抗战、反对投降，坚持团结、反对分裂，坚持进步、反对倒退，坚决维护抗日民族统一战线和团结抗战大局，成为坚持抗战的中坚力量、夺取战争胜利的民族先锋。
translations.en: The CPC remained steadfast in resistance and opposed capitulation, upheld unity and opposed division, promoted progress and opposed retrogression.

translations.zh: 声援祖国抗战1938年10月，南洋各属华侨筹赈祖国难民总会（简称南侨总会）成立，积极组织南洋华侨从财力、物力、人力上支援祖国抗战，成为东南亚华侨抗日救亡运动的最高领导机关。
translations.en: Supporting the National Resistance Against Japanese Aggression In October 1938, the Relief Committee of Nanyang Overseas Chinese for China's Refugees (abbreviated as Committee of Nanyang Overseas Chinese) was established to actively support China's fight against the Japanese aggression through financial, material, and manpower contributions, becoming the highest leadership body of the Southeast Asian Chinese resistance against Japanese aggression.

translations.zh: 图为南侨总会办事处所在地新加坡怡和轩。
translations.en: The photo shows the office location of the Committee of Nanyang Overseas Chinese in Singapore's Ee Hoe Hean Club.

translations.zh: 泰国中华总商会主席、爱国侨领蚁光炎积极带领泰国华侨开展抗日救国活动。
translations.en: The troops and Chairman of the Thai-Chinese Chamber of Commerce and patriotic overseas Chinese leader Ng Kwang-yen (Yi Guangyan) actively led Thai Overseas Chinese in organizing resistance activities against Japanese aggression to save the nation.

translations.zh: 1939年11月21日，蚁光炎在曼谷遇害。
translations.en: On November 21, 1939, he was assassinated in Bangkok.

translations.zh: 图为蚁光炎（前排左5）在泰国宣传抗日。
translations.en: The photo shows Ng

translations.zh: 1936年，中共地下党员柯麟到澳门负责与叶挺的联络工作，并以医生身份开展社会活动。
translations.en: In 1936, Ke Lin, an underground CPC member, arrived in Macao, where he was responsible for liaison with Ye Ting and carried out social activities under the disguise of a doctor.

translations.zh: 图为柯麟与镜湖医院西医顾问团合影（后排左1为柯麟）。
translations.en: The picture shows Ke Lin (back row, first from left) and members of the Western Medicine Advisory Group of Kiang Wu Hospital.

translations.zh: 抗战时期，澳门知名爱国实业家、战时儿童教养家马万祺积极捐助广东战时儿童教养院，并冒着巨大风险向内地输送棉纱等物资，倾力资助澳门镜湖医院。
translations.en: During the Chinese People's War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression, Ma Man-kei, a renowned patriotic industrialist in Macao, made huge donations to the Guangdong Wartime Orphanage, took great risks to send cotton yarn and other supplies to the mainland, and spared no effort to provide financial support for Kiang Wu Hospital in Macao.

translations.zh: 图为马万祺（右1）与镜湖医院院长柯麟（右2）及其弟柯正平合影。
translations.en: The picture shows Ma Man-kei (first from right) with Ke Lin (second from right), Director of Kiang Wu Hospital, and his younger brother Ke Zhengping.

translations.zh: 第一单元坚持持久战的战略总方针全民族抗战爆发后，对于抗战的进程和前途，国内存在“亡国论”和“速胜论”两种观点。
translations.en: Section 1 Upholding the General Strategy of Protracted War After the full-scale outbreak of the Chinese People's War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression,two opposing views emerged in China regarding the war's trajectory: one argued for the inevitability of national subjugation ("National Subjugation"),while the other anticipated a swift victory ("Quick Victory").

translations.zh: 为了阐明持久战的问题，坚定中国抗战胜利的信心，毛泽东结合实际，总结全民族抗战以来的经验教训，集中全党智慧，撰写了《论持久战》《抗日游击战争的战略问题》等著作，系统阐明中国共产党的抗日持久战战略总方针，深刻揭示抗日战争的发展规律。
translations.en: In order to clarify the necessity and logic of a protracted war and to reinforce confidence in ultimate victory, Mao Zedong drawing upon real wartime experience, the lessons learned since the beginning of the national resistance, and the collective wisdom of the Communist Party of China authored key works such as On Protracted War and Problems of Strategy in Guerrilla War Against Japan.

translations.zh: 河北武强县前西代村儿童团团员温三郁在反“扫荡”中面对日军的诱逼宁死不屈，被砍掉右手的两个手指，仍没有屈从，被晋察冀边区评为“气节模范第一名”。
translations.en: Wen Sanyu, a Children's Corps member from Qianxidai Village, Wuqiang County, Hebei Province, refused to succumb even under the pressures of the enemy during the “anti-mopping up" campaign.

translations.zh: 图为温三郁（右）和另外两个小英雄的山东胶东抗日根据地民兵张玉芬（左）、牛国才（中）。
translations.en: Despite having two fingers on his right hand cut off by the Japanese soldiers, he stood firm and was named “Role Model of Integrity by the Shanxi-Chahar-Hebei Border Region.

translations.zh: 女英雄孙玉敏正月里来是新春，赶上了猪羊出呀了门，猪呀羊呀，送到哪里去？送给那英勇的八路军。
translations.en: The picture shows Wen Sanyu (right) with two other young heroes, Zhang Yufen (left) and Niu Guocai (middle).

translations.zh: 一拥军歌淮北群众为新四军制作渡河工具
translations.en: Sun Yumin,a female militia hero from the Shandong Jiaodong Resistance Base, who participated in over 100 battles and bravely killed enemies.

translations.zh: 第二单元广泛开展抗日游击战争敌后战场逐渐成为中国抗战的主战场响应《论持》1938年9月29日至11月6日，中国共产党在延安召开扩大的第六届中央委员会第六次全体会议。
translations.en: Section 2 Narrow Waging Extensive Guerrilla Warfare- The Backstage Battlefield Gradually Became China's Main Theater in the War of Resistance On Practice From September 29 to November 6,1938,the Communist Party of China convened the Sixth Enlarged Plenary Session of the Sixth CPC Central Committee in Yan'an.

translations.zh: 会议正确分析了抗日战争的形势，规定了党在抗战新阶段的任务，把巩固和发展敌后游击战争作为党的军事战略的首要任务，并将巩固华北，发展华中”确定为开展敌后游击战争的基本方针。
translations.en: This expanded meeting accurately assessed the evolving situation in the War of Resistance and set forth the Party's strategic priorities for the new phase of the war of resistance, made the consolidation and expansion of guerrilla warfare behind enemy lines the Party's primary task in its military strategy, and defined “Consolidate North China,Develop Central China" as the basic policy for guerrilla warfare behind enemy lines.

translations.zh: 进入战略相持阶段后，广阔的敌后战场逐渐上升为中国抗战的主战场，大规模的敌后游击战争在持久抗战中发挥了重大战略作用。
translations.en: As the war entered a stage of strategic stalemate,the vast backstage battlefield gradually became the main theater of China's resistance efforts,and the large-scale guerrilla warfare behind enemy lines played a critical strategic role in sustaining the prolonged resistance.

translations.zh: 八路军冀鲁豫军区第8军分区7团参谋长王正南与一同参加抗战的11位家人合一家树的八路军照，被形象地称为
translations.en: A group photo of Wang Zhengnan, chief of staff of the Seventh Regiment of the Eighth District of the Hebei-Shandong-Henan Military Region, with 11 family members who also participated in the War of Resistance against Japanese Aggression, vividly referred to as “a tree of the Eighth Route Army.

translations.zh: 第三单元抗日民主根据地的全面建设
translations.en: Section 3 Comprehensive Development of the Democratic Resistance Bases

translations.zh: 中国共产党在抗日民主根据地中全面推进各项建设，将各抗日根据地建设成军民一体、牢不可破的坚强堡垒，激发了广大军民的抗战热情，使各抗日根据地呈现出崭新面貌，为长期坚持敌后抗战、争取抗战最后胜利奠定了坚实基础。
translations.en: The Communist Party of China comprehensively advanced all aspects of development in the democratic resistance bases, building resistance bases into unbreakable strongholds of unity between army and people.

translations.zh: 图为延安北郊兰家坪的马列学院旧址。
translations.en: The picture shows the site of the Marxism-Leninism College at Lanjiaping in the north suburb of Yan'an.

translations.zh: 1941年9月，中共中央决定在陕北公学民族部、中央党校民族班的基础上成立延安民族学院。
translations.en: In September 1941, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China decided to establish the Yan'an Ethnic Institute based on the Ethnic Department of the Northern Shaanxi Public School and the Ethnic Class of the Central Party School.

translations.zh: 图为延安民族学院学生在集会。
translations.en: The photo shows students of the Yan'an Ethnic Institute at a gathering.

translations.zh: 1940年9月创办的延安自然科学院是中国共产党历史上第一个开展自然科学教学与研究的专门机构。
translations.en: The Yan'an Academy of Natural Sciences, established in September 1940, was the first specialized institution in the history of the Communist Party of China dedicated to teaching and researching natural sciences.

translations.zh: 图为延安自然科学院旧址。
translations.en: The photo shows the site of the Yan'an Academy of Natural Sciences.

translations.zh: 1938年至1940年，新四军在皖南举办卫生训练队，共办6期，培训医护人员近200人。
translations.en: From 1938 to 1940, the New Fourth Army operated a health training unit in southern Anhui, holding six sessions and training nearly 200 medical personnel.

translations.zh: 图为朝气蓬勃的卫训队女学员。
translations.en: The photo shows energetic female trainees of the health training unit.

translations.zh: 图为晋察冀平西小学。
translations.en: The photo shows the Western Beiping Primary School in Shanxi-Chahar-Hebei region.

translations.zh: 延安中学旧址。
translations.en: The site of the Yan'an Middle School.

translations.zh: 第四单元坚持抗战、团结进步坚定维护抗日民族战线中国共产党始终坚持抗战、团结、进步的方针，连续打退或制止国民党顽固派三次反共高潮，在国统区和沦陷区组织群众、动员群众进行艰苦卓绝的反日斗争，巩固并扩大了抗日民族统一战线，有力维护了全国抗战大局。
translations.en: as Section 4 Persisting in Resistance, Unity, and Progress - Upholding the Chinese United Front Against Japanese Aggression Adhering to the principle of resistance, unity,and progress, the CPC repelled or thwarted three anti-communist onslaughts launched by KMT diehards. Moreover, it organized and mobilized the people in KMT-controlled areas and Japanese-occupied areas to carry out an extremely arduous struggle against Japanese aggression,further consolidating and expanding the Chinese united front against Japanese aggression and effectively safeguarding the overall situation of nationwide resistance against Japanese aggression.

translations.zh: “三三制”，形成了社会稳定、干部团结、群众拥护的良好局面。
translations.en: In the Sub-region of the Central Shaanxi Plain, the Shaanxi-Gansu-Ningxia Border Region, the political organization mode “Three-Thirds System (the CPC, the non-Party element, and the people)" was adopted and it helped create a favorable situation where the society was stable, officials were united and people were supportive.

translations.zh: 图为陕甘宁边区关中分区模范贯彻关中分区地委书记习仲勋（右三）和战友们。
translations.en: The picture shows Xi Zhongxun (third from right), the Secretary of the CPC Sub-region of the Central Shaanxi Plain, and soldiers.

translations.zh: 1941年12月，中共中央接受边区参议会议员李鼎铭的提案，开始在各抗日根据地实行“精兵简政”，以期达到“精简、统一效能、节约和反对官僚主义”的目的。
translations.en: A Liberation Daily report on the“streamlining of the armed forces and administration."

translations.zh: 图为边区百姓投票选举抗日民主政权的成员。
translations.en: The picture shows the people in the border region voting to elect members of the border region government.

translations.zh: 第一部分台湾是中国的一部分两岸同胞同属中华民族。
translations.en: PART I MyLand and My People: Taiwan is an Inalienable Part of China Compatriots on both sides of the Taiwan Strait are members of the Chinese nation, one of the greatest nations in the world.

translations.zh: 中华民族是世界上伟大的民族，中华民族在漫长历史中，共同建设了包括宝岛台湾在内的祖国疆域，共同书写了中国历史，共同创造了中华文化，共同培育了民族精神。
translations.en: Throughout its long history, the Chinese people have worked together to build the motherland, including Taiwan, jointly written Chinese history, created Chinese culture, and fostered the national spirit.

translations.zh: 台湾自古属于中国的历史经纬清晰、法理事实清楚。
translations.en: Taiwan has belonged to China since ancient times.This has a sound basis in history and jurisprudence.

translations.zh: 不断有新的考古发现和研究证明海峡两岸深厚的历史和文化联系。
translations.en: New archaeological discoveries and research findings have repeatedly attested to the profound historical and cultural ties between the two sides of the Taiwan Strait.

translations.zh: 大量的史书和文献记载了中国人民早期开发台湾的情景。
translations.en: A large number of historical records and annals document the development of Taiwan by the Chinese people in its early history.

translations.zh: 中华民族一路走来，书写了海峡两岸不可分割的历史，镌刻着两岸同胞血脉相连的史实。
translations.en: The Chinese nation has created a history demonstrating the inseparable connection between the two sides of the Taiwan Strait, engraving the fact that compatriots across the Taiwan Strait are bound by blood.

translations.zh: 第一单元台湾自古以来就是中国领土台湾自古以来就是中国领土。
translations.en: Section1 Taiwan Has Been an Inalienable Part of China Since Ancient Times Taiwan has been an inalienable Part of China since ancient times.

translations.zh: 台湾岛位于中国大陆架的边缘，大陆与台湾紧密相连。
translations.en: Located on the edge of the continental shelf of the Chinese mainland, Taiwan is closely connected to the Chinese mainland.

translations.zh: 考古学证明，早期台湾先民的文化与祖国大陆东南的文化息息相关。
translations.en: According to archaeological research, the early inhabitants of Taiwan share inseparable cultural bonds with those in the southeast Chinese mainland.

translations.zh: 古代人群DNA研究也表明，台湾地区的古代人群与大陆侗傣语人群有紧密的遗传关系。
translations.en: Studies of ancient peoples'DNA have also revealed that ancient populations shared close genetic ties with the Tai-Kadai speakers on the Chinese mainland.

translations.zh: 三国时期，孙吴政权巡视夷洲（今台湾），隋唐时期称台湾为“流求”，隋朝曾三次派人招抚流求。
translations.en: During the Three Kingdoms period, the Wu state inspected Yizhou (present-day Taiwan).

translations.zh: 宋元以来，中央政府一直对台湾实行有效的管辖。
translations.en: In the Sui and Tang dynasties, Taiwan was referred to as "Liuqiu," and the Sui Dynasty government dispatched envoys three times to pacify the region.

translations.zh: 台湾自古就是中国领土。
translations.en: Taiwan has been an inalienable part of China's sacred territory since ancient times.

translations.zh: 台湾与祖国命运紧密相连，两岸同胞荣辱与共。
translations.en: The fate of Taiwan has always been inextricably linked with that of the motherland, and compatriots across the Taiwan strait share a common future.

translations.zh: 1840年鸦片战争之后，西方列强入侵，中国陷入内忧外患、山河破碎的悲惨境地，台湾更是被日本侵占长达半个世纪。
translations.en: Following the Opium War of 1840, Western powers invaded China on a large scale, plunging the nation into a tragic state of domestic turmoil and foreign aggression, with its territories torn asunder, Taiwan, in particular, was colonized by Japan for half a century.

translations.zh: 为战胜外来侵略、争取民族解放、实现国家统一，中华儿女前仆后继，进行了可歌可泣的斗争。
translations.en: To resist foreign aggression, fight for national liberation, and achieve national reunification, generations of Chinese people carried out a heroic and moving struggle.

translations.zh: 台湾同胞在这场斗争中作出了重要贡献。
translations.en: Taiwan compatriots made remarkable contributions in this great cause.

translations.zh: 1945年，中国人民同世界各国人民一道，取得了中国人民抗日战争暨世界反法西斯战争的伟大胜利，台湾随之光复，重回祖国怀抱。
translations.en: In 1945, the Chinese people, together with people across the world, achieved the great victory in the Chinese People's War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression and the World Anti-Fascist War.

translations.zh: 数十万台湾同胞在长达50年的抗日斗争中献出了自己宝贵的生命，以慷慨赴死的英雄气概谱写了气壮山河的民族史诗！
translations.en: Consequently, Taiwan was recovered and returned to the motherland Hundreds of thousands of Taiwan compatriots sacrificed their precious lives in the resistance against Japanese aggression of 50 years, With a heroic spirit of fighting fearlessly to the death, they composed a monumental national epic.

translations.zh: 台湾光复是包括台湾同胞在内的全体中国人民前仆后继、浴血奋战铸就的伟大胜利！
translations.en: The recovery of Taiwan was a great victory achieved through the immense sacrifices and relentless struggles of all the Chinese people, with our compatriots in Taiwan playing an integral role in this collective effort.

translations.zh: 第二单元郑成功收复台湾
translations.en: Section 2 Zheng Chenggong's Recovery of Taiwan

translations.zh: 1624年，荷兰侵略者占据台湾后，台湾人民反抗荷兰殖民者的斗争此起彼伏，从未间断。
translations.en: In 1624, the Dutch invaders occupied Taiwan.Since then, Taiwan people's resistance against the Dutch colonizers persisted throughout the occupation period.

translations.zh: 1662年，郑成功率军打败荷兰殖民者，收复台湾。
translations.en: In 1662, Zheng Chenggong led his forces to defeat the Dutch colonizers and recovered Taiwan.

translations.zh: 郑成功在台湾设承天府，郑氏祖孙三代在台湾发展农商，提倡文教，保境安民。
translations.en: After establishing Chengtian Prefecture in Taiwan, three generations of the Zheng family developed agriculture and commerce in Taiwan, promoted culture and education,maintained social stability and protected the local populace.

translations.zh: 台南赤嵌楼是荷兰人窃据台湾时修建的一座海上城堡。
translations.en: Chikan Tower in Tainan was a fortress on the sea built by Dutch colonizers during their occupation of Taiwan.

translations.zh: 今陈列着荷兰人投降的条约书、郑成功与荷军作战的海图等珍贵历史资料，是郑成功收复台湾的历史见证。
translations.en: Precious historical documents including the treaty of capitulation signed by the Dutch and the sea chart used by Zheng Chenggong are on display.

translations.zh: 《台湾郑氏始末》民国二十三年六月重印郑氏政权在台湾设郡县，请文才，建孔庙，设学校，开科举，使中华文化在台湾生根成长并发扬光大。
translations.en: The Zheng regime established prefectures and counties in Taiwan. To enable the Chinese culture take root and develop in Taiwan, he invited literary talents, built Confucian temples, established schools, and implemented the imperial civil examination system.

translations.zh: 图为1666年，郑氏在台南建成的第一座孔庙，素有“全台首学”之称。
translations.en: The photo shows the first Confucian temple built by Zheng in Tainan in 1666, renowned as "the First School in Taiwan."

translations.zh: 荷兰殖民者在今台南市安平区建立热兰遮城，作为行政据点。
translations.en: Dutch colonizers established Fort Zeelandia in today's Anping District, Tainan City as the administrative base.

translations.zh: 图为1644年荷兰人绘制的荷兰殖民者在大员（今安平）修建的城堡和市镇全景。
translations.en: The photo shows the panoramic depiction of the fort and town built by Dutch colonizers in 1644 in Tayouan (present-day Anping, Taiwan).

translations.zh: 台南安平古堡保存的郑成功收复台湾时使用的炮
translations.en: The cannon preserved at Anping Fort in Tainan, which was used by Zheng Chenggong during his recovery of Taiwan.

translations.zh: 第三单元清代对台湾的开发与治理
translations.en: Section 3 The Development and Governance of Taiwan in the Qing Dynasty

translations.zh: 1683年，清朝政府派福建水师提督施琅率军入台，台湾郑氏宣布归附。
translations.en: In 1683, the Qing government dispatched the Commander-in-Chief of the Fujian Naval Fleet, Shi Lang, to lead his forces to Taiwan, and the Zheng regime then submitted to the authority of the Qing Dynasty.

translations.zh: 1684年，清朝政府设台湾府，隶属福建省管辖。
translations.en: In 1684, the Qing government established Taiwan Prefecture, which was under the jurisdiction of Fujian Province.

translations.zh: 1875年，清朝政府为进一步经营和治理台湾，增设台北府及淡水、新竹、宜兰三县和基隆厅。
translations.en: In 1875, to further administer Taiwan, the Qing government additionally established Taipei Prefecture and three counties of Tamsui, Hsinchu and Yilan, as well as Keelung Subprefecture.

translations.zh: 1885年，正式划台湾为单一行省，并选派福建巡抚刘铭传为首任巡抚，行政区扩为三府一州，领十一县五厅。
translations.en: In 1885, Taiwan was officially designated as a province, and Liu Mingchuan was appointed as the first governor. The administrative region was expanded to three prefectures and one department, governing a total of eleven counties and five subprefectures.

translations.zh: 刘铭传治理台湾期间，铺铁路，开矿山，架电线，造商轮，兴办企业，创设新学堂，开启台湾近代化进程，推进台湾社会经济文化发展。
translations.en: During his administration, Liu Mingchuan pioneered Taiwan's modernization and pushed forward its socioeconomic and cultural transformation by constructing railways, opening mines, installing electric wires, building merchant ships, establishing enterprises, and founding new schools.

translations.zh: 第二部分 日本强行侵占台湾以及殖民统治
translations.en: PART II Elegy for the Treasure Island: Taiwan Was Forcibly Occupied and Colonized by Japan

translations.zh: 近代以来，日本对台湾觊觎已久。
translations.en: In the modern history, Taiwan had always been a coveted target of Japan.

translations.zh: 清朝政府在中日甲午战争中战败，于1895年4月被迫签订了丧权辱国的《马关条约》，台湾全岛及其所有附属岛屿以及澎湖列岛被割让给日本。
translations.en: The Qing government was defeated in the Sino-Japanese War of 1894-1895 and was forced to sign the humiliating Treaty of Shimonoseki in April 1895, ceding Taiwan, all its affiliated islands, and the Penghu Islands to Japan.

translations.zh: 消息传来，举国义愤，发生了著名的“公车上书”事件。
translations.en: When the terms of the treaty were announced, public outrage swept the nation, leading to the famous “Petition of the Examination Candidates" protest.

translations.zh: 日本侵占台湾后，开始在台湾进行长达50年的殖民统治。
translations.en: After the occupation of Taiwan, the Japanese colonizers began their 50-year colonial rule over Taiwan.

translations.zh: 在此期间，日本殖民统治者疯狂掠夺各种资源，残害台湾民众，制造无数令人发指的血腥惨案，对台湾民众犯下了累累罪行！
translations.en: During this period, Japanese colonial authorities ruthlessly plundered Taiwan's resources and brutally oppressed Taiwan people, committing countless atrocities and inflicting great suffering on the people of Taiwan!

translations.zh: 第一单元日本侵犯与清政府被迫割让台湾日本对台湾垂涎已久，妄图侵占台湾。
translations.en: Section 1 Japanese Aggression and the Qing Government's Forced Cession of Taiwan Japan had long coveted Taiwan, attempting to occupy it by force.

translations.zh: 1874年，日本以“琉球属民”为名出兵“牡丹社事件”为借口、以保护所谓琉球属民”为名侵略台湾。
translations.en: In 1874, Japan used the "Mudan Incident" as a pretext to invade Taiwan under the guise of protecting the so-called "subject people of the Ryukyu Islands".

translations.zh: 同年10月，清朝政府被迫与日本签订《北京专条》。
translations.en: In October of the same year, the Qing government was compelled to sign the Sino-Japanese Convention of Peking with Japan.

translations.zh: 1894年，日本挑起甲午战争，翌年4月，强迫清政府签订《马关条约》，割让台湾全岛及其所有附属岛屿以及澎湖列岛。
translations.en: In 1894, Japan provoked the Sino-Japanese War of 1894-1895. In April of the following year, Japan compelled the Qing affiliated islands, and the Penghu Islands.

translations.zh: 刘铭传（1836—1896），字省三，庐州府合肥县（今安徽肥西）人。
translations.en: Liu Mingchuan (1836-1896), whose style name was Shengsan, was a native of Hefei County, Luzhou Prefecture (present-day Feixi, Anhui).

translations.zh: 1885年，刘铭传被任命为台湾省首任巡抚，他为台湾的近代化进程作出了突出贡献。
translations.en: He was appointed as the first Governor of Taiwan Province in 1885. He made significant contributions to Taiwan's modernization.

translations.zh: 1683年，清朝政府派福建水师提督施琅渡海攻台，统一台湾。
translations.en: In 1683, the Qing government dispatched the Commander-in-Chief of the Fujian Naval Fleet, Shi Lang, to sail across the sea and conquer Taiwan, thus bringing the region under its rule.

translations.zh: 1684年，清朝政府在台湾设立台湾府，隶属福建省，同时在台湾、澎湖设兵驻守。
translations.en: The Qing government set up Taiwan Prefecture in 1684, which was under the jurisdiction of Fujian Province. Concurrently, garrisons were stationed in both Taiwan and Penghu.

translations.zh: 图为施琅画像。
translations.en: The photo shows Shi Lang.

translations.zh: 《靖海纪事》集中收录了施琅关于用兵平定台湾的谋划部署、收复台湾后的治理措施等奏疏。
translations.en: Records of the Pacification of the Seas covers the memorials of Shi Lang on the strategies and deployment for subduing Taiwan and the governance measures following the recovery of Taiwan.

translations.zh: 河南省宜阳县发现的《台湾县志》，记载了清康熙二十二年至五十八年（1683—1719）台湾的政治、经济、历史和地理情况。
translations.en: Taiwan Xianzhi (Gazetteer of Taiwan County), discovered in Yiyang County, Henan Province, records the general situation of politics, economy, history and geography in the period from the 22nd to the 58th year of the Kangxi Reign in the Qing Dynasty (1683-1719).

translations.zh: 第三单元日本血腥占台与殖民统治日本在台湾建立殖民统治后，在政治、经济、思想文化等方面残酷迫害台湾民众，妄图灭台湾民众的中华民族意识。
translations.en: Section3 Japan's Brutal Occupation of Taiwan and Its Colonial Rule After establishing colonial rule in Taiwan, Japan cruelly persecuted the local people's Chinese national identity, attempting to assimilate them into subservient subjects.

translations.zh: 日本发动全面侵华战争后，又将台湾当作战争基地，更加疯狂地掠夺台湾各种资源，强征台湾民众充当侵略战争的炮灰。
translations.en: Following Japan's full-scale invasion of China, Taiwan became Japan's military supply base.

translations.zh: 第三部分两岸同胞掀起抗日斗争高潮
translations.en: PART III The Rising up in Resistance: Compatriots on Both Sides of the Taiwan Strait Ushered in a Climax of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression

translations.zh: 1895年5月，日军在台湾登陆后，由北向南进攻，台湾军民起了轰轰烈烈的武装抗日活动。
translations.en: In May 1895, Japanese forces landed on Taiwan and launched attacks from the north to the south.

translations.zh: 日本侵占台湾后，包括少数民族在内的台湾各地民众的武装斗争连绵不断，如火如茶，沉重打击了日本在台湾的殖民统治，展现出中华儿女可贵的民族气节。
translations.en: Taiwan thus witnessed a massive upsurge in armed resistance against Japanese aggression by both soldiers and civilians.

translations.zh: 1895年1月，日军乘军舰在山东荣成湾集结后登陆。
translations.en: In January 1895, before landing, Japanese troops took warships and gathered in the Bay.

translations.zh: 1895年2月，日军占领威海卫后修筑工事。
translations.en: In February 1895, Japanese troops constructed defensive fortifications after occupying Weihaiwei.

translations.zh: 日军占领刘公岛北洋舰队海军公所附近。
translations.en: Japanese forces seized the Beiyang Fleet Headquarters in Liugong Island.

translations.zh: 本日原（求政）方马建惠合见列府者外伊泉支邢人之千俊三脖谈物所伊藤贝の雨大臣丈李の李调章杜李鞭芳其他儿名の本日の会见列席艺人名食见脖周±一三十分2陶大均龙隆奥（吉）の嘴氏中旧井上伍廷芳给事中谢马机指精济李鸿幸父子赴台文制由婚和使上座の光景四八二十月日清刑科给事中谢隽杭奏折《请派李鸿章父子赴台交割由》，讽刺李鸿章父子“既能定割地请和之策，自必具用夷变夏之才”，“岂有功届垂成，反自逍遥事外之理”。
translations.en: Request to Dispatch Li Hongzhang and His Son to Supervise Taiwan's Handover, a memorial by Censor of the Criminal Division Xie Junhang of the Qing Dynasty, satirizes Li Hongzhang and his son: "Those who adopt the strategy of ceding territory and begging for peace certainly possess the talent to transform China with the barbarians. How can it be justified that when success is nearly at hand, these people remain unconcerned with the matters at hand."

translations.zh: 清御史陈壁奏折《台地碍难界敌由》中认为“台湾虽孤悬海外，实系沿海七省门户”，坚决反对割让台湾。
translations.en: Impracticality of Ceding Taiwan to the Enemy, a memorial by Censor Chen Bi of the Qing Dynasty, argues that "Although Taiwan lies isolated across the sea, it is actually a gateway to seven coastal provinces." He thus firmly opposed the act of ceding Taiwan.

translations.zh: 1895年3月21日，《日本新闻》附录“李鸿章、李经芳（方）和谈开始”。
translations.en: Supplement to The Japan News: "Peace negotiations with Li Hongzhang and Li Jingfang begin" on March 21st, 1895.

translations.zh: 派此二人赴台交割，正好可以“终遂其志”。
translations.en: "If these two people can be dispatched to handle the handover related matters in Taiwan, their ambition can be fulfilled."

translations.zh: 来子第一单元义旗英勇抵抗日军侵占台湾翁叔平徒天“愿人人战死为抗日保台，台湾军民纷纷表示而失台，决不愿拱手而让台”，纷纷组织武装力量抵抗日军占领台湾，使日本侵略者付出惨痛代价才占领台湾。
translations.en: Section 1 Heroically Resisting the Japanese Occupation of Taiwan To resist Japanese aggression and protect Taiwan, Taiwanese soldiers and civilians claimed that “we would prefer to lose Taiwan in a fight to the last man, rather than surrender it meekly"As they organized armed forces to oppose Japan's occupation in different corners of Taiwan, Japanese invaders occupied Taiwan at a huge cost.

translations.zh: 台湾军民的抵抗斗争充分显示了两岸同胞维护国家领土完整和保卫家园的坚强意志。
translations.en: The resistance of Taiwan soldiers and civilians fully demonstrated the strong will of compatriots across the Taiwan Strait in safeguarding national territorial integrity and defending homeland.

translations.zh: 茶是台湾重要的农产品。
translations.en: Tea was an important agricultural product in Taiwan.

translations.zh: 在日本殖民统治下，茶叶收归总督府专卖，日本殖民者独占了巨大利润。
translations.en: Under Japan's colonial rule, tea was monopolized by the Taiwan Governor-General's Office and Japanese colonizers monopolized huge profits.

translations.zh: 图为台湾茶农在采茶。
translations.en: The photo shows Taiwan farmers picking tea leaves.

translations.zh: 台湾盐业发达，台湾盐主要供应日本本土、朝鲜甚至香港、马尼拉以及日军占领地。
translations.en: Salt industry in Taiwan was highly developed.

translations.zh: 图为台湾盐田。
translations.en: The salt of Taiwan was mainly supplied to Japan as well as Japanese-occupied areas such as Korea, Hong Kong and Manila.

translations.zh: 糖业是台湾最大的特色产业。
translations.en: Sugar production was the largest industry in Taiwan.

translations.zh: 日本殖民统治时期，大量日资糖厂企业进入台湾，排挤和兼并了台湾的民族资本小制糖企业，摧毁了台湾传统的制糖家庭手工业。
translations.en: During the period of the colonial rule by Japan, a large number of Japanese-invested sugar factories set up operations in Taiwan, squeezing out and acquiring small-scale national capital sugar refineries of Taiwan.

translations.zh: 图为在台日本制糖工厂。
translations.en: Traditional household sugar craft industry in Taiwan was thus ruined.

translations.zh: 日本殖民者将台湾的林业资源运往日本或欧美各国进行海外贸易大量掠夺台湾的林业资源。
translations.en: Japanese colonizers plundered the forestry resources of Taiwan massively and shipped the timber to Japan or Western countries for overseas trade.

translations.zh: 图为日本殖民者在阿里山神社内向被砍伐树木“默哀”而建造的“树灵塔”。
translations.en: The photo shows the Tree Spirit Tower erected by Japanese colonizers within the Alishan Shrine to "mourn" the felled trees.

translations.zh: 日本殖民者将台湾丰富的煤炭、石油等矿产资源源源不断运往日本，使台湾成为日本专用的资源供应基地。
translations.en: Japanese colonizers continuously shipped mining resources of Taiwan such as coal and oil to Japan, making Taiwan the exclusive resource supply base of Japan.

translations.zh: 图为基隆以东约60公里的金瓜石矿山。
translations.en: The photo shows Jinguashi Mine, located about 60 kilometers east of Keelung.

translations.zh: 日本殖民者对台湾的山林和耕地进行掠夺性开发，利用台湾优良的农业生产条件，为日本提供粮食。
translations.en: Japanese colonizers plundered Taiwan's farmland and exploited the island's superior agricultural conditions to meet its domestic needs.

translations.zh: 图为大批台湾米在基隆港装运上船，准备运往日本。
translations.en: The photo shows a large quantity of Taiwanese rice being loaded onto a ship at Keelung Port ready to be transported to Japan.

translations.zh: 第三单元辛亥革命影响下的台湾革命活动辛亥革命爆发前后，虽台湾已被割让，但台湾同胞始终把台湾的前途命运与祖国大陆的前途命运紧紧联系在一起，积极支持并参与辛亥革命。
translations.en: Section 3 Revolutionary Activities in Taiwan Under the Influence of the Revolution of 1911 Despite the fact that Taiwan had been ceded to Japan around the time of the Revolution of 1911,Taiwan compatriots always linked their own future and destiny with those of the Chinese mainland,actively supporting and participating in the revolution.

translations.zh: 而辛亥革命的胜利，也鼓舞了台湾同胞的革命斗志，以罗福星等为代表的台湾同胞先后加入同盟会，对日本殖民统治者展开了各种形式的反抗。
translations.en: The victory of the Revolution of 1911 further boosted the revolutionary morale of Taiwan compatriots.Those represented by Luo Fuxing joined the Chinese Revolutionary League one after another, launching resistance against Japanese colonizers in different forms.

translations.zh: 第二单元精里大新雅林武装反抗和三十日本殖民统治和日军攻陷台湾后，台湾人民绝不屈服，继续武装反抗日本殖民统治。
translations.en: Section 2 Armed Resistance Against Japanese Colonial Rule of Taiwan In the wake of armed resistance against Japanese colonial rule in organized, underground, and guerilla ways, with indigenous peoples writing a glorious chapter in the process.

translations.zh: 台湾民众的抗日武装开始以团体化、地下化、游击化的方式出现，台湾少数民族在抗击日本侵略的过程中也谱写了光辉的篇章。
translations.en: Despite brutal suppression by the Japanese colonial authority, Taiwan people's form of armed resistance continued in relentless waves.

translations.zh: 第四部分台湾同胞顽强反抗侵略压迫第一次世界大战后，受五四运动的影响，台湾的民族资产阶级和知识分子开始发动并领导了反日民族运动，抵制日本的文化殖民，与日本殖民统治者进行保存中华文化的斗争。
translations.en: PART IV Unyielding Resistance: Taiwan Compatriots' Indomitable Struggle Against Invasion and Oppression After the outbreak of World War I, under the influence of the May 4th Movement, the national bourgeoisie and intellectuals in Taiwan initiated and led the movement against Japanese aggression, resisting cultural colonization and struggling against Japanese colonial rulers to preserve the culture of the Chinese nation.

translations.zh: 中国共产党始终关注台湾的前途命运，心系台湾同胞的利益福祉，早在成立之初就积极培育台湾革命力量，指导帮助台湾同胞开展反抗日本殖民统治的斗争。
translations.en: The Communist Party of China (CPC) has always been concerned about the future and destiny of Taiwan, caring deeply for the well-being and interests of its people. Since its very inception, the CPC has actively nurtured revolutionary forces in Taiwan, providing guidance and support to compatriots in Taiwan in their struggle against Japanese colonial rule.

translations.zh: 第一单元台湾同胞不屈不挠反抗压迫
translations.en: Section 1 Taiwan Compatriots' Unyielding Resistance Against Oppression

translations.zh: 日本侵占台湾后，以林献堂、蒋渭水为首的知识分子和民族资产阶级，发起“台湾议会设置请愿运动”，并相继成立台湾文化协会、台湾民众党。
translations.en: Following Japan's occupation of Taiwan, intellectuals and national bourgeoisie under the leadership of Lin Xiantang and Chiang Wei-shui initiated the “petition movement for the establishment of a Taiwan parliament", and established the Taiwan Cultural Association and the Taiwan People's Party.

translations.zh: 随着启蒙运动的发展，台湾的农工运动也开展起来。
translations.en: With the development of the enlightenment movement, the peasant and worker movements in Taiwan also emerged.

translations.zh: 一批台湾知识分子，批判日本殖民当局的同化政策，为激发台湾民众的民族意识、鼓舞台湾民众的革命热情作出了重要贡献。
translations.en: A group of Taiwan intellectuals rose to criticize the assimilation policies of Japanese colonial authorities, playing a vital role in stimulating national consciousness and revolutionary enthusiasm among the Taiwan people.

translations.zh: 第二单元中国共产党支持和推动中国共产党与台湾有着长久的历史联系。
translations.en: Section 2 The Communist Party of China Supporting and Advancing the Revolutionary Struggle in Taiwan The CPC and Taiwan had long-standing historical ties.

translations.zh: 建党之初，中国共产党就对台湾进步青年予以极大的关注和支持，并积极指导组建台湾共产党。
translations.en: From its very inception in 1921, the CPC began to pay great attention and offer strong support to the progressive youth in Taiwan, actively instructing the establishment of the Taiwan Communist Party.

translations.zh: 中国共产党鲜明提出收复台湾的主张，指出台湾的命运与中国革命的命运息息相关，开展工人运动，为台湾社会进步作出重要贡献。
translations.en: The CPC explicitly raised the proposal to recover Taiwan, claiming that the destiny of Taiwan was interconnected with that of revolution in China. Meanwhile, the CPC launched various labor movements, contributing significantly to the social progress in Taiwan.

translations.zh: 第五部分台湾抗日斗争汇入全民族抗战洪流
translations.en: PART V Uniting Against Foreign Aggression: The Resistance Struggle in Taiwan Merging into the Whole Nation's War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression

translations.zh: 抗击侵略、救亡图存成为中国各党派、各民族、各阶级、各阶层、各团体以及海外华侨华人的共同意志和行动。
translations.en: Resisting aggression and saving the nation from extinction became the common resolve and action of all political parties, ethnic groups, social classes and strata, and organizations throughout China, as well as overseas Chinese communities.

translations.zh: 在中国共产党倡导建立的抗日民族统一战线旗帜下，包括台湾同胞在内的全体中华儿女同仇敌忾、众志成城，推动台湾抗日斗争最终汇入到全民族抗战的历史洪流中，奏响了气吞山河的爱国主义壮歌。
translations.en: Under the banner of national united front against Japanese aggression initiated by the CPC, all Chinese people, including the Taiwan compatriots, rallying together to defy the enemy and standing together with unwavering solidarity, propelled the resistance struggle in Taiwan into the mighty torrent of the total resistance against Japanese aggression by the whole nation, composing a monumental epic of patriotism.

translations.zh: 第二单元全民族抗战爆发后台湾同胞的抗日斗争台湾同胞时刻关心着祖国的命运，在长期反对日本殖民统治的斗争中，他们深刻认识到台湾与祖国的命运息息相关。
translations.en: Section 2 Taiwan Compatriots' Resistance Against Japanese Aggression After the Outbreak of the Whole Nation's War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression Taiwan compatriots have always been concerned about the nation's destiny.

translations.zh: 全民族抗战爆发后，许多台湾同胞更是冲破重重阻力，回到祖国大陆直接参加抗日斗争。
translations.en: Throughout the prolonged struggle against Japanese colonial rule, they realized deeply that Taiwan's future is inextricably linked to that of the motherland.

translations.zh: 在岛内的台湾同胞面对日本殖民者的高压并没有屈服，用各种方式进行抵制和斗争。
translations.en: Following the outbreak of the whole nation's War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression, many Taiwan compatriots overcame numerous obstacles to return to the mainland and join the resistance directly. Those who remained on the island refused to yield to the harsh repression of Japanese colonial rule, resisting enemy and struggling in various forms.

translations.zh: 第一单元抗日民族统战线旗帜下大陆各界对台湾同胞抗日斗争的支持
translations.en: Section 1 Support from Different Sectors of the Chinese Mainland on Taiwan Compatriots' Resistance Against Japanese Aggression Under the Banner of Chinese United Front Against Japanese Aggression

translations.zh: 在民族危亡的历史关头，中国共产党高举抗日民族统一战线旗帜，坚定不移推动全民族坚持抗战、团结、进步，大陆各界与台湾同胞携手一道投入到抵抗侵略、争取民族独立的抗日战争中，无数仁人志士前仆后继，不懈奋斗，甚至献出了自己宝贵的生命。
translations.en: At the critical juncture in history when the survival of the Chinese nation was at stake, the CPC held nationwide unity and progress in the War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression. Together with compatriots in Taiwan, people on the Chinese mainland joined hands in resisting the invaders and in the struggle for national independence. Countless patriots persevered in their struggle, and even sacrificed their precious lives.

translations.zh: 第六部分光复中华民族取得抗日战争的伟大胜利经过全体中华儿女的艰苦抗战，中国人民取得了抗日战争的伟大胜利，遭受日本殖民统治达50年的台湾回到祖国怀抱，彻底粉碎了日本军国主义殖民奴役中国的图谋，有力捍卫了国家主权和领土完整，彻底洗刷了近代以来抗击外来侵略屡战屡败的民族耻辱，开启了古老中国凤凰涅槃、浴火重生的历史新征程。
translations.en: PART VI Restoration of Taiwan: The Chinese Nation Achieved a Great Victory in the War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression The Chinese nation achieved the great victory in the War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression through the arduous struggle of all the Chinese people, marking Taiwan, which had suffered under 50 years of Japanese colonial rule, returned to the motherland.

translations.zh: 台湾光复是包括台湾同胞在内全体中国人民前赴后继、浴血奋战铸就的伟大胜利，无可辩驳地证明台湾是中国领土不可分割的一部分。
translations.en: This great triumph crushed the plot of the Japanese militarists to colonize and enslave China, safeguarded China's national sovereignty and territorial integrity, put an end to China's national humiliation of suffering successive defeats at the hands of foreign aggressors in modern times,and set the ancient country on a new journey after gaining rebirth.

translations.zh: 第一单元抗战胜利与台湾回归祖国
translations.en: Section 1 Victory in the War of Resistance and Taiwan's Return to the Motherland

translations.zh: 1945年8月15日，日本宣布无条件投降，同年10月25日，中国政府在台湾举行受降仪式。
translations.en: On August 15th,1945, Japan declared its unconditional surrender.On October 25th of the same year,the acceptance ceremony was held by the Chinese government in Taiwan.

translations.zh: 中国政府在台湾设立行政长官公署，恢复台湾的行省地位。
translations.en: The Chinese government set the Chief Executive Office in Taiwan, restoring Taiwan's provincial status.

translations.zh: 通过一系列具有国际法效力的文件，中国从法律和事实上收复了台湾。
translations.en: Through a series of documents with international legal effect, China restored Taiwan de jure and de facto.

source.title_zh: 第二单元两岸同庆台湾光复
source.title_en: Section 2 Compatriots on Both Sides of the Taiwan Strait Celebrate Taiwan's Restoration

translations.zh: 台湾光复一举洗雪了中国在甲午战争中遭受的巨大屈辱，这是中国人民抗日战争的伟大成果，是包括台湾同胞在内的全体中华儿女团结奋斗的伟大成果，是全民族的骄傲。
translations.en: The restoration of Taiwan wiped out the profound humiliation China suffered in the Sino-Japanese War of 1894-1895. This great achievement was not only a monumental outcome of the Chinese People's War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression,but also a triumph of the united struggle of all the Chinese people, including Taiwan compatriots. It remains a source of immense pride for the entire nation.

source.title_zh: 第二单元两岸同庆台湾光复
source.title_en: Section 2 Compatriots on Both Sides of the Taiwan Strait Celebrate Taiwan's Restoration

translations.zh: 中国军民举国欢腾，两岸共同欢庆，从此被日本占领50年的台湾重回祖国怀抱。
translations.en: Chinese soldiers and civilians across the nation erupted in jubilation, with compatriots on both sides of the Taiwan Strait joining in celebration.This marked the return of Taiwan, which had been occupied by Japan for 50 years,to the embrace of the motherland.

translations.zh: 第五单元共产党抗战感召世人
translations.en: Section 5 The CPC-Led Resistance Against Japanese Aggression Inspired People Worldwide

translations.zh: 中国共产党领导的敌后抗战赢得广泛赞誉。
translations.en: The CPC-led War of Resistance behind enemy lines won widespread acclaim.

translations.zh: 延安成为进步青年向往的革命圣地，民主人士、国民党将领、爱国华侨、国际友人接连来到抗日根据地，共同见证中国共产党在敌后战场作出的巨大贡献。
translations.en: Yan'an became the revolutionary sacred land that progressive youth yearned for.Democrats, Kuomintang generals, patriotic overseas Chinese and international friends came in succession to the resistance bases,jointly witnessing the great contributions made by the Communist Party of China on the battlefields behind enemy lines.

translations.zh: 1938年9月29日至11月6日，中国共产党扩大的六届六中全会在延安召开，会议把建立与台湾人民的反对侵略战争的统一战线作为全中华民族当前的紧急任务之一。
translations.en: From September 29th to November 6th, 1938, the enlarged Sixth Plenary Session of the Sixth CPC Central Committee was held in Yan'an.

translations.zh: 图为大会主席团成员合影。
translations.en: The session regarded establishing the united front against Japanese aggression with Taiwan compatriots as one of the most urgent priorities of the Chinese nation.

translations.zh: 加余大朝野热烈狱迎中退进犯之澈蒋夫人在加國食演説力康民主就治培签人润更高水堂同为中国员民抗吸痘老整总保大我德攻公安以化發禅空戳美以少滕敏的三分之台湾·同到机國求国外突的冠果武中规定一台别
translations.en: The photo shows members of the presidium.

translations.zh: 《新华日报》多次发表社论，呼吁台湾人民参加抗战、早日收复台湾。
translations.en: The Xinhua Daily repeatedly published editorials calling on Taiwan people to join the War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression and early achieve the recovery.

translations.zh: 图为1943年6月17日《新华日报》社论《台湾，回到祖国来！》
translations.en: The image shows the newspaper's editorial titled Taiwan, Return to the Motherland on June 17th, 1943.

translations.zh: 1940年4月，国民参政会中共代表董必武代表中国共产党联合部分民主党派、民主人士提议：“我与敌（日本）为交战国，应即宣布《马关条约》无效，认台湾亦在应收复之失地范围。”
translations.en: In April 1940, at the National Political Council, Dong Biwu, representing the Communist Party of China, together with certain democratic parties and figures, put in a proposal: "Since China is at war with Japan, the Treaty of Shimonoseki should be declared null and void immediately, and Taiwan should be recognized as the lost territories to be recovered."

translations.zh: 图为董必武。
translations.en: The photo shows Dong Biwu.

translations.zh: 1939年春，周恩来到浙江视察抗日工作时，研究了台湾义勇队的相关情况，并指导义勇队的具体工作。
translations.en: In the spring of 1939, Zhou Enlai learned about the work of Taiwan Volunteer Corps and gave instructions to the corps on its specific operation when he visited Zhejiang to inspect the resistance efforts there.

translations.zh: 图为抗战时期的周恩来。
translations.en: The photo shows Zhou Enlai in the period of the War of Resistance.

translations.zh: 1938年4月1日，中国国民党临时全国代表大会在武汉举行，会议明确表示中国政府要收复台湾。
translations.en: On April 1st, 1938, the KMT Provisional National Congress was held in Wuhan.

translations.zh: 图为大会会址国立武汉大学。
translations.en: The meeting clearly stated that the Chinese government would recover Taiwan.

translations.zh: 第四部分战略支撑法西斯称霸世界的画谋
translations.en: PART 4 China's Arduous Struggle Against Japanese Aggression Provided Strategic Support for Smashing Fascists' Plot to Dominate the World

translations.zh: 中国人民抗日战争，是世界反法西斯战争的重要组成部分。
translations.en: The Chinese People's War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression constituted a vital part of the World Anti-Fascist War.

translations.zh: 中国战场是抗击日本法西斯侵略的主战场，也是世界反法西斯战争的东方主战场。
translations.en: The Chinese battlefield was the main battlefield resisting Japanese fascist aggression and also the main Eastern Theater of the World Anti-Fascist War.

translations.zh: 中国以长期抗战牵制和消耗了日本的大量军力，打乱了日本既定战略意图，减轻了苏、美、英等国的压力。
translations.en: Through prolonged resistance, China tied down and expended a great deal of Japanese military force, disrupted Japan's established strategic plans and relieved pressure on the Soviet Union, the United States, the United Kingdom and other countries.

translations.zh: 太平洋战争爆发后，中国战场仍然抗击着日本陆军主力和部分海空力量，在战略上策应和支持了盟军其他战场的作战，为世界反法西斯战争胜利作出了重大贡献。
translations.en: Even after the outbreak of the Pacific War, the Chinese battlefield continued to fight against the main Japanese ground forces and parts of its naval and air forces strategically coordinating with and supporting the allied operations on other fronts, thereby making a significant contribution to the victory of the World Anti-Fascist War.

translations.zh: 台湾同胞半个世纪的抗日斗争，是近代中国人民反抗外来侵略、争取民族解放的重要组成部分。
translations.en: Taiwan compatriots' half-century resistance against Japanese aggression constitutes a vital chapter in the Chinese people's resistance against foreign invasion and the fight for national liberation in modern times.

translations.zh: 台湾是中国一部分、两岸同属一个中国的历史和法理事实，是任何人任何势力都无法改变的！
translations.en: Taiwan is an inalienable part of China, Both sides of the Taiwan Strait belong to one China, The historical and juridical fact is beyond change by any force or individual.

translations.zh: 两岸同胞都是中国人，血浓于水、守望相助的天然情感和民族认同，是任何人任何势力都无法改变的！
translations.en: Compatriots on both sides of the Taiwan Strait are all Chinese, who are connected by blood and remain committed to mutual assistance.

translations.zh: 新时代新征程，我们要以习近平新时代中国特色社会主义思想为指引，团结两岸同胞在内的全体中华儿女努力奋斗，推动两岸统一的航船驶向胜利的彼岸，共创中华民族伟大复兴的美好未来！
translations.en: This natural kinship and national identity is beyond change by anyone or any force!

translations.zh: 第三单元正面战场对日作战和中国远征军入缅作战中国军队继续在正面战场上对日作战。
translations.en: Section 3 China's Resistance Against Japanese Aggression on the Center Stage Battlefields and the Chinese Expeditionary Force's Fight in Burma The Chinese army continued to fight against Japanese troops on the center stage battlefields.

translations.zh: 太平洋战争爆发后，应英方的请求，中国派遣远征军紧急入缅支援英军对日作战，为世界反法西斯战争作出了重要贡献。
translations.en: After the outbreak of the Pacific War, at the request of the British side, China urgently dispatched an expeditionary force to support the British army in fighting against Japanese troops in Burma, making significant contributions to the World Anti-Fascist War.

translations.zh: 第四单元中国为盟国作战提供有力支持在世界反法西斯战争中，中国作为亚洲太平洋地区盟国对日作战的重要战略基地，为同盟国对日作战提供空军基地、军事情报等重要保障，在人力、物力、财力上支援了同盟国的反法西斯斗争。
translations.en: Section 4 China's Strong Support for Allied Operations During the World Anti-Fascist War, China served as a crucial strategic base for Allied operations against Japan in the Asia-Pacific theater.

translations.zh: 第五部分 罄竹难书日本侵略者的法西斯暴行
translations.en: PART5 Japanese Invaders Committed Numerous Fascist Atrocities

translations.zh: 日本法西斯惨无人道的侵略行径，给中国人民和广大亚洲国家人民带来了惨绝人寰的灾难。
translations.en: The atrocious crimes committed by Japanese fascist invaders brought untold disasters to the people in China and other Asian countries.

translations.zh: 日本军国主义在侵华战争期间大肆使用各种残暴手段，对中国人民进行骇人听闻的屠杀、迫害、奴役、掠夺和摧残。
translations.en: During their invasion of China, Japanese militarists wantonly used all kinds of brutal means to massacre, persecute, enslave, plunder and suppress the Chinese people.

translations.zh: 中国城乡战火连绵、硝烟四起，中国人民生灵涂炭、苦难深重，中国大地赤地千里、饿殍遍野。
translations.en: The smoke of warfare swept across both urban and rural areas of China, bringing tremendous sufferings to the Chinese people.

translations.zh: 第二单元日军领中国共产党领导敌后军民坚持抗战抗击侵华日军主力约3340万侵华日军。
translations.en: Section 2 Japanese: The CPC Led Troops and Civilians Behind Enemy Lines to Resist Japanese Aggression, Combating the Main Force of the Japanese Army.

translations.zh: 在发动太平洋战争前后，为解除南进的后顾之忧，对敌后抗日根据地进行了大规模的“扫荡”、“蚕食”和“清乡”。
translations.en: From 1941 to 1942, the Japanese Around the start of the Pacific War, Japan, in order to eliminate concerns about its southward advance, launched operations against the resistance bases behind enemy lines.

translations.zh: 在极为严峻的形势下，广大军民不屈不挠，前仆后继，克服严重困难，实行“敌进我进”方针，展开艰苦卓绝的反“扫荡”、反“蚕食”、反“清乡”斗争，陷敌于人民战争的汪洋大海，牵制和歼灭了大量日军，有力地配合与策应了其他战场1941年至1942年的作战。
translations.en: In this extremely severe situation, the broad masses of soldiers and civilians persevered indomitably, one after another, overcoming severe difficulties.

translations.zh: 第一单元制造大量居杀与迫害惨案侵华日军灭绝人性地使用各种残暴手段，对中国人民进行大规模、有组织的屠杀，制造了大量屠城屠村的血腥惨案。
translations.en: Section1 Extensive Massacres and Persecutions The Japanese troops employed inhumane and brutal methods to conduct large-scale, organized massacres of the Chinese people, leaving a trail of blood-soaked tragedies in their wake.

translations.zh: 在震惊中外的南京大屠杀中，30万以上的中国军民惨遭杀害。
translations.en: During the Nanjing Massacre, an atrocity that shocked the world, over 300,000 Chinese civilians and soldiers were brutally killed.

translations.zh: 为摧毁中国军民的抗战意志和生存条件，日军推行野蛮的烧光、杀光、抢光的“三光”政策，在各地实施无差别轰炸，给中国人民的生命财产造成重大损失。
translations.en: To crush the Chinese people's resistance efforts and destroy their means of survival, the Japanese burn all, loot all and carried out indiscriminate bombings across the country, causing tremendous loss of life and property for the Chinese people.

translations.zh: 第二单元摧残妇女儿童在侵华战争期间，日本侵略者对中国妇女儿童的残害，是其对中国人民所犯严重罪行之一。
translations.en: Section2 and Children The brutal abuse of Chinese women and children by Japanese of the serious crimes they committed against the Chinese stations" in various parts of China, and a large number of Chinese women were forced to serve as sexual slaves persecution,

translations.zh: 无数中国儿童惨遭日军的摧残和杀害
translations.en: Countless Chinese children were abused and killed by Japanese troops,

translations.zh: 第三单元掠夺与奴役日本侵略者实行“以战养战”政策，大肆劫掠中国民众财物，疯狂掠夺战略资源；大肆摧残中国文化，掠夺、摧毁文物和典籍，给中国文化造成难以挽回的巨大损失；在占领区大肆开展奴化教育和政治欺骗，实行高压统治，妄图泯灭中国人民的民族意识和反抗精神；利用毒品对中国民众进行精神和肉体摧残，削弱和瓦解中国民众斗争意志。
translations.en: Section 3 Pillage and Enslavement to sustain war, wantonly looting the property of the Chinese people and frantically plundering strategic resources.

translations.zh: 第四单元强掠与虐杀中国劳工日军在占领区实施“强制劳动政策，到处掳掠、抓捕中国劳工，强制从事军事工程、筑路、开矿、拓荒和大型土建工程等劳役，进行非人虐待，大批劳工被虐杀。
translations.en: Section 4 Kidnapping and Killing of Chinese Laborers The Japanese army implemented the policy of "forced labor" laborers everywhere and forced them to work in military projects, road construction, mining, wasteland reclamation, and large-scale civil engineering projects.

translations.zh: 中国劳工遭受了残酷的奴役和迫害
translations.en: Those victims of forced labor suffered inhuman abuse and torture, with many being killed.

translations.zh: 1932年1月，日本海军陆战队司令部在上海虹口选择了“大一沙龙”等日本人开设的风俗店，慰安所作为海军的指定“慰安所”。
translations.en: In January 1932, the Japanese Naval Landing Forces Department selected Japanese-operated brothels such as “Daichi Salon" in Hongkou, Shanghai, as designated"comfort stations"for the navy.

translations.zh: 图为“大一沙龙”旧址。
translations.en: The photo shows the former site of the "Daichi Salon".

translations.zh: 于1938年1月，日军在上海杨家宅开设的军部直营“慰安所”第1号。
translations.en: The first military-operated "comfort station" established by the Japanese military in January 1938 at Yangjiazhai, Shanghai.

translations.zh: 日军发动侵华战争后，在中国各地设立大量“慰安所”，强迫中国和朝鲜等国妇女充当日军性奴隶，形成了丑陋的“慰安妇”制度。
translations.en: After launching the war of aggression against China, the Japanese military established a large number of "comfort stations" across China, coercing women from China, Korea, and other countries into becoming sexual slaves for the Japanese soldiers, giving rise to the criminal"comfort women" system.

translations.zh: 图为日本陆军省关于在中国设立“慰安所”的通告。
translations.en: The photo shows a notification from the Japanese Army Ministry regarding the establishment of "comfort stations"in China.

translations.zh: 第五单元实施生化武器战日本侵略者公然违反国际法，在中国占领区和日本国内进行大规模生化武器研制，并组建作战部队；在侵华战争中使用生化武器，进行罪恶的细菌战与化学战，造成中国军民大量伤亡
translations.en: Section 5 Implementing Biological and Chemical Warfare Japanese invaders openly violated international law by conducting large-scale research and development of biological and chemical weapons both in occupied Chinese territories and in Japan, and forming combat units.

translations.zh: 第六单元日本在亚洲其他地区的法西斯暴行日军在菲律宾、新加坡、缅甸等亚洲地区进行残暴的统治、虐杀、迫害和摧残，这些残酷暴行给当地人民带来了深重的灾难。
translations.en: Section 6 Japanese Fascist Atrocities in Other Regions of Asia The Japanese army carried out brutal ruling, killing, persecution, and oppression in Asian countries such as the Philippines, Singapore, and Burma. These cruel atrocities brought grave sufferings to local people.

translations.zh: 第一单元世界反法西斯统一战线的建立
translations.en: Section 1 The Establishment of the World Anti-Fascist United Front

translations.zh: 1939年欧洲战争爆发后，德、意法西斯疯狂扩张。
translations.en: The Outbreak After Europe went into war in 1939, German and Italian fascists sought military expansions rampantly.

translations.zh: 1941年苏德战争爆发。
translations.en: In 1941, the Soviet-German War broke out, and Japanese fascists invaded OnSeptember1,1939,Germanyinv southwards and launched the Pacific War.

translations.zh: 日本法西斯实行南进，发动太平洋战争。
translations.en: By the time, had lasted for a decade.

translations.zh: 此时，中国独立抗战已持续十年之久。
translations.en: The status of the Chinese battlefield as the main battlefield for fighting against Japan, as well as the strong determination and long-term resistance of the Chinese people, made China an important nation in the World Anti-Fascist War.

translations.zh: 中国战场对日作战的主战场地位、中国人民的抗战决心和长期抗战行动，使中国成为世界反法西斯战争的重要国家。
translations.en: Throughout the World Anti-Fascist War, China always advocated and promoted the establishment of the world anti-fascist united front.

translations.zh: 在世界反法西斯战争中，中国始终积极倡导和推动建立世界反法西斯统一战线。
translations.en: In January 1942, the anti- fascist countries signed the Declaration by United Nations, officially signaling the formation of the world anti-fascist united front.

translations.zh: 第六部分得道多助人民对中国抗战的支持
translations.en: PART 6 Chinese People's War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression Received Extensive Support from Peoples Upholding Justice Globally

translations.zh: 中国人民抗日战争是反侵略的正义战争，从一开始就具有拯救人类文明、保卫世界和平的重大意义。
translations.en: The Chinese People's War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression is a righteous struggle against foreign invasion and has been significant for safeguarding human civilization and defending world peace since its very onset.

translations.zh: 中国人民抗日战争为世界反法西斯战争作出了重大贡献，中国人民赢得了世界爱好和平人民的尊敬，中华民族赢得了崇高的民族声誉。
translations.en: The Chinese People's War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression contributed significantly to the world anti-Fascist War.

translations.zh: 世界上爱好和平与正义的国家和人民、国际组织等各种反法西斯力量，也给予中国人民抗日战争以宝贵援助和支持。
translations.en: The Chinese people won the respect of peace-loving peoples around the world, and the Chinese nation earned a lofty reputation.

translations.zh: 1944年10月，山东高密县农民刘连仁被日军强掳到日本北海道明治矿业株式会社昭和矿业所当苦力。
translations.en: In October 1944, Liu Lianren, a farmer from Gaomi County, Shandong Province, was forcibly taken to the Showa Mining Company of Meiji Mining Corporation in Hokkaido, Japan, to work as a laborer.

translations.zh: 1945年7月30日，由于不堪忍受奴役和虐待，刘连仁逃至深山，在山洞中过了13年的非人生活。
translations.en: On July 30, 1945, unable to endure slavery and abuse, Liu Lianren fled to the mountains, living in a cave for 13 years under inhumane conditions.

translations.zh: 图为1958年刘连仁被发现时的情景。
translations.en: The photo shows the scene when Liu Lianren was discovered in 1958.

translations.zh: 日本不仅将中国人强掳到本土无偿役使，还将大批劳工抓到其南洋占领地充当苦力。
translations.en: Japan not only forcibly exploited Chinese laborers in Japan but also captured a large number of people to work as laborers in its occupied territories in Southeast Asia.

translations.zh: 1943年8月，江苏吴江盛泽镇人施方舟在家乡被日军抓捕，随后施方舟等1500余名中国人被送至巴布亚新几内亚服苦役。
translations.en: In August 1943, Shi Fangzhou, a resident of Shengze Town, Wujiang, Jiangsu Province, was captured by the Japanese army in his hometown.

translations.zh: 日本投降后仅幸存700余人。
translations.en: Shi Fangzhou and more than 1,500 other Chinese people were subsequently sent to Papua New Guinea as forced laborer.

translations.zh: 第一单元苏联对华援助和军事合作苏联是中国人民抗日战争的主要支持者之一。
translations.en: Section 1 The Soviet Union's Assistance to China and Military Cooperation The Soviet Union was one of the main supporters of the Chinese People's War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression.

translations.zh: 九一八事变后，苏联在道义上同情和支持中国抗战，采取了较积极的对华方针。
translations.en: After the September 18th Incident in 1931, the Soviet Union sympathized with and supported China's war of resistance, and adopted a relatively proactive China policy.

translations.zh: 1937年8月，中国与苏联签订《中苏互不侵犯条约》。
translations.en: In August 1937, China and the Soviet Union signed the Treaty of Non-Aggression.

translations.zh: 之后，苏联政府向中国提供贷款和军用物资，并派遣空军志愿队与中国空军并肩作战，200多名苏联志愿飞行员献出了宝贵生命。
translations.en: Subsequently, the Soviet government extended loans and military supplies to China and dispatched the Soviet Volunteer Group to fight alongside the Chinese Air Force.

translations.zh: 日军围捕、强抓中国劳工。
translations.en: Japanese troops rounding up and forcibly capturing Chinese laborers.

translations.zh: 日军在修筑黑龙江虎头要塞时，强迫数十万中国劳工秘密修建。
translations.en: During the construction of Hutou Fortress in Heilongjiang by the Japanese army.

translations.zh: 日军在修筑黑龙江东宁军事要塞时，强制役使大批中国劳工修筑虎头要塞，无数劳工遭到奴役和杀害。
translations.en: hundreds of thousands During the construction of Dongning Military Fortress in Heilongjiang by the Japanese army.

translations.zh: 图为虎头要塞“亚洲第一巨炮”遗址的炮座坑。
translations.en: a Chinese laborers were forced to secretly build Hutou Fortress, and countless workers were enslaved and killed.

translations.zh: 许多劳工在工程结束后被日军秘密杀害。
translations.en: The photo shows the gun base pit of the "Asia's First Giant Cannon" site at Hutou Fortress.

translations.zh: 图为东宁要塞内景。
translations.en: the Japanese army after the project was completed. The photo shows the interior of Dongning Fortress.

translations.en: On November 25, 1935, Japan supported traitor Yin Rugeng in establishing the puppet Eastern Hebei Anti-Communism Autonomous Committee in Tongxian County, later renamed “Eastern Hebei Anti- Communism Autonomous Government."

translations.zh: 1935年6月15日，中华苏维埃共和国中央政东北反日总会印发的《为华北事变告东北同胞书》府、中国工农红军革命军事委员会发布《为反对日本并吞华北和蒋介石卖国宣言》，号召驱逐日本帝国主义出中国。
translations.en: On June 15, 1935, the Central Government of the Chinese Soviet Republic and the Revolutionary Military Committee of the Chinese Workers and Peasants' Red Army issued the “Declaration Against Japan's Annexation of North China and Chiang Kai-shek's Betrayal of the Nation.
