source.title_en: The North China Incident and the December 9th Movement

translations.zh: 日军在华北举行大规模军事演习
translations.en: Japanese troops conducting large-scale military exercises in North China.

translations.zh: 第二单元美国对华援助和军事合作太平洋战争爆发后，美国逐步加强对华援助，除对中国进行经济援助外，还积极同中国进行军事合作，组建志愿援华航空队（飞虎队）来华参战，参与开辟驼峰航线，向中国运送急需物资
translations.en: Section2 U.S. Assistance to China and Military Cooperation After the outbreak of the Pacific War, the United States gradually strengthened its aid to China.

translations.zh: 第七部分伟大胜利向复兴中华民族走的历更转折点
translations.en: PART 7 Great Victory A Historic Turning Point in the Great Rejuvenation of the Chinese Nation

translations.zh: 经过14年浴血奋战，中国人民打败了日本侵略者，宣告了日本军国主义的彻底失败，宣告了中国人民抗日战争和世界反法西斯战争的最后胜利。
translations.en: After 14 years of bloody resistance, the Chinese people defeated the Japanese aggressors, marking the complete failure of Japanese militarism and the ultimate victory of both the Chinese People's War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression and the World Anti-Fascist War.

translations.zh: 这个伟大胜利，彻底粉碎了日本军国主义殖民奴役中国的图谋，重新确立了中国在世界上的大国地位，坚定了中国人民追求民族独立、自由、解放的意志，开启了古老中国凤凰涅躲、浴火重生的历史新征程。
translations.en: This monumental victory completely shattered Japan's militarist scheme to colonize and enslave China, reestablished China's standing as a major world power, steeled the Chinese people's resolve to pursue national independence, freedom and liberation and marked the phoenix-like rebirth of an ancient civilization through fire and blood, heralding a new historical journey.

translations.zh: 第二单元中国国际地位的显著提高
translations.en: Section 2 China's Notable Rise in International Standing

translations.zh: 中国战场对日作战的主战场地位、中国人民的抗战决心和长期抗战行动，使中国国际地位显著提高。
translations.en: China theater's position as the primary theater in the resistance against Japan, the resistance resolve of Chinese people as well as the long-sustained resistance campaigns improved China's international standing significantly.

translations.zh: 中国参与发起创建联合国，成为安理会常任理事国之一
translations.en: As the founding member of the United Nations, China has become a permanent member of the Security Council.

translations.zh: 第一单元中国战场转入战略反攻随着苏德战场、北非战场和太平洋战场取得重大胜利，世界反法西斯战争发生根本性转折。
translations.en: Section 1 Chinese Theater Shifting to Strategic Counter-Offensive Stage As the Soviet-German, North Africa, and Pacific Theaters achieved decisive victories, the World Anti-Fascist War reached a fundamental turning point.

translations.zh: 在此有利形势下，中国战场于1943年秋季起逐步转入战略反攻。
translations.en: Capitalizing on this favorable momentum, the Chinese Theater gradually transitioned into a strategic counter-offensive stage from autumn 1943 onward.

translations.zh: 中国驻印军与中国远征军分别于1943年10月、1944年5月开始缅北、滇西反攻。
translations.en: In October 1943 and May 1944,the Chinese Army in India and the Chinese Expeditionary Force launched counter-offensives in northern Burma and western Yunnan, China respectively.

translations.zh: 1944年至1945年春夏，中国共产党领导人民军队在敌后战场发起连续不断的攻势作战，为转入全面反攻创造了重要条件。
translations.en: From 1944 to the spring and summer of 1945,the people's army under the leadership of the Communist Party of China launched relentless offensive operations in behind-the-enemy battlefields,paving the way for an all-out counter-offensive.

translations.zh: 日本侵略者走向全面失败已成定局。
translations.en: By this stage, it became inevitable that the Japanese aggressors would be totally defeated.

translations.zh: 中国人民在艰苦抗战中赢得了世界人民的尊敬，国际地位得到提高。
translations.en: The Chinese people won respect from the rest of the world in their arduous war of resistance, enhancing China's international status.

translations.zh: 日本在亚洲的不断扩张，严重侵害着美、英的权益，他们希望中国坚持抵抗，牵制住日军的主力。
translations.en: Japan's continuous expansion in Asia seriously infringed on the rights and interests of the United States and Britain, and they hoped that China would persist in resistance and contain the main force of the Japanese army.

translations.zh: 图为1943年1月11日，中美两国代表在华盛顿签订新约。
translations.en: The picture shows representatives of China and the United States signing a new treaty in Washington D.C. on January 11, 1943.

translations.zh: 1943年1月11日，中英两国代表在重庆签订新约。
translations.en: On January 11, 1943, representatives of China and the United Kingdom signed a new treaty in Chongqing.

translations.zh: 第三单元世界各国人民和国际组织支援中国抗战中国人民抗日战争得到世界上爱好和平与正义的各国人民、国际组织的广泛同情和支援。
translations.en: Section 3 China Support from the People of the World and International Organizations in the Chinese People's War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression armwelcome.

translations.zh: 国际社会纷纷抗议和谴责日本帝国主义侵略中国，从政治上、道义上声援中国抗战，对中国抗战给予了宝贵援助和支持。
translations.en: The Chinese People's War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression received widespread sympathy and support from all the peace- and justice-loving peoples and international organizations.

translations.zh: 许多国际友人来到延安，深入中国战场各地，或作为新闻记者到前线和根据地采访报道，或参加医疗队救治伤病员，或开展抗日宣传活动，或直接参加对日作战，不少人为此献出了宝贵生命。
translations.en: The international community strongly condemned and protested against Japanese imperialist aggression in China, offering both political and moral support along with various forms of aid.

translations.zh: 第四单元中国抗战转入全面反攻日本无条件投降日投降。
translations.en: Section IV: Chinese People's War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression Shifted to the All-Out Counter-Offensive Japan Announced Unconditional Surrender Potsdam

translations.zh: 随着世界反法西斯战争的胜利推进，1945年8月9日，毛泽东发表《对日寇的最后一战》的声明。
translations.en: As the World Anti-Fascist War victoriously advanced, Mao Zedong issued a statement titled The Last Round of the War Against the Japanese Invaders on August 9,1945.

translations.zh: 随后，延安总部发布七道反攻命令。
translations.en: Subsequently, the Yan'an headquarters delivered seven counter-offensive orders in succession,

translations.zh: 中国抗日战争进入全面反攻阶段。
translations.en: marking that the Chinese People's War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression entered the stage of all-out counter-offensive.

translations.zh: 1945年8月15日，日本宣布无条件投降。
translations.en: On August 15,1945,Japan announced unconditional surrender.

translations.zh: 9月2日，日本签字投降。
translations.en: On September 2,Japan formally signed the instrument of surrender.

translations.zh: 中国人民抗日战争和世界反法西斯战争取得最后胜利。
translations.en: Such indicates that Chinese People's War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression and the World Anti-Fascist War secured the final victory.

translations.zh: 第三单元中共七大与争取抗战胜利1945年4月21945年4月至6月，中国共产党第七次全国代表大会在延安召开，总结中国革命曲折发展的历史经验，制定了正确的纲领和策略，提出了“放手发动群众，壮大人民力量，在我党的领导下，打败日本侵略者，解放全国人民，建立一个新民主主义的中国”的政治路线，把毛泽东思想确立为党的指导思想，使全党在思想上政治上组织上达到空前统一和团结，为夺取抗日战争的最后胜利和新民主主义革命在全国的胜利奠定了坚实基础。
translations.en: Section 3 The 7th CPC National Congress and struggles for the Victory of the War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression From April 23 to June From April to June 1945, the 7th CPC National Congress was held in Yan'an.

translations.zh: 第五单元欢庆胜利中国人民抗日战争的伟大胜利，谱写了中华民族不屈不挠抵抗外来侵略的壮丽史诗，彻底洗刷了近代以后中国屡遭外来侵略的民族耻辱，极大增强了中华民族的自信心和自豪感。
translations.en: Section 5 Celebrating Victory The great victory of Chinese People's War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression composed a magnificent epic of the Chinese nation's indomitable spirit in resisting foreign invasion.

translations.zh: 第六单元正义审判世界反法西斯战争胜利后，同盟国分别在德国纽伦堡和日本东京设立国际军事法庭，对德、日甲级战犯进行审判。
translations.en: Section 6 Judgement of Justice Following the allied victory of the World Anti-Fascist War, the International Military Tribunals were convened by the allied powers in Nuremberg, Germany and Tokyo, Japan respectively, to prosecute major war criminals from Germany and Japan.

translations.zh: 有关国家也对日本乙、丙级战犯进行了审判。
translations.en: Other nations concerned also conducted trials of Japanese Class-B and Class-C war criminals.

translations.zh: 1945年12月起，中国在北平、南京、上海等地设立审判日本战犯军事法庭。
translations.en: From December 1945, China set military tribunals in Beiping, Nanjing and Shanghai for trials of Japanese war criminals.

translations.zh: 1956年6月至7月，中华人民共和国最高人民法院特别军事法庭在沈阳和太原公开审判日本战犯。
translations.en: From June to July 1956, the Special Tribunal of the Supreme People's Court of the People's Republic of China publicly tried Japanese war criminals in Shenyang and Taiyuan.

translations.zh: 对战犯的审判，体现了反法西斯同盟国和世界人民的共同意志，维护了人类的正义和尊严
translations.en: Trials of war criminals reflect the common will of the allied powers and people worldwide in upholding international justice and defending human dignity

translations.zh: 第八部分铭记历史珍爱和平携手构建人类命运共同体
translations.en: PART 8 Remembering History, Cherishing Peace and Working Together to Build a Community with a Shared Future for Mankind

translations.zh: 中国人民热爱和平、珍惜和平，对战争带来的苦难有着刻骨铭心的记忆，对和平有着孜孜不倦的追求。
translations.en: The Chinese people love and cherish peace.

translations.zh: 当前，世界百年未有之大变局加速演进，以中国式现代化全面推进强国建设、民族复兴伟业进入关键时期。
translations.en: Their unforgettable memories of the sufferings brought by war urge them to persistently pursue peace.

translations.zh: 新征程上，我们将高举和平、发展、合作、共赢旗帜，奉行独立自主的和平外交政策，坚持走和平发展道路，推动构建新型国际关系，推动构建人类命运共同体。
translations.en: At present, the world is undergoing profound changes unseen in a century, and the great cause of building a great country and realizing national rejuvenation through a Chinese path to modernization has entered a critical stage.

translations.zh: 中国人民愿同世界人民携手开创人类更加美好的未来！
translations.en: On the new journey ahead, we will hold high the banner of peace, development, and win-win cooperation, pursue the independent foreign policy of peace, stick to the path of peaceful development, promote the building of a new type of international relations, and work together to build a community with a shared future for mankind.

translations.zh: 从1953年起，中国政府基于人道主义考虑，积极协助在华日侨回国。
translations.en: Since 1953, the Chinese government, out of humanitarian considerations, has actively assisted Japanese expatriates in China in returning to Japan.

translations.zh: 图为即将离开中国的日本侨民。
translations.en: The photo shows Japanese expatriates ready to leave China.

translations.zh: 1954年11月，中国红十字会代表团访日。
translations.en: In November 1954, a delegation of the Red Cross Society of China visited Japan.

translations.zh: 这是新中国成立后的第一个访日团体。
translations.en: This is the first Chinese delegation to visit Japan after the founding of the People's Republic of China.

translations.zh: 苏联空军志愿队部分援华顾问安东·阿列克塞耶维奇·古边科1938年3月至8月在华参加对日作战。
translations.en: Some of the Soviet Volunteer Group advisors aiding China.

translations.zh: 1938年5月31日，日机空袭武汉，古边科在击落2架敌机、子弹打光的情况下，撞击敌机，安全返航。
translations.en: CETOДHЯ HOMEP: Верховного АРТИЛЛЕРИЯ-КИНЖАЛ: РАДИОСТАНЦИЯ СССР И Герое Советского НА МЕЖДУНАРОДНЫЕ РАБОЧЕ-КРЕСТЬЯНСКОЙ А.КОЖЕВНИКОВ ПРАВДА СИЛА СССР ЕВРЕЙСКИЙ ОРГАН ЦЕНТРАЛЬНОГО КОМИТЕТА И МК ВКП(Б). СТАТЬЯ: ЗВЕЗДА КРИТИКА И БИБЛИОГРАФИЯ БЮРО 1-Е НОЯБРЯ 1938 г. СРЕДА ИЗДАНИЯ ИО НОМЕР ПРЕДЕСТЕ СТР.) КИТАЕ (5 стр.) -МУЗЫКАНТОВ (6 стр.) ЕКАТЕРИНА СОВЕТСКОЙ МУЗЫКИ 22-Й ПЕСНЕ УКАЗ НЕСТИ СССР ИМЕНИ ПРЕЗИДИУМА ВЕРХОВНОГО СОВЕТА СССР НОВО-МОРСКОЙ ВЕРЕЩАГИНА ЛЕНИНА: ОРДЕНОМ КРАСНОГО ЗНАМЕНИ! ПРОЦЕСС ГЕРМАНСКОГО ЯПОНСКОГО ЦЕНТРА ДЛЯ ВВЕДЕНИЯ В СИЛУ АНГЛО-ИТАЛЬЯНСКОГО ОРГАНИЗМ УКАЗ СОГЛАШЕНИЯ ПРЕЗИДИУМА ВЕРХОВНОГО СОВЕТА СССР ЗДАНИИ ГЕРОЕВ Советского СОЮЗА КОМАНДИРАМ НАВЕСТИ ДАЛЬНЕЙШИМ РАЗДЕЛ НЕКОТОРЫХ ТОРГОВЫХ On May 31, 1938, during a Japanese air raid on Wuhan, Gubenko, after shooting down two enemy aircraft and running out of ammunition, rammed his aircraft into an enemy plane, causing it to crash.

translations.zh: 1938年11月16日苏联《真理报》刊登的参加援华作战荣获“苏联英雄”称号的飞行员名单
translations.en: Despite damages, Gubenko's plane managed to return safely. On November 16, 1938, the Soviet newspaper Pravda published a list of pilots who participated in aiding China and were awarded the title of “Hero of the Soviet Union.”

translations.zh: 第二单元坚决捍卫反法西斯战争胜利成果
translations.en: Section 2 Defending the Achievements of the World Anti-Fascist War

translations.zh: 中国人民抗日战争胜利是中国人民同反法西斯同盟国以及各国人民并肩战斗的伟大胜利。
translations.en: The Chinese people won the victory of their War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression by fighting side by side with peoples from all anti-fascist countries.

translations.zh: 我们将以最大的决心和努力，同世界各国人民一道，坚决捍卫中国人民抗日战争和世界反法西斯战争胜利成果，坚决维护战后国际秩序，决不允许否认和歪曲侵略历史，决不允许军国主义卷土重来，决不允许历史悲剧重演！
translations.en: The Chinese people will, with the greatest determination and effort, work together with the people around the world to resolutely defend the outcomes of their War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression and the World Anti-Fascist War, safeguard the postwar international order, and never allow the denial and distortion of the history of aggression, the resurgence of militarism,or the recurrence of historical tragedies!

translations.zh: 第一单元战后，中国中日关系的改善间外交。
translations.en: Section 1 After World War II, the Japan friendship has also has strongly between Japan and China agreement The Improvement and Development of China-Japan Relations After the war, China.

translations.zh: 1952年6和发展中国始终坚持独立自主，积极谋求同世界各国和平共处。
translations.en: China has always adhered to an independent foreign policy and actively sought peaceful coexistence with other countries in the world.

translations.zh: 经过中日两国领导人和各界有识之士的长期不懈努力，两国于1972年实现了邦交正常化。
translations.en: Thanks to unremitting efforts of Chinese and Japanese leaders and visionary people from all walks of life,the two countries achieved the normalization of their diplomatic ties in 1972.

translations.zh: 中日两国之间签署的四个政治文件成为发展中日友好关系的“压舱石”。
translations.en: The four political documents signed between China and Japan have become the ballast for the stable development of bilateral relations.

translations.zh: 前事不忘，后事之师。
translations.en: History, if not forgotten, can serve as a guide for the future.

translations.zh: 中日双方应按照中日四个政治文件确立的原则和方向，共同努力全面推进中日战略互惠关系，致力于构建契合新时代要求的建设性、稳定的中日关系。
translations.en: China and Japan should work together to comprehensively advance their strategic and mutually beneficial relations in accordance with the principles and directions set forth in the four political documents,and commit themselves to building a constructive, stable China-Japan relationship that meets the requirements of the new era.

translations.zh: 第三单元促进世界和平与发展
translations.en: Section 3 Promoting World Peace and Development

translations.zh: 中国历来是维护世界和平、促进共同发展的坚定力量。
translations.en: China has always been a staunch force for safeguarding world peace and promoting common development.

translations.zh: 中国人民已经迈上了全面建设社会主义现代化国家新征程，正以中国式现代化全面推进强国建设、民族复兴伟业。
translations.en: The Chinese people have embarked on a new journey of building a modern socialist country in all respects and are advancing the building of China into a great country and national rejuvenation on all fronts through Chinese modernization.

translations.zh: 中国式现代化是走和平发展道路的现代化，中国的发展壮大是世界和平力量的发展壮大。
translations.en: Chinese modernization is the modernization pursuing peaceful development, and China's development is the development of the world's peace-loving forces.

translations.zh: 中国将坚定站在历史正确的一边、站在人类文明进步的一边，弘扬全人类共同价值，在坚定维护世界和平与发展中谋求自身发展，又以自身发展更好维护世界和平与发展，推动构建人类命运共同体。
translations.en: China will firmly stand on the right side of history and on the side of human progress,and uphold the common values of humanity.China will explore its own development while firmly safeguarding world peace and development, and better promote world peace and development through its own development, so as to advance the building of a community with a shared future for mankind.

translations.zh: 正义必胜！
translations.en: Justice will prevail!

translations.zh: 和平必胜！
translations.en: Peace will prevail!

translations.zh: 人民必胜！
translations.en: The people will prevail!

translations.zh: 我们要牢记由鲜血和生命铸就的中国人民抗日战争的伟大历史，牢记中国人民为维护民族独立和自由、捍卫祖国主权和尊严建立的伟大功勋，牢记中国人民为世界反法西斯战争胜利作出的伟大贡献。
translations.en: We must keep in mind the great history of the Chinese People's War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression forged by blood and lives, the great feats made by the Chinese people in safeguarding national independence and freedom and defending the sovereignty and dignity of their motherland, and the great contributions made by the Chinese people to the victory of the World Anti-Fascist War.

translations.zh: 新时代新征程，让我们更加紧密地团结在以习近平同志为核心的党中央周围，高举中国特色社会主义伟大旗帜，全面贯彻习近平新时代中国特色社会主义思想，弘扬伟大抗战精神，铭记历史、缅怀先烈、珍爱和平、开创未来，为以中国式现代化全面推进强国建设、民族复兴伟业不懈奋斗，为人类和平与发展的崇高事业作出新的更大贡献！
translations.en: Along the new journey in the new era, let us rally more closely around the CPC Central Committee with Comrade Xi Jinping at the core, hold high the great banner of socialism with Chinese characteristics, fully implement Xi Jinping Thought on Socialism with Chinese Characteristics for a New Era, and carry forward the great spirit of resisting aggression.

translations.zh: 前言古代中国陈列”是中国国家博物馆的基本陈列，它以王朝更替为主要脉络，分为远古时期、夏商西周时期、春秋战国时期、秦汉时期、三国两晋南北朝时期、隋唐五代时期、辽宋夏金元时期和明清时期八个部分。
translations.en: Introduction Ancient China is a permanent exhibition of the National Museum of China.

translations.zh: 该陈列以古代珍贵文物为主要见证，较为全面地展示了古代中国不同历史时期在政治、经济、文化、社会生活以及中外交流等方面的发展状况，突出展现了中华文明绵延不绝的发展特点和各族人民共同缔造多民族国家的历史进程，展现了中华民族所取得的辉煌成就和对人类文明所做出的伟大贡献。
translations.en: Following a dynastic sequence, it unfolds the Chinese history in eight sections from the prehistoric times to the Ming and Qing Dynasties.

translations.zh: 约二百万年前至约公元前二十一世纪
translations.en: c. 2 million years ago to c. 21st century BC

translations.zh: 中国旧石器时代早期人类及其生活旧石器时代早期是指距今约200万年一20余万年间这一历史阶段。
translations.en: Lower Palaeolithic China The Lower Palaeolithic spans a period from about 2 million to 200,000 years ago.

translations.zh: 生活在这一阶段的人类被称为直立人。
translations.en: During that period, the early human species called Homo erectus lived in China.

translations.zh: 中国是人类进化的重要地区之一，有丰富的古人类化石遗存。
translations.en: Early fossils discovered at numerous locations indicate that China was a key area of activity for human evolution.

translations.zh: 距今约170万年的元谋人是中国发现最早的直立人，稍晚的直立人有蓝田人、北京人、郧县人、和县人、汤山人等。
translations.en: The earliest Homo erectus found in China, Yuanmou Man, lived about 1.7 million years ago.

translations.zh: 直立人使用打制石器、木棒等工具，从事采集、狩猎活动，已经学会控制用火，逐渐改变了自然和人类本身。
translations.en: Somewhat later, Lantian Man, Peking Man, Yunxian Man, Hexian Man, and Tangshan Man emerged in other regions.

translations.zh: 202北京市组织开展“北京抗日战争主题片区”保护提升工作。
translations.en: In December 2024, Beijing initiated the preservation and enhancement project for the “War of Resistance against Japanese Aggression Themed Area in Beijing.”

translations.zh: “北京抗日战争主题片区”主要包括北京地区与抗日战争有关的重要纪念场馆、重大历史事件发生地、烈士纪念场所等纪念设施、遗址。
translations.en: This area mainly encompasses significant memorials, major historical event sites, martyr memorial sites, and other commemorative facilities and relics related to the War of Resistance against Japanese Aggression in Beijing.

translations.zh: 中国人民抗日战争纪念馆中国人民抗日战争纪念馆位于北京市丰台区西南卢沟桥畔、宛平城内，是全国唯一一座全面反映中国人民抗日战争历史的大型综合性纪念馆，建筑面积约50000平方米，于1987年7月7日建成并对外开放。
translations.en: MUSEUM OF THE WAR OF THE CHINESE PEOPLE'S RESISTANCE AGAINST JAPANESE AGGRESSION The Museum of the War of the Chinese People's Resistance Against Japanese Aggression is located within Wanping Fortress near Lugou Bridge in the southwestern Fengtai District, Beijing.

translations.zh: 作为全民族抗战爆发纪念地、北京抗日战争主题片区核心区重要组成部分，馆内设有为了民族解放与世界和平”主题展览，全景式展示中国人民14年抗战波澜壮阔的伟大历史，着力展现中国共产党在抗战中的中流砥柱作用和中国人民抗日战争在世界反法西斯战争中的东方主战场地位。
translations.en: Covering an area of about 50,000 m, it is a large-scale memorial hall comprehensively reflecting the Chinese People's War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression.

translations.zh: 中国人民抗日战争纪念馆是国家一级博物馆，全国爱国主义教育示范基地，第一批国家级抗战纪念设施、遗址，国际二战博物馆协会倡议发起成立单位及秘书处常设单位中共北京市委宣传部二〇二五年六月北京抗日战争主题片区主要纪念设施、遗址分布图中国人民抗日战争纪念馆卢沟桥宛平城中国人民抗日战争纪念雕塑园一二九运动纪念地冀热察挺进军司令部旧址陈列馆平西抗日战争纪念馆平西情报联络站纪念馆平北抗日烈士纪念园白乙化烈士纪念馆北京焦庄户地道战遗址纪念馆“没有共产党就没有新中国”革命歌曲纪念馆城北街贝家花园沙岗村古北口长城抗战纪念馆赵登禹将军墓佟麟阁将军墓
translations.en: The Museum of the War of the Chinese People's Resistance Against Japanese Aggression is a national first-grade museum of China and a national patriotic education demonstration base.

translations.zh: 直立人直立人已能直立行走，会制造工具，具备了人的一些特征，但脑量较小，头部保留了较原始的特征。
translations.en: Homo erectus Homo erectus walked upright on two feet and made tools.

translations.zh: 古老的石器工具受地理环境的制约，中国旧石器时代的石器以秦岭为界，大致可分为南北两大系统，北方以小型石片石器为主，南方以大型块状毛坯或砾石制成的石器为主，在不同地区还存在多样性的特点。
translations.en: Stone Tools Stone tools in Palaeolithic China fell into two geographical groups with the Qinling Mountains as the dividing line.

translations.zh: 用火用火是人类适应自然与改善生存环境的关键一步。
translations.en: Use of Fire is a crucial step in human evolution that signifies the ability of early humans to adapt to and transform the natural environment.

translations.zh: 北京人已学会使用自然火，并能保存火种。
translations.en: The Peking Man learned to preserve live cinders from fire found in nature to roast food, provide light and warmth, and scare off predators.

translations.zh: 他们用火烧烤食物、照明、取暖和驱赶野兽，促进了身体特别是大脑的发育，提高了适应和改变自然的能力。
translations.en: This contributed to physical health, cerebral development, and improved living conditions.

translations.zh: 采集与狩猎在北京人遗址中，除发现采集食用的朴树籽外，还发现了大量的动物遗骸，其中肿骨鹿化石有2000多个个体，斑鹿化石有1000多个个体，说明肿骨鹿和斑鹿是北京人狩猎的主要对象。
translations.en: Hunting and Gathering Hackberry seeds gathered for food and a large cache of animal remains were discovered at the Peking Man site.

translations.zh: 北京人在夏末秋初时狩猎斑鹿，在秋末冬初时狩猎肿骨鹿。
translations.en: The fossils of over 2,000 individual thick-jawed deer and over 1,000 individual Pseudaxis grayi deer indicate that these two species were primary hunting targets for Peking Man.

translations.zh: 北京
translations.en: The Pseudaxis grayi were hunted in late summer/early autumn, while the thick-jawed deer were hunted in late autumn/early winter.

translations.zh: 中国旧石器时代中、晚期的人类及其文化旧石器时代中、晚期是指距今约20余万年一1万年间这一历史阶段。
translations.en: Middle and Upper Palaeolithic China The Middle and Upper Palaeolithic can be traced from about 200,000 to 10,000 years ago when the human species Homo sapiens emerged.

translations.zh: 生活在这一阶段的人类被称为智人。
translations.en: Many fossils belonging to Homo sapiens have been discovered across China, including Jinniushan Man, Dali Man, Xujiayao Man, Dingcun Man, Maba Man, Liujiang Man, Xuchang Man, Upper Cave Man, and Zuozhen Man.

translations.zh: 在中国境内已发现金牛山人、大荔人、许家窑人、丁村人、马坝人、柳江人、许昌人、山顶洞人、左镇人等智人化石。
translations.en: This period is characterized by progress in stone tool technology and wider use of stone balls in hunting.

translations.zh: 这一阶段，石器技术不断进步，石球更多地被用于狩猎。
translations.en: The Upper Palaeolithic saw the invention of javelins, harpoons, bows, and arrows—indicating an economy based on fishing and hunting-as well as the early seeds of spiritual beliefs and art.

translations.zh: 智人意为“智慧的人”，可分为早期智人和晚期智人。
translations.en: Homo sapiens There were two types of Homo sapiens.

translations.zh: 早期智人生活在距今20余万年一5万年间，相当于旧石器时代中期，其身体特征介于直立人和晚期智人之间，石器加工技术有所进步。
translations.en: The early Homo sapiens lived during the Middle Palaeolithic (c. 200,000-50,000 years ago), had physical features somewhere between Homo erectus and the late Homo sapiens, and were more skilled in making stone tools than the former.

translations.zh: 晚期智人生活在距今5万年一1万年间，相当于旧石器时代晚期，其身体特征已接近现代人，石器加工技术更加进步，已学会人工取火。
translations.en: The late Homo sapiens lived during the Upper Palaeolithic (c. 50,000-10,000 years ago) with physical features closer to modern humans.

translations.zh: 假说认单一地因变异
translations.en: They produced more advanced stone tools and learned how to create fire

translations.zh: 石器技术的改进旧石器时代中期，石器制作技术有所提高，石器形态更加规整，精品不断增加。
translations.en: Improved Stone Tools With advancements in tool-making during the Middle Palaeolithic, stone tools became finer and more regular in shape.

translations.zh: 旧石器时代晚期，石器制作技术有更大的突破，开始出现用特殊工艺技术制作的细石器。
translations.en: In the Upper Palaeolithic, the use of microliths marked a breakthrough in technology.

translations.zh: 原始信仰与原始艺术的萌芽
translations.en: Origins of Early Spiritual Beliefs and Art

translations.zh: 旧石器时代晚期，人类已开始将死者按照一定的葬俗进行埋葬。
translations.en: In the Upper Palaeolithic, the deceased were buried according to certain burial customs.

translations.zh: 山顶洞人在死者周围撒上赤铁矿粉末，用石器和装饰品随葬，表明了原始信仰及原始艺术的萌芽。
translations.en: Inhabitants at the Upper Cave Man site spread hematite powder around the dead and buried them together with stone tools and decorative items-an indication of early spiritual beliefs and primitive art.

translations.zh: 弓箭、鱼镖的发明与骨、角器的使用
translations.en: Use of Bone and Antler and the Invention of Composite Tools

translations.zh: 旧石器时代晚期，出现了磨制和穿孔技术
translations.en: In the Upper Palaeolithic, techniques for grinding and perforating took place.

translations.zh: 标枪、鱼镖和弓箭等复合生产工具的发明，提高了狩猎和捕鱼的效率。
translations.en: The invention of composite tools like the javelin, harpoon, and bow and arrow made fishing and hunting more efficient.

translations.zh: 用骨、角制作的锥、针和铲等工具，丰富了人们的生活。
translations.en: Furthermore, bone or antler tools like awls, needles, and spades enriched everyday life.

source.title_zh: 中国新石器时代的生产与生活
source.title_en: Life and Production in Neolithic China

translations.zh: 距今约1万年前，人类历史进入到新石器时代。
translations.en: The Neolithic Age began about 10,000 years ago.

source.title_zh: 中国新石器时代的生产与生活
source.title_en: Life and Production in Neolithic China

translations.zh: 这一时期出现了农业和养畜业，开始使用磨制石器和制作陶器。
translations.en: This period featured the advent of agriculture, domesticated animals, polished stone tools, and the invention of pottery.

source.title_zh: 中国新石器时代的生产与生活
source.title_en: Life and Production in Neolithic China

translations.zh: 人们以血缘关系为纽带结成聚落，过着定居生活。
translations.en: People began living in settlements with blood relatives and the economy was gradually transformed into a production based one.

translations.zh: 家畜饲养新石器时代，人类开始驯养家畜，并逐渐使之成为生活中重要的食物来源。
translations.en: Domestication of Animals In the Neolithic Age, people began domesticating animals like dogs, pigs, oxen, sheep, and goats.

translations.zh: 家畜种类也逐渐增加，主要有狗、猪、黄牛、绵羊和山羊等。
translations.en: Domesticated animals became an important food source.

translations.zh: 农业的发生中国是世界上主要的农业起源地区之一。
translations.en: Advent of Agriculture China is one of the major birthplaces for agriculture.

translations.zh: 距今约1万年前，长江中、下游地区已开始种植水稻，黄河流域已开始种植粟，并逐渐形成了南方稻作农业和北方栗作农业两大传统经济区。
translations.en: About 10,000 years ago, rice was cultivated along the middle and lower reaches of the Yangtze River and millet in the Yellow River basin.

translations.zh: 这一时期耕作方式不断改进，农业工具的制作与加工达到了一定的水平。
translations.en: This was the start of two agricultural traditions: rice-growing in south China and millet-growing in the north.

translations.zh: 制陶中国是世界上较早发明陶器的地区之一。
translations.en: Pottery China is one of the early sites for the invention of pottery.

translations.zh: 新石器时代，陶器制作由简单的手工捏塑、模制、泥片贴塑，再到泥条盘筑、慢轮修整，进而产生了快轮制陶技术。
translations.en: In the Neolithic Age, pottery production developed with simple kneading, modelling, and pasting methods.

translations.zh: 中国各地区的陶器在器形、质地、纹饰及器类组合等方面体现出丰富的文化内涵，具有鲜明的时代和地域特征。
translations.en: The technique then advanced to clay-strip coiling, the slow wheel, and finally the fast wheel.

translations.zh: 编织与纺织编织工艺的进步促成了纺织技术的发明，人们开始用纺织物来改善自身的穿着。
translations.en: Weaving and Textiles Advancements in weaving gave birth to textile production and people began using textiles to make better clothing.

translations.zh: 新石器时代遗址中广泛发现有纺轮、锥、针等工具，部分陶器上还印有布纹痕迹。
translations.en: Spindle whorls, awls, and needles as well as pottery with textile impressions have been found at many Neolithic sites.

translations.zh: 纺织原料主要是葛、麻等植物的纤维。
translations.en: Hemp and ramie were the main raw materials for weaving.

translations.zh: 原始信仰与原始艺术的发展新石器时代，人类往往借助神灵观念解释生命和自然现象，以神灵崇拜为特征的原始信仰构成了人类精神生活的重要组成部分。
translations.en: Growth of Early Beliefs and Art The Neolithic people used spiritual beliefs to explain natural phenomena and spirit worship was an important element in daily life.

translations.zh: 随着社会复杂程度的加深，原始信仰逐步规范化、礼仪化，出现了祭坛、神庙等高等级宗教场所。
translations.en: As society grew increasingly complex, spiritual beliefs became more standardized and ritualized, leading to the construction of sacrificial altars, temples, and other religious sites.

translations.zh: 认识领域的拓展，使得人们的精神世界变得日益丰富多彩，绘画、雕塑、音乐和舞蹈等艺术，反映了先民朴素的审美意识。
translations.en: With the expansion of knowledge, the spiritual life of the Neolithic people became increasingly rich and varied.

source.title_zh: 文字的萌芽与铜器的产生
source.title_en: Origins of Writing and Bronze Production

translations.zh: 新石器时代遗物上常见一些刻画符号，它们可能是文字萌芽阶段的产物。
translations.en: Engraved symbols are often found on Neolithic objects and are probably early forms of writing.

source.title_zh: 文字的萌芽与铜器的产生
source.title_en: Origins of Writing and Bronze Production

translations.zh: 新石器时代晚期，治铜技术出现，人们已能够制造小件铜器，质地多为青铜和红铜，部分遗址中还发现了铜炼渣等遗物。
translations.en: As copper-smelting technology emerged in the late Neolithic, small-sized objects were produced from bronze and red copper.

source.title_zh: 中国新石器时代的文明化进程
source.title_en: Dawn of Civilization in Neolithic China

translations.zh: 中国幅员辽阔，各地区新石器文化源远流长、异彩纷呈。
translations.en: Neolithic China extended over a vast land with long-established cultures in various regions.

source.title_zh: 中国新石器时代的文明化进程
source.title_en: Dawn of Civilization in Neolithic China

translations.zh: 新石器时代晚期，随着文字的萌芽、礼器的出现、大型礼仪建筑与城堡的兴建，社会分化加剧，社会形态也由简单的平等社会发展为复杂的分层社会。
translations.en: The emergence of writing, ritual objects, large-scale ceremonial architecture, and walled settlements in the late Neolithic accelerated social differentiation and society grew increasingly complex and stratified.

source.title_zh: 中国新石器时代的文明化进程
source.title_en: Dawn of Civilization in Neolithic China

translations.zh: 文明之光灿若繁星，中国文化呈现出多元一体的演变趋势。
translations.en: Chinese culture developed as an organic whole with diverse parts.

source.title_zh: 中国新石器时代的文明化进程
source.title_en: Dawn of Civilization in Neolithic China

translations.zh: 在吸收周边地区先进文化因素的过程中，中原地区率先步入文明。
translations.en: By absorbing cultural advancements in neighbouring areas, the Central Plains progressed towards civilization.

source.title_zh: 中国新石器时代的文明化进程
source.title_en: Dawn of Civilization in Neolithic China

translations.zh: 与新石器时代晚期剧烈的社会变革相对应，中国古代文献记载了许多有关炎帝、黄帝，直至尧、舜、禹的古史传说。
translations.en: Legends from that time about tribe leaders like Yandi,Huangdi (Yellow Emperor) Yao, Shun, and Yu are found in ancient Chinese writings.

translations.zh: 礼仪制度与权贵阶层新石器时代晚期，社会分化加剧，具有特定含义的礼仪制度已经产生。
translations.en: Ritual System and the Nobility In the late Neolithic, social stratification intensified and fostered the development of a ritual system.

translations.zh: 一些遗址中出现了具有礼仪功能的大型公共建筑。
translations.en: Large-scale public buildings with ritual functions have been found at certain Neolithic sites.

translations.zh: 公共墓地中贫富分化严重，还出现了专门的贵族墓地。
translations.en: Divisions between rich and poor are evident in tombs.

translations.zh: 贵族墓中出土了大量象征权力与身份的玉器，标志着凌驾于公共群体之上的权贵阶层已经形成。
translations.en: There even appeared exclusive tombs for the nobility, from which jade objects denoting power and social status have been unearthed, indicating the existence of an elite class.

translations.zh: 聚落、城堡与战争新石器时代的聚落一般由居址、墓地、手工业作坊等不同功能的区域组成，有些聚落还有壕沟围护。
translations.en: Settlements, Walled Cities, and War Neolithic settlements usually consisted of a residential area, handicraft workshops, and a burial ground; some were surrounded by a ditch.

translations.zh: 新石器时代晚期，逐渐出现了大型中心聚落与普通聚落的分化，并在剧烈的社会冲突中涌现出了众多城堡，社会形态开始向早期国家过渡。
translations.en: By the late Neolithic, large principal settlements broke off from ordinary ones.

translations.zh: 夏朝的建立约在公元前21世纪，禹治水成功，被推举为联盟首领。
translations.en: Establishment of the Xia Dynasty Around the 21st century BC, a famous figure in ancient Chinese history known as Yu succeeded in controlling the floods and was made leader of a coalition of tribes.

translations.zh: 禹死后，其子启继位。
translations.en: After Yu's death, his son Qi became the successor.

translations.zh: 自此，传统推举首领的“禅让”制为王位世袭制所代替，中国历史上出现了第一个王朝——夏。
translations.en: Henceforth, the system in which appointed leaders abdicated their rule was replaced by a system based on hereditary succession and China's first dynasty emerged-the Xia Dynasty.

translations.zh: 夏人的主要活动地域在今河南西部与山西南部。
translations.en: The Xia people lived mainly in present-day western Henan and southern Shanxi Provinces.

translations.zh: 以河南偃师二里头遗址为中心的“二里头文化”，是目前探索夏人历史面貌的主要遗存。
translations.en: The Erlitou cultural remains at Yanshi in Henan Province provide important clues about their history and activities.

translations.zh: 早期国家的形成与初步发展夏、商、西周时期是中国古代早期国家形态的形成与初步发展阶段。
translations.en: Early State Formation During the Xia, Shang, and Western Zhou period, China experienced the initial stages of state formation.

translations.zh: 这一时期，伴随着朝代更迭，王权政治得以强化并不断完善。
translations.en: Monarchical power was strengthened with each dynastic change.

translations.zh: 盘庚迁殷之后，商朝开始强盛。
translations.en: After moving the capital to Yin, the Shang Dynasty prospered.

translations.zh: 西周统治者通过分封诸侯巩固了政权，同时将影响区域空前扩大。
translations.en: Western Zhou kings consolidated their power and expanded their area of influence by bestowing land and commoners to lords.

translations.zh: 夏、商、西周时期形成的政治结构，促进了当时社会经济与文化的繁荣，也为此后中国古代社会的进一步发展奠定了坚实基础。
translations.en: The political system that took shape during this period fostered economic and cultural growth and laid a strong foundation for Chinese society in the ensuing dynasties.

translations.zh: 西周晚期，王室衰微，各阶层间矛盾激化，社会变革势在必然。
translations.en: Nevertheless, in the late Western Zhou, decline in monarchical rule gave rise to intense social conflict and change became inevitable.

translations.zh: 商朝的强盛约在公元前16世纪，成汤率领商族趁夏乱起兵，灭夏，建立了商朝。
translations.en: Rise of the Shang Dynasty Around the 16th century BC, Cheng Tang led the Shang people to overthrow the Xia rule and establish the Shang Dynasty with a capital at Bo.

translations.zh: 商初建都于毫，后经数次迁徙，约在公元前14世纪，商王盘庚定都于殷（今河南安阳），直至公元前11世纪商朝灭亡。
translations.en: Around the 14th century BC, the Shang King Pan Geng moved the capital to Yin (present-day Anyang, Henan Province),where it remained until the fall of the Shang in the 11th century BC.

translations.zh: 盘庚迁殷之后，商朝进入了强盛时期。
translations.en: After the move to Yin, the Shang Dynasty grew strong and prosperous.

translations.zh: 西周的封邦建国商朝后期，居住在陕西岐山之南周原一带的周人逐渐强大。
translations.en: Establishment of the Western Zhou Dynasty The late Shang Dynasty saw the gradual expansion of the Zhou people at Zhouyuan (south of present-day Qishan Mountain, Shaanxi Province).

translations.zh: 约在公元前11世纪，周武王联合许多方国、部落，大败商军于牧野，灭商，建立了周朝，都于镐（今陕西西安）。
translations.en: Around the 11th century BC, King Wu of Zhou joined forces with several states and tribes to defeat the Shang army and established the Zhou Dynasty (later known as Western Zhou) with the capital at Hao (present-day Xi'an, Shaanxi).

translations.zh: 周武王死后，由周公摄政，他平定了管叔、蔡叔与商王子武庚联合发动的叛乱，并分封诸侯。
translations.en: After King Wu's death, Zhou Gong governed as regent and successfully put down a rebellion.

translations.zh: 夏商西周时期的经济农业是这一时期主要的经济部门，管理体制较为完善。
translations.en: Economy During the Xia, Shang, and Western Zhou period, agriculture was the primary economic sector and was managed quite well.

translations.zh: 手工业在二里头文化时期内部已出现专业分工，到了商代，生产规模进一步扩大，同时，商业活动也取得显著发展。
translations.en: A Division of labour by profession had already emerged in the handicraft industry in the Erlitou Culture.

translations.zh: 西周时期，手工业内部分工更细，号称“百工”，与商业同为官府垄断，即所谓“工商食官”。
translations.en: In the Shang Dynasty, the scale of handicraft production expanded and trade increased.

translations.zh: 其主要生产门类包括青铜铸造、玉石器加工、陶瓷器制作、纺织与漆等。
translations.en: During the Western Zhou, the government controlled both handicrafts and trade.

translations.zh: 农业这一时期的生产工具以木、石、骨、蚌器为主，青铜工具使用较少。
translations.en: Agriculture During this period, farming tools were generally made of wood, stone, bone, or mussel shells and bronze tools were still a rarity.

translations.zh: 商王极其重视农业，设有主管农事之官、当时生产过程包括作垫、收获、储藏等一系列完整的环节。
translations.en: The Shang kings attached great importance to agriculture and appointed officials to manage production; farming was practiced in steps beginning with building ridges in the fields and ending with harvest and storage.

translations.zh: 西周的土地为周王所有，周王将土地赐给各级贵族与平民。
translations.en: In the Western Zhou, land belonged to the kings, who bestowed it upon the nobility and common people.

translations.zh: 劳动者在布满沟洫的井田上，进行大规模的集体耕作，同时采取休耕轮作以保持地力。
translations.en: Large-scale collective farming was practiced in fields crisscrossed with irrigation ditches.

translations.zh: 原始瓷器制作中国是瓷器的故乡，二里头文化时期已发现原始瓷器。
translations.en: Proto-porcelain Production China is the birthplace of porcelain and proto-porcelain can be traced to the Erlitou Culture.

translations.zh: 商代的一部分原始瓷器，以高岭土为胎，器表及部分口沿内施石灰釉，光亮透明，呈现深浅不同的青色，烧成温度约在1200℃左右，质地坚硬，无吸水性或吸水性很弱，已经具备瓷器的基本特征。
translations.en: Made from kaolin clay, some Shang proto-porcelain was applied with a mixed glaze containing lime on the surface and inside parts of the rim before firing at around 1,200 °C.

translations.zh: 西周时期，原始瓷器的制作工艺比商代有所提高，器类增加，使用更加普遍。
translations.en: In the Western Zhou, progress in technology led to greater diversity and more widespread use of proto-porcelain.

translations.zh: 青铜铸造二里头文化时期，青铜合金技术普及，出现采用多块复合范浇铸的青铜礼器群，工艺复杂。
translations.en: Bronze-casting The Erlitou Culture featured wide use of bronze alloy and groups of bronze ritual vessels made using complicated piece-mould casting techniques.

translations.zh: 商代的青铜铸造业内部分工明确，生产规模扩大，并用一次浇铸的浑铸法与先铸器体或附件然后接铸两者的分铸法，铸造出品类多样、造型复杂、纹饰精美的器物，在器型设计、制作工艺等方面均有较大突破。
translations.en: Bronze-casting in the Shang Dynasty saw a division of labour, expanded production, and advances in mould-making.

translations.zh: 西周早期的青铜制品，较多承袭商代遗风。
translations.en: In general, early Western Zhou bronzes followed Shang styles.

translations.zh: 西周中期之后，发明了一模翻制数范的方法，并在铸器时使用焊接技术，器类、器型、纹饰均发生明显变化，出现许多新的式样。
translations.en: By the middle Western Zhou, new methods for creating moulds using one model and welding techniques led to changes in type, shape, and design.

translations.zh: 玉石器加工二里头文化时期，玉石器器类增多，雕琢更加精细，出现了新的装饰纹样以及在青铜上镶嵌绿松石的工艺。
translations.en: Jade and Stone Carving Erlitou Culture produced jades with more variety, sophisticated carving techniques, and new decorative designs as well as bronze vessels inlaid with turquoise.

translations.zh: 商代的玉石器加工工艺取得了明显进步，器类更多，其中的人物、动物造型生动传神，通常装饰程式化的纹样，反映出艺术发展的成熟。
translations.en: In the Shang, advancements in jade-processing technology led to even greater diversity.

translations.zh: 西周时期，玉石器被赋予丰富的礼制内涵，其中由多件玉饰结成的玉佩与玉覆面尤具时代特色。
translations.en: In the Western Zhou, jade and stone objects were imbued with ritual meaning.

translations.zh: 夏商西周时期的文化汉字是世界上最古老的文字之一，自成体系，使用时间最长。
translations.en: Chinese characters form one of the oldest written languages in the world.

translations.zh: 商代后期，汉字已发展到成熟阶段。
translations.en: Reaching maturity in the late Shang, this unique writing system has been in use for thousands of years.

translations.zh: 丰富的汉字材料，记录了当时政治、经济与文化面貌。
translations.en: Abundant written materials about the politics, economy, and culture of the Shang survive today.

translations.zh: 西周统治者以宗法制为基础，推行一整套完备的礼制，重在彰显并严格维护等级秩序，对此后的中国古代社会产生了深远影响。
translations.en: In the Western Zhou, the rulers used an elaborate ritual system to demonstrate and maintain a rigid hierarchy.

translations.zh: 汉字在夏代已经使用，商代后期的汉字已经具备汉字结构的基本形式，是一种发展到成熟阶段的文字。
translations.en: Chinese characters were already in use during the Xia Dynasty.

translations.zh: 夏、商、西周时期，在青铜器、龟甲、兽骨、玉石器及陶器上留下了异常丰富的汉字材料，内容涉及祭祀、政治、军事、田猎、刑罚、农业、畜牧业、手工业、商业、医学与历法等领域。
translations.en: Late Shang characters possessed the basic structure of fully-developed Chinese writing.

translations.zh: 天象、气象的观察与历法由于农业、畜牧业的发展及日常生活需要，商人对日食、月食、星等天象以及云、雷、雨、虹、雹、雪、雾、风等气象的观察频繁而细致，使用太阴纪月、太阳纪年的阴阳合历，其纪日、纪时方式长期为后世沿用。
translations.en: Astronomy, Meteorology, and the Calendar In an effort to improve farming, animal husbandry, and everyday life, the Shang people made detailed observations of lunar and solar eclipses as well as the stars, clouds, thunder, rain, rainbows, hail, snow, fog, and wind. A lunar-solar calendar was used to designate the time of month and time of year. Such methods for recording time were adopted by later generations.

translations.zh: 西周的礼制西周时期，以宗法制为基础，推行一整套完备的礼制，内容包括祭祀、丧葬、朝聘、征伐、宴飨、赏赐及册命等，重在彰显并严格维护等级制度。
translations.en: Western Zhou Ritual System To protect the hierarchy during the Western Zhou, a complete ritual system was introduced to govern sacrifices, burials, state visits, warfare, feasts, bestowing awards, and official appointments.

translations.zh: 不同等级贵族所使用礼器的数量、组合各不相同，庶人不得使用贵族的礼仪。
translations.en: Under this system, the use of ritual vessels varied in terms of numbers and combinations depending upon a noble's rank.

translations.zh: 音乐二里头文化时期，乐器种类主要有埙、鼓、铃、磬，到了商代，出现了铙、编铙、编磬。
translations.en: Music Musical instruments in the Erlitou Culture included the xun (wind instrument), gu (drum), ling (bell), and qing (chime stone).

translations.zh: 西周时期，钟、编钟的应用，极大丰富了音乐的表现力。
translations.en: In the Shang Dynasty, nao (inverted bell), nao sets, and qing sets appeared.

translations.zh: 夏商西周时期的周边各族夏、商、西周时期是中原文化区周边各族形成的重要阶段，在这一发展过程中，周边各族形成了各具特色的文化，并与中原文化进行频繁的交流。
translations.en: Ethnic Cultures During the Xia, Shang, and Western Zhou periods, ethnic peoples outside the Central Plains culture were also in important stages of development . Distinct ethnic groups formed unique cultures and had frequent contact with the Central Plains.

translations.zh: 北部地区夏、商、西周时期，肃慎、戎狄等部族曾经活动在今东北、内蒙古、河北、山西及陕西部分地区。
translations.en: Peoples in the North Some areas in present-day northeast China, Inner Mongolia, Hebei, Shanxi, and parts of Shaanxi Province were home to the Sushen, Rongdi, and other peoples during the Xia, Shang, and Western Zhou period.

translations.zh: 分布在此地的夏家店下层文化、西团山文化、朱开沟文化等遗存，属于这一时期。
translations.en: These areas are known for the Lower Xiajiadian, Xituanshan, and Zhukaigou cultural sites.

translations.zh: 西北地区夏、商、西周时期，今甘肃、青海等地主要有羌、戎狄部族，此地分布着齐家文化、四坝文化、寺洼文化、辛店文化及卡约文化等青铜时代的遗存。
translations.en: Peoples in the Northwest In the Xia, Shang, and Western Zhou period, the Qiang and Rongdi peoples lived in present-day Gansu and Qinghai Provinces in northwest China.

translations.zh: 西北地区夏、商、西周时期，今甘肃、青海等地主要有羌、戎狄部族，此地分布着齐家文化、四坝文化、寺洼文化、辛店文化及卡约文化等青铜时代的遗存。
translations.en: Peoples in the Northwest In the Xia, Shang, and Western Zhou period, the Qiang and Rongdi peoples lived in present-day Gansu and Qinghai Provinces in northwest China.

translations.zh: 东部地区夏、商、西周时期，生活在东部地区的部族主要有东夷与淮夷。
translations.en: Peoples in the East The Dongyi and Huaiyi peoples lived in east China during the Xia, Shang, and Western Zhou period.

translations.zh: 分布在山东地区的岳石文化，其时代大体与夏、商前期相当，是东夷的遗存。
translations.en: The Yueshi Culture was active during the Xia and early Shang and its cultural remains scattered in Shandong Province belong to the Dongyi people.

translations.zh: 西南地区商周时期，今四川、重庆主要是蜀人与巴人的活动地区。
translations.en: Peoples in the Southwest Present-day Sichuan Province and Chongqing were home to the Shu and Ba peoples during the Shang and Western Zhou period.

translations.zh: 四川广汉三星堆出土的玉器、青铜树、青铜人、青铜面具等造型具有鲜明的地方特色，但其装饰及青铜尊、青铜等明显受到商文化的影响。
translations.en: Jade objects and bronze trees, figures and masks unearthed at Sanxingdui in Sichuan are unique in design, while their decorations and the styles of some other bronze vessels indicate Shang influence.

translations.zh: 东南与南部地区夏、商、西周时期，今江苏南部、安徽南部、浙江、江西、湖北、湖南、福建、广西及广东南部地区，是吴与多支越族的聚居地。
translations.en: Peoples in the South and Southeast In the Xia, Shang, and Western Zhou period, the Wu people and several Yue tribes were indigenous to areas in present-day south and southeast China.

translations.zh: 在这片广大区域内，普遍发现几何印纹硬陶器与青铜器。
translations.en: A lot of hard pottery vessels with impressed geometric patterns and bronzes have been found there.

translations.zh: 其中洞庭湖周围地区出土的青铜器明显受到商文化的影响，而且多动物造型，形象生动、工艺精湛。
translations.en: Bronzes unearthed in the Dongting Lake region in Hunan Province are known for vivid animal designs, excellent craftsmanship, and clear Shang influence.

translations.zh: 〇年至公元前二
translations.en: Periods 770-221BC and Warring States

source.title_zh: 春秋战国时期的经济和生活
source.title_en: Economy and Daily Life

translations.zh: 春秋战国时期，各国的变法革新促进了地区经济的迅速发展。
translations.en: In the Spring and Autumn and the Warring States Periods, political reforms introduced in various states accelerated regional economic growth.

source.title_zh: 春秋战国时期的经济和生活
source.title_en: Economy and Daily Life

translations.zh: 铁器的普遍使用提高了农业产量，促进了手工业、商业的繁荣。
translations.en: Wide use of iron tools increased agricultural yields and promoted handicrafts and trade.

source.title_zh: 春秋战国时期的经济和生活
source.title_en: Economy and Daily Life

translations.zh: 到战国中期，各国的政治、军事中心都发展成为工商业都会。
translations.en: By the middle Warring States Period, capitals that originally functioned as the political and military centres of the states developed into industrial and commercial cities.

translations.zh: 大国争霸和七雄并立公元前770年，周平王迁都洛邑（今河南洛阳），中国进入春秋战国时期，这是一个思想活跃、民族融合、政治大变革的历史阶段。
translations.en: Rival States and the Seven Powers In 770 BC, King Ping moved the Zhou capital to Luoyi (present-day Luoyang, Henan Province), an event marking the start of the Spring and Autumn and the Warring States Periods.

translations.zh: 春秋时期的大国争霸，给西周以来的政治秩序带来严重冲击；战国七雄的兼并征战和社会生产力的提高，促使地区间经济趋于平衡，为秦王朝建立统一的中央集权国家奠定了基础。
translations.en: This was an era of intellectual inquiry, ethnic interaction, and political transformation.

translations.zh: 铁农具的广泛使用春秋时期，中国人已经掌握了治铁技术。
translations.en: Widespread Use of Iron Farming Tools The Chinese mastered iron-smelting technology as early as the Spring and Autumn Period.

translations.zh: 战国时期，铸铁技术日趋成熟，特别是铸铁柔化技术的发明以及铁范的使用，极大地提高了铁器的产量。
translations.en: With developments in iron-casting during the Warring States Period particularly the introduction of techniques to improve the malleability of cast iron and the use of iron moulds there was a striking increase in the output of iron tools.

translations.zh: 到战国中期，铁器已广泛应用于农业，使农业生产迅速发展。
translations.en: By the middle Warring States Period, iron tools were widely used in farming and thus led to rapid agricultural development.

translations.zh: 城市和商业春秋战国时期，城市的数量不断增加，规模日益扩大，城市的商业特点日趋明显。
translations.en: Cities and Trade During the Spring and Autumn and the Warring States Periods, cities increased in size and number.

translations.zh: 为适应商业发展的需要，各国大量铸造金属货币，实行各自的度量衡制。
translations.en: With growth in trade, metal currencies were circulated and each state set its own standards for weights and measures.

translations.zh: 手工业的发展春秋战国时期，青铜铸造技术进一步提高。
translations.en: Growth in Handicraft Industry In the Spring and Autumn and the Warring States Periods, bronze production saw advancements in casting techniques.

translations.zh: 焊接技术、复合范铸造技术普遍应用于青铜器铸造，熔模铸造技术的出现使精密铸造成为可能，错金、错银、嵌铜、嵌绿松石、包金、鎏金、刻镂等新工艺使青铜器制作呈现出新的风貌。
translations.en: Welding and piece-moulds were in wide use and the innovative lost-wax method led to casting with precision.

translations.zh: 丝织品的种类繁多，拥有当时世界上领先的织造技术；原始瓷器的烧制有所进步：大量金银器和精美玉器、漆器的使用，表现出王室贵族追求奢华的时尚。
translations.en: Meanwhile, new technologies were introduced such as inlaying with gold, silver, copper, or turquoise, gold plating, gilding, and engraving.

translations.zh: 手工业的发展春秋战国时期，青铜铸造技术进一步提高。
translations.en: Growth in Handicraft Industry In the Spring and Autumn and the Warring States Periods, bronze production saw advancements in casting techniques.

translations.zh: 焊接技术、复合范铸造技术普遍应用于青铜器铸造，熔模铸造技术的出现使精密铸造成为可能，错金、错银、嵌铜、嵌绿松石、包金、鎏金、刻镂等新工艺使青铜器制作呈现出新的风貌。
translations.en: Welding and piece-moulds were in wide use and the innovative lost-wax method led to casting with precision.

translations.zh: 丝织品的种类繁多，拥有当时世界上领先的织造技术原始瓷器的烧制有所进步；大量金银器和精美玉器、漆器的使用，表现出王室贵族追求奢华的时尚。
translations.en: Meanwhile, new technologies were introduced such as inlaying with gold, silver, copper, or turquoise gold plating, gilding, and engraving.

translations.zh: 日常生活春秋战国时期，贵族礼仪化的饮食活动依然很多，鼎、簋、罍、壶、盘、匜等青铜器仍在生活中使用；漆器因其艳丽、轻巧，而被广泛应用到日常生活的许多方面；丝织业的发展，使丝绸服装成为贵族阶层的主要衣着。
translations.en: Daily Life During the Spring and Autumn and the Warring States Periods, while ceremonial feasts were still popular among the nobility, bronze vessels like ding, gui, lei, hu, pan, and yi began to be used in everyday life.

translations.zh: 华丽的铜灯、精美的铜镜等，都成为贵族家居生活中的时尚用品。
translations.en: Lacquerware was widely used in everyday life because of its light weight and vivid colours.

translations.zh: 春秋战国时期的周边各族春秋时期，中原人常常自称为“诸夏”，将居住在周边地区的部族称为“蛮、夷、戎、狄”。
translations.en: Ethnic Cultures In the Spring and Autumn Period, the people of the Central Plains called themselves the “Zhuxia", while those on the peripheries were referred to as the Man, Yi, Rong, or Di.

translations.zh: 随着中原各国与周边各族的密切交往，到春秋战国之际，“蛮、夷、戎、狄”中的大多数部族逐渐与“诸夏”相融合，为统一的多民族国家的建立奠定了基础。
translations.en: As communications between the people of the Central Plains and neighbouring ethnic groups grew during the late Spring and Autumn and the early Warring States Periods, most of the Man, Yi, Rong, and Di peoples gradually mixed with the Zhuxia.

translations.zh: 东部地区春秋战国时期，东部地区部族被泛称为“夷”，分布在今山东、安徽及江苏北部一带，包括淮夷、徐夷、东夷等。
translations.en: Peoples in the East In the Spring and Autumn and the Warring States Periods, peoples living in east China (present-day Shandong, Anhui, and northern Jiangsu Provinces) were referred to collectively as the Yi, including the Huaiyi, Xuyi, and Dongyi peoples.

translations.zh: 北部和西北部地区春秋时期，北部和西北部地区生活着北戎、山戎、白狄、长狄等部族，这些部族后来部分与华夏族融合为一体。
translations.en: Peoples in the North and Northwest In the Spring and Autumn Period, peoples living in the north and northwest regions were referred to as the Beirong, Shanrong, Baidi, Changdi, etc., including some who later mixed with the Huaxia culture of the Central Plains.

translations.zh: 战国时期，活动在北部地区的部族主要有匈奴、白狄、东胡、林胡、楼烦等；西北部地区的部族被泛称为氏、羌。
translations.en: In the Warring States Period, ethnic groups called the Xiongnu, Baidi, Donghu, Linhu, and Loufan populated the north and the Di and Qiang lived in the northwest.

source.title_zh: 春秋战国时期的文化

translations.zh: 春秋战国时期，文化领域发生巨变，一些受过良好教育的“士”人聚徒讲学，著书立说，建立了众多学术流派。
translations.en: Culture Enormous cultural change took place during the Spring and Autumn and the Warring States Periods when educated scholars began lecturing, attracting disciples, writing books, and establishing various schools of thought.

source.title_zh: 春秋战国时期的文化

translations.zh: 其中，孔子开创的儒家学派与墨子开创的墨家学派成为时代显学，弟子遍天下。
translations.en: Confucianism founded by Kongzi (Confucius) and Mohism founded by Mozi were the most famous schools and had the largest following.

source.title_zh: 春秋战国时期的文化

translations.zh: 他们与道家、法家、名家、阴阳家等学派自由争论政治、思想领域的各种问题，在学术思想界形成了“百家争鸣”的局面。
translations.en: Confucians and Mohists argued freely about politics and philosophical issues with the Daoists, Legalists, Logicians, and Yin-Yang School.

source.title_zh: 春秋战国时期的文化

translations.zh: 思想界的活跃也促进了文学、史学、艺术与科学的发展，中华文明从此走入了一个生机勃勃、硕果累累的新时代。
translations.en: Within scholarly circles this became known as the period when the Hundred Schools of Thought contended.

translations.zh: 公元前三年至公元二年
西南部地区春秋战国时期，西南部地区的主要部族是巴、蜀和西南夷。
translations.en: Peoples in the Southwest In the Spring and Autumn and the Warring States Periods, the southwest region was home to the Ba, Shu, and Xi'nanyi peoples.

translations.zh: 巴人分布在今重庆及四川东部、湖北西北部及陕西南部；
translations.en: The Ba people lived in present-day Chongqing, eastern Sichuan, northwestern Hubei, and southern Shaanxi.

translations.zh: 蜀人分布在今四川北部和西部；
translations.en: The Shu people were based in northern and western Sichuan, while the Xi'nanyi resided across southwestern Sichuan, Yunnan, Guizhou, and western Guangxi.

source.title_zh: 秦汉时期的社会经济和生活
source.title_en: Economy and Daily Life During the Qin and Han Dynasties

translations.zh: 秦汉时期，精耕细作的农业生产体系逐渐形成。
translations.en: During the Qin and Han Dynasties, a system for increasing agricultural production gradually emerged.

source.title_zh: 秦汉时期的社会经济和生活
source.title_en: Economy and Daily Life During the Qin and Han Dynasties

translations.zh: 水排、脚踏纺织机等工具的发明、众多新工艺的出现，使手工业生产呈现出不断创新的时代风貌。
translations.en: Inventions like the water-powered bellows, pedal loom, and other new technologies sped up innovations in the handicraft industry.

source.title_zh: 秦汉时期的社会经济和生活
source.title_en: Economy and Daily Life During the Qin and Han Dynasties

translations.zh: 随着社会经济的发展，人们的社会生活更加丰富多彩。
translations.en: With social and economic development, everyday life became more plentiful and varied.

translations.zh: 大一统帝国秦汉时期，长达数百年的诸侯割据纷争的局面终于结束，统一的秦汉王朝屹立在世界的东方，中国历史迎来了大一统的帝国时代。
translations.en: A Unified Empire After centuries of wars between rival states, China entered a new era of unification under one empire beginning in the Qin and Han Dynasties.

translations.zh: 在这个时代，皇帝拥有至高无上的权力，中央实行三公九制，地方推行郡县制。
translations.en: During this period, the emperor had supreme power over a centralized government led by “three statesmen and nine ministers" (but not limited to nine).

translations.zh: 这种中央集权政治体制的创立对后世中国政治体制的发展产生了深远的影响。
translations.en: At the local level, a system of jun (prefectures) and xian (counties) was introduced.

translations.zh: 秦统一中国秦王赢政从公元前230年至前221年，先后兼并韩、赵、魏、楚、燕、齐六个诸侯国，结束了长期以来诸侯割据的局面。
translations.en: Unification of China Between 230 and 221 BC, Ying Zheng, ruler of the Qin State, annexed the six states of Han, Zhao, Wei, Chu, Yan, and Qi, putting an end to an era of separatist regimes.

translations.zh: 兼并六国后，秦王赢政自称“皇帝”，在全国范围内建立起专制主义中央集权制，推行郡县制，统一文字、货币和度量衡，开驰道、直道，筑长城，巩固国家的统一。
translations.en: Thereupon, Ying Zheng proclaimed himself huangdi (emperor) and set up a centralized autocracy to rule over a network of prefectures and counties.

translations.zh: 由于役繁重，刑罚严酷，陈胜、吴广于公元前209年发动了中国历史上第一次农民大起义，反秦风暴席卷全国。
translations.en: Nevertheless, the imposition of forced labour and harsh penal laws soon provoked rebellions.

translations.zh: 西汉的强盛秦朝灭亡后，经过楚汉战争，刘邦于公元前202年建立了汉朝，定都长安（今陕西西安），史称西汉。
translations.en: Prosperity of the Western Han Following the collapse of the Qin, in 202BC, Liu Bang established the Han Dynasty (later known as the Western Han) with its capital at Chang'an (present-day Xi'an).

translations.zh: 西汉前期实行无为而治、休养生息的政策，社会经济得到恢复和发展，出现了“文景之治”的局面。
translations.en: In the early years, the economy was restored from ruins of war and developed under the enlightened rule of Emperors Wendi and Jingdi (r. 179-141 BC).

translations.zh: 汉武帝刘彻即位后，继续削弱地方割据势力；大规模反击匈奴的侵犯，通西域；实行盐铁官营、货币官铸；兴修水利，推行先进的农业技术罢百家，独尊儒术。
translations.en: During the reign of Emperor Wudi (r. 140-87 BC), he continued to weaken local separatist forces, resisted invasions by the Xiongnu, and expanded contact with the Western Regions.

translations.zh: 西汉中央集权国家进入强盛时期。
translations.en: He also administered irrigation projects, promoted advanced farming technologies, and imposed central control over minting and the salt and iron industries.

translations.zh: 东汉贵族豪强的统治新朝灭亡后，汉皇族刘秀于公元25年重建汉朝，定都洛阳（今河南洛阳），史称东汉。
translations.en: Rule under Powerful Landlords of the Eastern Han After the Xin Dynasty collapsed, Liu Xiu reestablished the Han Dynasty (later known as the Eastern Han) in 25 AD with its capital at Luoyang (present-day Luoyang, Henan Province).

translations.zh: 东汉王朝豪族大姓往往世代高官，有众多的“门生”、“故吏”和私家武装，实际上控制着中央和地方的政权。
translations.en: During the Eastern Han, central and local government control was effectively in the hands of wealthy and powerful families who had their own loyal supporters and private armies.

translations.zh: 东汉前期，统治者采取了一系列恢复发展生产和巩固中央集权统治的措施，使天下安定。
translations.en: In the early days, measures to resume and expand agricultural production and strengthen central authority resulted in a period of stability.

translations.zh: 东汉后期政治腐败，各地的反抗斗争此伏彼起，公元184年爆发了黄巾大起义。
translations.en: Later, political corruption sparked a series of local rebellions that culminated in the Yellow Turban Uprising of 184 AD.

translations.zh: 公元220年曹不代汉称帝，东汉灭亡。
translations.en: In 220 AD, Cao Pi proclaimed himself emperor, signalling the end of the Eastern Han.

translations.zh: 农业秦汉时期，政府提倡牛耕，使牛耕在各地逐渐推广，在农业生产中占据主导地位。
translations.en: Agriculture During the Qin and Han period, ox-drawn cultivation was encouraged by the government and gradually became the dominant farming method.

translations.zh: 各类铁制农具普遍使用，犁的基本结构已经完善，还出现了以楼车为代表的新型农具。
translations.en: Iron tools were in wide use, the plough was perfected, and new farming tools like the seed plough emerged.

translations.zh: 水利工程大量兴修，农业灌溉面积不断扩大。
translations.en: Large-scale irrigation and water conservation projects helped to expand arable farmland.

translations.zh: 饮食秦汉时期，以五谷杂粮为主的饮食传统依旧保留，肉食的比重有所增加，菜肴的品种不断创新，炙、腌、烩、酱、煎等各种烹饪技术均已使用。
translations.en: Eating In the Qin and Han Dynasties, the “five cereals" (usually listed as rice, millet, wheat, beans, etc.) were still the staple food together with greater consumption of meat and other new dishes. Principal cooking methods included roasting, salting, saucing, frying, and boiling rice with meat and vegetables.

translations.zh: 服饰秦汉时期，随着纺织业的高度发展，服饰质地愈加精良。
translations.en: Clothing Along with advancements in the textile industry, the quality of garments was greatly enhanced in the Qin and Han period.

translations.zh: 上衣和下裳相连的深衣是主要的服装款式，后逐渐为宽大的袍服和檐榆所取代。
translations.en: The principal style of clothing was the full-length robe (shenyi), later replaced by looser fitting robes (pao and chanyu).

translations.zh: 舒服方便的短衣也从平民阶层走向上流社会。
translations.en: More convenient shorter garments worn by commoners gained favour among the upper class.

translations.zh: 贵族讲究服饰的整体效果，注意鞋、袜、手套和香囊与衣服的协调搭配。
translations.en: The nobility paid particular attention to the overall coordinated effect of clothing and personal accessories like shoes, socks, gloves, and sachets.

translations.zh: 起居这一时期，宫殿苑囿规模宏大，廊院和私人园林屡见不鲜，楼阁式建筑得到发展，三合院或四合院的住房布局已基本形成，为构建具有独特民族风格的中国古代建筑体系奠定了基础。
translations.en: Architecture The Qin and Han dynasties were known for magnificent royal palaces, courtyards surrounded by corridors, private gardens, and tall multi-storeyed buildings.

translations.zh: 出行秦始皇统一中国后，修驰道、开河渠，初步建立了全国性的水陆交通网，汉代在此基础上进一步加以扩展。
translations.en: After Emperor Qin Shihuang unified China, he built imperial highways and canals to establish a transportation network on land and water that was further expanded during the Han.

translations.zh: 交通网络的发达，车船制造技术的提高，马车、牛车和舟船等多种交通工具的使用，使人们出行更为方便。
translations.en: Improved techniques for manufacturing vehicles and ships resulted in increased use of animal-drawn carriages and boats, making travel more convenient.

translations.zh: 手工业秦汉时期，手工业主要有冶铁、纺织、漆、青铜铸造、陶瓷生产、制盐和酿酒等生产部门。
translations.en: Handicraft Industry The handicraft industry in the Qin and Han period consisted primarily of iron-smelting, weaving, lacquerware, bronze-casting, ceramics, salt-making, and wine-brewing.

translations.zh: 其中冶炼设备齐全，采用韧性铸铁、脱碳钢、炒钢和叠铸等技术，处于当时世界领先水平，丝织品种类繁多，工艺精良，汉代脚踏纺织机的发明是纺织业的重大进步；漆器生产分工日益细密，具有更大的优越性的饮食器具在某种程度上取代了青铜器；青铜器的生活用品种类和数量增多北方的釉陶、南方的青瓷代表了陶瓷业发展的新成就。
translations.en: China led the world in smelting technologies such as ductile cast iron, decarbonized steel, pig-iron puddling, and superposition casting.

source.title_zh: 汉代画像砖
source.title_en: Han Dynasty Brick Reliefs

translations.zh: 汉代许多墓葬中流行用嵌入墓壁上的画像砖作为装饰，其中以河南、四川的发现最为集中。
translations.en: It was popular in the Han Dynasty to decorate tomb walls with pictorial reliefs.

source.title_zh: 汉代画像砖
source.title_en: Han Dynasty Brick Reliefs

translations.zh: 砖上的画像均模印而成，生动反映了当时生产经济、社会生活和风俗信仰等方面的内容。
translations.en: Han tomb bricks with stamped reliefs have been found in large numbers in Henan and Sichuan Provinces, providing a vivid representation of agricultural production, everyday life, customs, and beliefs of that time.

source.title_zh: 秦汉时期的科学文化
source.title_en: Science and Culture During the Qin and Han Dynasties

translations.zh: 秦汉时期，科学文化有很多重要成就。
translations.en: During the Qin and Han Dynasties, there were many important scientific and cultural achievements.

source.title_zh: 秦汉时期的科学文化
source.title_en: Science and Culture During the Qin and Han Dynasties

translations.zh: 造纸术的发明，使人类书写材料发生了划时代的革命。
translations.en: The epoch-making invention of paper created a revolutionary new material for writing.

source.title_zh: 秦汉时期的科学文化
source.title_en: Science and Culture During the Qin and Han Dynasties

translations.zh: 天文、历算、地震观测、医药等领域的研究，也处于当时世界领先地位。
translations.en: In areas like astronomy, the calendar, seismology, and medicine, China led the world as well.

source.title_zh: 秦汉时期的科学文化
source.title_en: Science and Culture During the Qin and Han Dynasties

translations.zh: 儒家思想的统治地位在汉代得到确立。
translations.en: In the Han Dynasty, Confucianism was adopted as the dominant ideology.

source.title_zh: 秦汉时期的科学文化
source.title_en: Science and Culture During the Qin and Han Dynasties

translations.zh: 史学家司马迁和班固分别开创了纪传史体裁和断代为史的先河。
translations.en: Famous historians like Sima Qian (145 or 135 BC-?) and Ban Gu (32-92 AD) pioneered in biographical and dynastic history respectively.

source.title_zh: 秦汉时期的科学文化
source.title_en: Science and Culture During the Qin and Han Dynasties

translations.zh: 汉代民歌、散文、辞赋富于时代内容。
translations.en: Folk songs, sanwen (prose), and fu (rhyme prose) of the Han provide rich information about this period.

translations.zh: 造纸术的发明西汉时期，人们发明了利用废旧麻料制成原始型的植物纤维纸。
translations.en: Papermaking The invention of paper is one of China's major contributions to world civilization.

translations.zh: 东汉蔡伦改进造纸技术，在原料中增加了树皮和旧鱼网，开辟了木浆纸的先河，制造出质量较好的植物纤维纸，人称“蔡侯纸”。
translations.en: Proto-paper made from hemp and flax fibres was first invented in the Western Han.

translations.zh: 这种纸原料广、成本低，便于书写，逐渐取代帛和简牍，成为中国对世界文化的一项重大贡献。
translations.en: In the Eastern Han, Cai Lun (62-121 AD) improved papermaking technology by adding tree bark and old fishing net.

translations.zh: 墨的制作工艺也有所发展，出现了具有一定硬度和形状的墨锭，以麋（今陕西千阳）制墨最为有名。
translations.en: This earliest wood pulp paper was of better quality, cheaper, and easier to write on and gradually replaced other writing materials like silk, bamboo, and wooden slips.

translations.zh: 艺术这一时期，对现实生活的描绘和对精神需求的反映是艺术创作最重要的主题，石雕、陶塑、绘画等成为引人注目的艺术类型，其写实风格达到了很高的艺术水平。
translations.en: Art Art in the Qin and Han times focused on everyday life and spiritual pursuits.

translations.zh: 造纸术的发明西汉时期，人们发明了利用废旧麻料制成原始型的植物纤维纸。
translations.en: Papermaking The invention of paper is one of China's major contributions to world civilization.

translations.zh: 东汉蔡伦改进造纸技术，在原料中增加了树皮和旧鱼网，开辟了木浆纸的先河，制造出质量较好的植物纤维纸，人称“蔡侯纸”。
translations.en: Proto-paper made from hemp and flax fibres was first invented in the Western Han.

translations.zh: 这种纸原料广、成本低，便于书写，逐渐取代缣帛和简牍，成为中国对世界文化的一项重大贡献。
translations.en: In the Eastern Han, Cai Lun (62-121 AD) improved papermaking technology by adding tree bark and old fishing net.

translations.zh: 墨的制作工艺也有所发展，出现了具有一定硬度和形状的墨锭，以黟（今陕西千阳）制墨最为有名。
translations.en: This earliest wood pulp paper was of better quality, cheaper, and easier to write on and gradually replaced other writing materials like silk, bamboo, and wooden slips.

translations.zh: 医学秦汉时期，中医学的基本体系已经建立，在病理研究、诊治、草药以及针灸、体育健身等方面，都取得重要成就。
translations.en: Medicine The fundamentals of traditional Chinese medicine were established in the Qin and Han period.

translations.zh: 其中，张仲景奠定了中医辨证施治的基础，华佗在世界上最先施用全身药物麻醉进行大手术。
translations.en: Achievements were made in pathology, diagnosis, treatment, herbal medicine, acupuncture, and physical fitness.

translations.zh: 天文、历法与算学秦汉时期，在天文、历法与算学方面有许多重大的发现、发明。
translations.en: Astronomy, the Calendar, and Mathematics There were many achievements during the Qin and Han in the areas of astronomy, the calendar, and mathematics, including the world's earliest recording of sunspots and a nova.

translations.zh: 《周髀算经》记载了运用勾股定理做天文计算、比较复杂的分数算法等数学成就。
translations.en: The Zhou Bi Suan Jing (Zhoubi Mathematics) records astronomical calculations using the Gougu theorem (or the Pythagorean theorem) and other advanced mathematical computations.

translations.zh: 《九章算术》是周秦以至汉代我国算学发展的一部总结性的数学专著。
translations.en: Another book, Jiu Zhang Suan Shu (Nine Chapters on Mathematics), summarizes Chinese mathematics from the Warring States Period to the Han.

translations.zh: 东汉张衡发明了世界上第一台测定地震的仪器—地动仪。
translations.en: In the Eastern Han, Zhang Heng (78-139 AD) invented the seismograph, the first instrument of its kind in the world.

source.title_zh: 汉代画像石
source.title_en: Han Dynasty Stone Carvings

translations.zh: 汉代画像石常见于阙、祠堂、墓室、棺等石质建筑物或葬具上，以河南南阳、湖北北部、山东、江苏北部、安徽北部、陕西北部、山西西部、四川和重庆等地区的发现最为集中。
translations.en: Han Dynasty stone carvings are often found decorating que (gate towers), ancestral temples, burial chambers, or sarcophagi and are particularly prevalent in parts of Henan, Hubei, Shandong, Jiangsu, Anhui, Shaanxi, Shanxi, Sichuan, and Chongqing.

source.title_zh: 汉代画像石
source.title_en: Han Dynasty Stone Carvings

translations.zh: 石上画像采用线刻、浅浮雕、减地平面阴刻等技法，生动反映了当时的生产活动、社会生活和神话故事等方面的内容。
translations.en: Evocative pictures carved with incised lines or in bas-relief provide details about agricultural production, everyday life, and the myths and legends of that time.

source.title_zh: 秦汉时期的周边各族
source.title_en: Ethnic Cultures During the Qin and Han Dynasties

translations.zh: 秦汉时期，除中原地区人口众多的汉族以外，主要有北方的匈奴，东北的乌桓、鲜卑族，西北的西域各族，东南和南方的百越，西南的西南夷等。
translations.en: During the Qin and Han Dynasties, apart from the Han people who populated the Central Plains, there were the Xiongnu people in the north, the Wuhuan and Xianbei peoples in the northeast, the peoples of the Western Regions, the Baiyue people in the southeast and far south, and the Xi'nanyi people in the southwest.

source.title_zh: 秦汉时期的周边各族
source.title_en: Ethnic Cultures During the Qin and Han Dynasties

translations.zh: 各族人民创造了各具特点的文化，为多民族国家历史的发展做出了贡献。
translations.en: Diverse ethnic cultures contributed to the development of a multi-ethnic country.

translations.zh: 东北各族秦汉时期，东北地区分布着乌桓、鲜卑、夫余、沃沮、挹娄、高句骊、濊貊等族。
translations.en: Peoples in the Northeast During the Qin and Han Dynasties, the northeast areas were home to the Wuhuan, Xianbei, Fuyu, Woju, Yilou, Gaogouli, and Huimo peoples.

translations.zh: 在这些地区出土的遗物，有些与匈奴同类文物相似，又往往与汉式文物共存，表明各族的密切关系。
translations.en: Some relics discovered in these areas resemble those of the Xiongnu people and often appear together with Han-style objects-evidence of close relations between various ethnic groups.

translations.zh: 匈奴这一时期，匈奴具有发达的游牧经济和强大的军事势力。
translations.en: The Xiongnu People The Xiongnu was an ancient nomadic tribe living in the north with strong economic and military strength during the Qin and Han period.

translations.zh: 秦朝大将蒙恬曾率军出击匈奴。
translations.en: Despite clashes with the Qin and Han armies, the Xiongnu people maintained trade with the Han and it was not uncommon for daughters of the Han royal families to marry Xiongnu rulers to help improve relations.

translations.zh: 汉朝和匈奴之间也曾发生激烈的军事冲突，但又长期互通关市，多次和亲。
translations.en: During Emperor Yuandi's reign (48-33 BC), the Western Han court and the Xiongnu chief made an alliance and declared “Han and Xiongnu as one family".

translations.zh: 西汉元帝时，匈奴呼韩邪单于与汉朝立下盟约：“汉与匈奴合为一家。”
translations.en: Artifacts found in former Xiongnu areas show the coexistence of nomadic and Han stylistic traits-evidence of close contact between the two peoples.

translations.zh: 百越秦汉时期，东南沿海和南方一带的百越各族，分布在今浙江、福建地区的称东瓯、闽越，广东、广西一带的称南越、西瓯和雒越。
translations.en: The Baiyue People In the Qin and Han period, the southeast coastal areas and the south were home to peoples referred to collectively as the Baiyue .

translations.zh: 这些地区出土的文物，一些具有越文化特色，许多则具有汉式特点，呈现了汉与越人文化的融合。
translations.en: They included the Dong'ou and Minyue peoples in present-day Zhejiang and Fujian Provinces and the Nanyue, Xi'ou, and Luoyue peoples in present-day Guangdong and Guangxi.

translations.zh: 西南各族秦汉时期，居住在今云南、贵州及四川西部一带的夜郎、滇、邛都、嶲、昆明、冉、徙、白马等族，当时统称西南夷。
translations.en: Peoples in the Southwest In the Qin and Han times, ancient peoples known as the Yelang, Dian, Qiongdu, Xi, Kunming, Ranmang, Zuodu, and Baima living in present-day Yunnan, Guizhou, and western Sichuan Provinces were collectively called the Xi'nanyi.

translations.zh: 其中滇族处于发达的青铜文化阶段，青铜器上有很多反映社会面貌的装饰。
translations.en: Among them, the Dian people developed a sophisticated bronze culture as indicated in the elaborate decorations on their bronzes.

translations.zh: 汉朝在西南地区设郡，密切了西南各族与汉族之间的往来。
translations.en: In the Han Dynasty, the establishment of prefectures in the southwest encouraged interaction between the Xi'nanyi and Han peoples

translations.zh: 公元二三〇年至五八九
translations.en: 220-589AD Northern Dynasties

source.title_zh: 西域各族
source.title_en: Peoples in the Western Regions

translations.zh: 汉代的西域，是指玉门关、阳关以西包括今新疆、中亚在内的广大地区。
translations.en: In the Han Dynasty, the Western Regions referred to an area in present-day Xinjiang and Central Asia.

source.title_zh: 西域各族
source.title_en: Peoples in the Western Regions

translations.zh: 西汉初年，西域一带有乌孙、楼兰、若羌、精绝、于阗、车师、龟兹、疏勒等三十六个小国，有的从事农业，有的以游牧为主。
translations.en: In the early Western Han, this area consisted of thirty-six small agricultural or nomadic kingdoms, including Wusun, Loulan, Ruoqiang (Charkhlik), Jingjue, Yutian (Khotan), Jushi, Qiuci (Kucha), and Shule (Kashgar).

source.title_zh: 西域各族
source.title_en: Peoples in the Western Regions

translations.zh: 汉武帝派张骞通西域，加强了与西域各族的联系。
translations.en: Emperor Wudi (r. 140-87 BC) sent his envoy Zhang Qian (164-114 BC) on several diplomatic missions and successfully strengthened ties with the western peoples.

source.title_zh: 西域各族
source.title_en: Peoples in the Western Regions

translations.zh: 汉宣帝设立西域都护府，对西域广大地区施行管辖。
translations.en: Subsequently, Emperor Xuandi (r. 73-49 BC) established a protectorate to govern the Western Regions.

source.title_zh: 秦汉时期的中外交流
source.title_en: Foreign Relations In the Qin and Han Dynasties

translations.zh: 秦汉时期的对外经济、文化交流呈现新局面。
translations.en: China enjoyed a new era of foreign trade and cultural exchange.

source.title_zh: 秦汉时期的中外交流
source.title_en: Foreign Relations In the Qin and Han Dynasties

translations.zh: 西汉张骞两次出使西域，开通了一条自首都长安出发，经河西走廊、塔里木盆地，直达中亚、西亚的陆路通道。
translations.en: Zhang Qian's two diplomatic missions to the Western Regions during the Western Han opened a land route from the capital Chang'an extending westward to Central and West Asia.

source.title_zh: 秦汉时期的中外交流
source.title_en: Foreign Relations In the Qin and Han Dynasties

translations.zh: 精美的中国丝绸输往西方国家，西方的物产也传入中国。
translations.en: Merchants carried exquisite Chinese silks along this road to the west and exotic western goods travelled to China in return.

source.title_zh: 秦汉时期的中外交流
source.title_en: Foreign Relations In the Qin and Han Dynasties

translations.zh: 这条东西方交流的通道后来被称作“丝绸之路”。
translations.en: This route later became known as the Silk Road.

source.title_zh: 秦汉时期的中外交流
source.title_en: Foreign Relations In the Qin and Han Dynasties

translations.zh: 当时还加强同四邻国家的物质文化交流，开通了从西南通往今天缅甸、印度的陆上通道，开辟了从今天广东、广西和海南沿海通往今天印度和斯里兰卡的海上航线。
translations.en: Trade and cultural exchange with neighbouring countries was further enhanced by the opening of southwest land routes to present-day Myanmar and India, in addition to maritime routes from present-day Guangdong, Guangxi, and Hainan to India and Sri Lanka.

translations.zh: 农业这一时期，出现了翻车、水磨等先进农具和粮食加工机械，北方旱作地区形成了“耕一耙一糖”的耕作技术体系，南方部分地区水田使用了耕一粑”的耕作技术。
translations.en: Agriculture More advanced farming tools and grain-processing machines like square-pallet chain pump and water mill appeared during the Three Kingdoms to the Southern and Northern Dynasties period.

translations.zh: 园艺、畜牧生产也有显著提高，蚕桑生产在长江中下游地区进入发展期。
translations.en: In the dry farming areas of the north, a “ploughing, raking, and levelling"' cultivation technique was employed, while ploughing and raking alone were suitable for some paddy fields in the south.

translations.zh: 青瓷制造业的繁荣这一时期，青瓷器烧造进入了更成熟阶段，南方青瓷器制造成就尤为突出，在选料、施釉、造型和烧制技术等方面有了显著进步，瓷器产量、产区扩大，也能够烧造质量较好的黑瓷器，北朝时期还创制了白瓷器。
translations.en: Flourishing Celadon Industry From the Three Kingdoms to the Southern and Northern Dynasties, celadon production entered a mature phase, particularly in the south where advances were made in the selection of materials, glazing, modelling, and firing.

translations.zh: 多民族政权并立与民族融合东汉灭亡后，形成了魏、蜀、吴三国鼎立的局面。
translations.en: Existence of Multi-ethnic Regimes and National Integration After the fall of the Eastern Han Dynasty, three kingdoms-Wei, Shu, and Wu dominated China.

translations.zh: 此后，经历了西晋的短暂统一，中国进入一个多民族政权并立的时期，南方出现了代表门阀世族利益的东晋及南朝政权，北方则出现了主要由少数民族统治者建立的“十六国”及北朝政权。
translations.en: Following a brief period of unification in the Western Jin Dynasty, the country entered an era marked by coexisting multi-ethnic regimes.

translations.zh: 这一时期，民族融合在规模与程度上都超越以往时代，为统一的多民族的隋唐王朝建立奠定了基础。
translations.en: The south was controlled by a succession of powerful families ruling over the Eastern Jin and the Southern Dynasties.

translations.zh: 三国两晋南北朝的社会生活在三国两晋南北朝近400年间，人口的流动使不同地区、不同民族的人们在饮食、起居、服装等方面互相影响。
translations.en: Daily Life In the nearly 400 years from the Three Kingdoms to the Southern and Northern Dynasties, waves of migration created opportunities for peoples from different regions to share their food, dress, and lifestyle.

translations.zh: 汉族人以积极的姿态包容、吸取外来生活习俗，各少数民族也热衷于学习汉族的风俗礼仪，社会生活呈现出以汉族文化为主体、兼收并蓄的时代风貌。
translations.en: The Han people actively embraced different traditions and other ethnic peoples adopted Han customs as well.

translations.zh: 三国两晋南北朝的社会经济这一时期，许多政权致力于恢复和发展受战乱破坏的经济，大量荒芜田地被重新耕种，许多水利工程得以兴建，新的生产技术被采用。
translations.en: From the Three Kingdoms to the Southern and Northern Dynasties, many regimes made efforts to restore the economy damaged by successive wars.

translations.zh: 北方地区战乱频仍，经济几经破坏、复苏。
translations.en: Deserted farmlands were recultivated, irrigation works were built, and new farming technologies were adopted.

translations.zh: 南方地区处于相对安定的局面，大量人口因战乱南迁，南方劳动力明显增加，一些地区得到开发，北方生产方式、农作物也向南传播，南方经济取得新的发展。
translations.en: Continuous wars in the north resulted in frequent downturns in the economy.

translations.zh: 饮食这一时期，人口迁徙频繁，人们将自己的饮食习惯带到迁入地区，使饮食内容更加丰富。
translations.en: Eating and Drinking In the period from the Three Kingdoms to the Southern and Northern Dynasties, population migration frequently and dietary customs travelled as well, enriching Chinese cuisine.

translations.zh: 饮酒在士大夫生活中有了人文含义，促进了酿酒工艺的发展。
translations.en: Wine-drinking became a popular pastime among scholar-officials (shidafu), fostering advancements in brewing techniques.

translations.zh: 饮茶习俗开始由南向北推广，出现了专门的茶具。
translations.en: As the southern tea-drinking custom spread northward, tea set appeared.

translations.zh: 室内陈设这一时期，居室的基本格局仍沿袭汉代传统。
translations.en: Furnishings Home furnishings in the Three Kingdoms to the Southern and Northern Dynasties period basically followed Han Dynasty traditions.

translations.zh: 地面铺席，居室内普遍陈设床、榻、案、凭几、屏风等家具以及香炉、烛台等生活用具，有些家庭还摆设文房用具。
translations.en: Floors were covered with sitting mats and the furniture consisted of low-standing beds and articles for sitting or lying, tables, elbow rests, and screens.

translations.zh: 西晋以后，受游牧民族影响，垂脚坐姿开始出现，床、榻等坐具逐渐增高，产生了椅类高足坐具。
translations.en: Incense burners and candle holders were popular.

translations.zh: 歌舞魏晋南朝盛行清商乐，北魏时江南的清商乐传播到北方。
translations.en: Music and Dance A musical genre known as qingshang was popular during the Wei, Jin, and the Southern Dynasties period and spread to the north during the Northern Wei.

translations.zh: 龟兹（qiu ci）、高句丽、安国、康国、高昌、天竺等地的音乐舞蹈也传入并流行于十六国、北朝时期。
translations.en: Music and dance traditions from   Qiuci (Kucha), Goguryeo, Bokhara,  Samarkand, Gaochang, and India became fashionable in the Sixteen Kingdoms and the Northern Dynasties.

translations.zh: 服饰这一时期，服饰文化多姿多彩。
translations.en: Costumes From the Three Kingdoms to the Southern and Northern Dynasties, clothing was rich and varied.

translations.zh: 受北方少数民族服装的影响，裤的形制改善，人们较多地穿着“上衣下裤”；少数民族政权则引进了汉族政权的衣冠制度；一些北方、西部少数民族服装在内地流行。
translations.en: Influenced by the northern ethnic peoples, the style for trousers was improved and people increasingly wore a short jacket with trousers, instead of full-length robes.

translations.zh: 这些改变极大地丰富了中国古代服饰文化内容。
translations.en: The costumes of northern and western peoples became popular in Chinese inland.

translations.zh: 三国两晋南北朝的文化三国两晋南北朝是一个多元文化汇聚的时代，汉族传统文化依然保持着生机与活力，各区域文化因人口大迁移而相互影响，少数民族文化为中国文化注入新鲜血液，佛教文化则在中国土地上生根发芽。
translations.en: Culture The Three Kingdoms to the Southern and Northern Dynasties period was a time of multi-cultural interaction.

translations.zh: 中华文明在这一时期海纳百川、吐故纳新，等待着焕然一新的隋唐时代到来。
translations.en: Han traditions continued to flourish as large-scale migrations activated inter-regional cultural exchange.

translations.zh: 科学技术这一时期，出现了祖冲之等著名科学家，他们在多个领域取得卓越成就。
translations.en: Science and Technology In this period, scientists like Zu Chongzhi made significant contributions in various fields.

translations.zh: 传统中医学得到了系统的总结，出现了许多医药学著作；造纸术进一步发展，纸逐渐代替简牍成为书写材料；这一时期的科技成就还体现在机械制造、数学、天文学等方面。
translations.en: Traditional Chinese medicine was systematically developed and other works on medical science emerged.

translations.zh: 艺术这一时期，中国文字的书写方法真正成为了艺术，书体逐渐由隶、章草向楷、行、今草演化，产生了钟繇、王羲之等著名书法家。
translations.en: Art During the Three Kingdoms to the Southern and Northern Dynasties period, calligraphy became a true art form.

translations.zh: 在绘画领域，人物画依然盛行，出现了山水画与佛教画；不仅有顾恺之等杰出艺术家，还产生了比较系统的绘画理论著作。
translations.en: Calligraphy scripts and styles evolved and famous calligraphers like Zhong You and Wang Xizhi gained recognition.

translations.zh: 雕塑艺术在北朝出现了明显的进步。
translations.en: In painting, figure subjects were still popular as landscape and Buddhist paintings emerged.

translations.zh: 三国两晋南北朝时期，“丝绸之路”进一步通畅，中国与外部世界的交往扩大。
translations.en: Foreign Relations From the Three Kingdoms to the Southern and Northern Dynasties, the expansion of the Silk Road accelerated China's contact with the outside world.

translations.zh: 国内一些城市有不少外国人过往、居住，这些人不仅从事贸易，也带来了外国文化和技术。
translations.en: Foreigners could be found travelling or living in Chinese cities.

translations.zh: 佛教的广泛传播，成为中国与许多国家和地区文化交流的纽带。
translations.en: When they came to China to trade, they brought foreign culture and technology as well.

translations.zh: 海上交通也获得发展，留下了中国人关于海外国家的重要记录。
translations.en: The wide spread of Buddhism also created opportunities for cultural exchange.

translations.zh: 公元五八一年至九六八年

source.title_zh: 玄学与宗教
source.title_en: Philosophy and Religion

translations.zh: 玄学是以老庄思想为骨架，糅合儒家经义的哲学思潮，盛行于魏晋时期。
translations.en: The Three Kingdoms and Jin Dynasty saw a rise in the popularity of xuanxue (metaphysical learning), a philosophical school based on Daoist framework mixed together with Confucian thought.

source.title_zh: 玄学与宗教
source.title_en: Philosophy and Religion

translations.zh: 从十六国开始，佛教迅速传播，信徒和寺院不断增加，佛造像大量出现，佛经翻译规模空前。
translations.en: Beginning in the Sixteen Kingdoms, Buddhism spread across China quickly as believers and temples multiplied.

source.title_zh: 玄学与宗教
source.title_en: Philosophy and Religion

translations.zh: 佛教不断吸收本土文化，开始走上“中国化”的道路。
translations.en: Buddhist sculptures began to appear in large numbers and sutras were translated into Chinese on an unprecedented scale.

source.title_zh: 玄学与宗教
source.title_en: Philosophy and Religion

translations.zh: 三国以来，道教逐渐流行。
translations.en: By continuously absorbing local culture, Buddhism took roots on the Chinese land.

source.title_zh: 玄学与宗教
source.title_en: Philosophy and Religion

translations.zh: 南北朝时期，道教在经典、教义、教仪、戒律、组织形式等方面进行了改造，创立了信众居住的道馆，奠定了道教的基本格局。
translations.en: In the Three Kingdoms period, religious Daoism gained popularity and by the Southern and Northern Dynasties, a set of Daoist scriptures, doctrines, rituals, and disciplines as well as organization had been formed.

translations.zh: 统一多民族国家的发展经过300余年的分裂割据与民族融合，6世纪末，中国历史再次进入了一个兴盛的统一时代。
translations.en: A Unified Multi-ethnic Country After 300 years of division and ethnic integration, China once again entered an age of unity and prosperity near the end of the 6th century AD.

translations.zh: 隋唐以西京长安、东京洛阳为中心，统治疆域大大扩展，各民族间交往愈益密切，典章制度臻于完备，经济、文化空前繁荣，这一时期成为继秦汉之后统一的多民族国家的重要发展阶段。
translations.en: The Sui and Tang Dynasties, with a western capital at Chang'an and an eastern capital at Luoyang, enjoyed a period of significant territorial expansion, active communication between ethnic peoples, improved legal institutions, and unprecedented economic and cultural achievements.

source.title_zh: 隋唐五代的经济
source.title_en: Economy

translations.zh: 隋唐时期，社会保持较长时期安定，人口迅速增长，统治集团采取了鼓励生产的政策，因而农业、手工业、商业都得到蓬勃发展，出现了高度繁荣局面。
translations.en: The Sui and Tang Dynasties enjoyed a long period of peace and prosperity.

source.title_zh: 隋唐五代的经济
source.title_en: Economy

translations.zh: 五代十国时期，中原经济遭到破坏，但长江流域经济迅猛发展，江南渐成富庶的鱼米之乡，中国经济重心南移的历史趋势成为定局。
