translations.en: The population was rapidly expanding and policies were adopted to stimulate agricultural production, the handicraft industry, and trade.

translations.zh: 五代十国的更迭唐朝灭亡后，中原地区相继建立了后梁、后唐、后晋、后汉、后周五个王朝，史称“五代”。
translations.en: Five Dynasties and the Ten Kingdoms Following the collapse of the Tang there were five successive dynasties-the Later Liang, Later Tang, Later Jin, Later Han, and Later Zhou.

translations.zh: 淮水以南还先后存在过九个割据政权，即吴、南唐、吴越、闽、楚、荆南(南平)、前蜀、后蜀、南汉，加上割据山西的北汉，统称为“十国”。
translations.en: Nine separatist regimes located south of the Huai River-Wu, Southern Tang, Wuyue, Min, Chu, Jingnan (Nanping), Former Shu, Later Shu, and Southern Han-together with the Northern Han (in present-day Shanxi Province) are collectively referred to as the Ten Kingdoms.

translations.zh: 五代十国时期，朝代更迭频繁，各政权间战乱不断，但经济、文化方面仍有发展。
translations.en: During this period of frequent dynastic change and incessant war, there was still economic and cultural development.

translations.zh: 公元581年，外戚大丞相杨坚夺取北周政权，建立隋朝。
translations.en: In 581 AD, Yang Jian overthrew the Northern Zhou and established the Sui Dynasty.

translations.zh: 589年，隋灭南方的陈朝，统一全国，从而结束了数百年的分裂局面。
translations.en: After destroying Chen-the last of the Southern Dynasties, in 589 AD, the Sui unified the country and put an end to centuries of disunity.

translations.zh: 隋朝后期，赋役繁重、刑罚苛酷，社会矛盾加剧，各地反隋武装暴动蜂起。
translations.en: Heavy taxation, forced labour, and harsh punishment in later days ignited nation-wide unrest and in 618 AD, a coup within the ruling class brought an end to the dynasty.

translations.zh: 隋朝虽然立国只有38年，但在政治制度方面有新的建树，建立起了一整套严密的统治机构，加强了中央集权制度，经济、文化方面也出现了短暂的繁荣局面。
translations.en: Despite its short history, the Sui is credited with creating well-organized ruling institutions, strengthening central authority, and fostering a brief period of economic and cultural advancement.

translations.zh: 曲辕犁与筒车这一时期，农技与农具有很大进步，发明了曲辕犁与筒车等新型耕作、灌溉工具。
translations.en: Curved-shaft Plough and the Noria Waterwheel The Sui, Tang, and Five Dynasties period was noted for the invention of new farming and irrigating implements such as curved-shaft plough and noria waterwheel.

translations.zh: 垦田面积扩大，兴修水利较多，精耕细作趋势加强。
translations.en: Farming areas were enlarged, irrigation works were expanded, and intensive cultivation became widespread.

translations.zh: 粮食与经济作物产量大幅度增长，茶的种植逐渐广泛。
translations.en: The yield from grain and cash crops increased considerably and the planting of tea was promoted.

translations.zh: 唐朝的强盛公元618年，在隋末战乱中起兵的李渊建立唐朝，随后陆续消灭了南北各地的割据武装，再次实现统一。
translations.en: The Tang Empire The Tang Dynasty was a period in Chinese history known for its flourishing economy and culture.

translations.zh: 唐太宗李世民统治时期，实行休养生息政策，出现了天下大治局面，史称“贞观之治”。
translations.en: Established by Li Yuan in 618 AD, the Tang reunified the country by abolishing regional separatist regimes.

translations.zh: 其后的高宗、武则天使国力持续增长。
translations.en: The dynasty saw its first prosperous period in the Zhenguan Era (627-649 AD) of Emperor Taizong, who successfully implemented a policy to restore and rebuild the country.

translations.zh: 至玄宗李隆基开元时期，唐朝达到全盛，史称“开元盛世”。
translations.en: With continued growth during the reigns of Emperor Gaozong and Empress Wu, Tang reached its height in the Kaiyuan Era (713-741 AD) of Emperor Xuanzong.

translations.zh: 玄宗统治末年，爆发了边境将帅叛变的“安史之乱”，虽最终被平息，但唐王朝也由此转衰，地方势力逐渐强大，形成藩镇割据局面。
translations.en: By that time, the Tang Empire was known around the world for its vast territory, large population, and widespread influence.

translations.zh: 907年，唐朝在黄巢起义的沉重打击下，终为节度使朱温所灭。
translations.en: Nevertheless, a rebellion (755-763 AD) led by two military governors from the border regions, An Lushan and Shi Siming, created a turning point.

translations.zh: 唐代是中国古代经济、文化全面发展、高度繁荣的历史时期，唐王朝疆域辽阔、人口众多、国力雄厚，是当时世界声威远播的大帝国。
translations.en: After that, the empire continued to weaken as regional separatists gained power.

translations.zh: 丝绸、金银器、铜镜丝织及印染技术有很多创新，发展出一些新品种。
translations.en: Silk, Gold and Silver Wares, and Bronze Mirrors Innovations in silk-weaving, printing, and dyeing resulted in new varieties in textile.

translations.zh: 唐代丝绸色彩绚丽、图案新颖。
translations.en: Tang silk was famous for brilliant colours and novel designs.

translations.zh: 受中西亚金银器影响，金银器制造逐渐流行，并普遍使用切削、抛光、焊接、铆、镀、刻凿等工艺以及手摇脚踩的简单车床。
translations.en: In metalwork, craftsmen influenced by Central and West Asian products began to manufacture gold and silver wares using techniques such as cutting, polishing, welding, riveting, gilding, and carving as well as hand or pedal machines.

translations.zh: 器型、纹饰也渐从模仿西方转向中国人的审美趣味。
translations.en: Imitative shapes and designs were gradually adapted to suit Chinese tastes.

translations.zh: 铜镜也是富有时代特色的重要手工业成果。
translations.en: Bronze mirrors were another important handicraft representative of this period.

translations.zh: 开元通宝在农业、手工业发展的基础上，这一时期商业较前代繁荣、进步，绢帛虽然继续当作辅币使用，但铸钱大量通行。
translations.en: Currency With developments in agriculture and the handicraft industry, trade became more active.

translations.zh: 开元通宝钱的铸造和流布，使五铁钱从此退出了货币流通领域，在钱币史上具有划时代的意义。
translations.en: While silk was still used as a form of currency, coins were in wide circulation.

translations.zh: 隋唐五代的社会生活经济的繁荣、物质的丰富使得社会生活质量大有提高，人们的衣食住行更加精致、多彩。
translations.en: Daily Life During the Sui, Tang, and Five Dynasties period, economic prosperity and an abundance of goods raised the standards of living and the quality of everyday life.

translations.zh: 各民族及中外交流的空前频繁，使得社会生活呈现出开放和多种文化习俗融合的时代特色。
translations.en: Unprecedented interaction between ethnic peoples and with foreign cultures created an open for customs and traditions to intermingle.

translations.zh: 服饰推陈出新，更加绚丽多彩，饮食增加了许多新品种，“胡服”、“胡妆”、“胡食”和“胡乐”曾流行一时，妇女有骑马出游之风，马球等娱乐竞技活动也盛行起来。
translations.en: This period was noted for diverse and novel clothing styles, innovative food, and new forms of entertainment like polo.

translations.zh: 文体娱乐歌舞戏、杂技在宫廷和民间的庆典及宴饮中都是不可或缺的助兴节目；打马球、狩猎、下围棋等文娱活动也深受人们的喜爱。
translations.en: Entertainment Dramas featuring music and dance and acrobatic performances were common entertainment for celebrations or banquets at court or among the people. Polo, hunting, and the Chinese board game weiqi were also favourite recreational activities.

translations.zh: 建筑与雕版印刷这一时期存留下来的建筑设计独到、制作技术精湛，显示了古人的智慧和才能；雕版印刷始于初唐之际，由源远流长的印章、碑拓及织物印花等技术发展而来，9世纪已相当普及。
translations.en: Architecture and Block-printing Standing in front of surviving architecture from the Sui, Tang, and Five Dynasties period, one marvels at the unique design, skilled workmanship, and the talent of people in ancient times.

translations.zh: 雕版印刷术的发明对文化的传播起了很大作用。
translations.en: Engraved woodblock-printing first appeared in the early Tang, adopting techniques from seal-carving, stone rubbings, and textile-printing.

translations.zh: 衣冠服饰这一时期，礼服仍沿袭传统的高冠革履、宽袍大袖。
translations.en: Costumes and Accessories From the Sui to the Five Dynasties, formal dress still followed the traditional high hat, loose robe with large sleeves, and leather shoes.

translations.zh: 唐代男子的便服吸收了胡服遍窄紧身和圆领、开衩等特点，穿圆领袍、裹幞头、系腰带、长靿靴成为从皇帝到平民日常生活的主要着装。
translations.en: Hu elements such as close-fitting robe with round neck and side slits were evident in men's casual clothes in the Tang Dynasty.

translations.zh: 女装多由裙、衫及帔组成。
translations.en: Female dress usually consisted of an upper garment, skirt, and embroidered shawl.

translations.zh: 唐代妇女还以着男装、胡装为一时风尚，面部化妆繁复，发式也多种花样。
translations.en: In addition, it was fashionable for Tang women to dress up in men's clothing or hu-style costumes and to wear elaborate make-up and hairstyles.

translations.zh: 诗歌诗在唐代文学中成就最高，流传至今的将近五万首，许多反映了丰富的社会生活，具有完美的艺术形式。
translations.en: Poetry Poetry represented the height of Tang literary achievements.

translations.zh: 李白、杜甫、白居易是最著名的诗人。
translations.en: Many of the nearly 50,000 poems handed down to today's readers possess superb artistic quality and offer a colourful glimpse of life in those days.

translations.zh: 饮食起居这一时期，主食有饼、饭、粥、糕等，副食更为丰富；烹调方法仍以蒸、煮、烙、烧、煎、炸、烤为主；饮酒非常普遍。
translations.en: Food and Lifestyle People in the Sui, Tang, and the Five Dynasties usually had rice, porridge, and baked or steamed cakes as staple food together with a variety of other dishes.

translations.zh: 8世纪以后，南方的饮茶之习，风靡全国。
translations.en: Cooking methods included steaming, boiling, baking, frying, and roasting.

translations.zh: 家具逐渐由矮变高，人们由席地起居向垂足高坐转变。
translations.en: Wine was a common beverage.

translations.zh: 隋朝时，出行仍然主要乘坐牛车，到了唐代，驴、马成为主要的代步工具。
translations.en: Beginning in the 8th century, tea-drinking, a custom that originated in the south, became popular throughout the country.

translations.zh: 唐五代的文化这一时期，文学、艺术、科技等诸多方面都取得辉煌成就。
translations.en: Culture During the Sui, Tang, and the Five Dynasties there were outstanding achievements in literature, art, science, and technology.

translations.zh: 唐诗辉耀千古，成为中华文化奇葩。
translations.en: Masterpieces of calligraphy, painting, sculpture, and Tang poetry demonstrate the artistic splendours of that time; the fusion of music and dance with foreign elements further enhanced the arts.

translations.zh: 建筑、天文、历法、地理、史学、医药、造纸等诸方面都取得重大进步，雕版印刷更是中国古代科技史上的重要发明创造。
translations.en: Important progress was made in architecture, astronomy, the calendar, geography, historiography, medicine, and papermaking as well as one of China's most significant scientific and technological inventions block-printing.

translations.zh: 佛、道二教也在这一时期走向兴盛，对思想、文化等都产生了深刻影响。
translations.en: Buddhism and Daoism flourished and had a profound influence on contemporary thought and culture.

translations.zh: 书画与雕塑这一时期，书法吸收了南北朝的优秀成果，并创造出崭新的风格，欧阳询、颜真卿、柳公权为楷书集大成者；山水、仕女、花鸟画开创一代新风，敦煌、龙门石窟以及唐墓中的雕塑、壁画更是举世闻名的艺术瑰宝。
translations.en: Calligraphy, Painting, and Sculpture During the Sui, Tang, and the Five Dynasties, calligraphers assimilated the outstanding achievements of the Southern and Northern Dynasties to create new styles.

translations.zh: 隋唐时期的边疆民族隋唐时期，许多边疆民族建立了政权，其中最重要的是北方的突厥、回（后改称回纥），西南的吐蕃、南诏以及东北的渤海。
translations.en: Ethnic Cultures During the Sui and Tang Dynasties, ethnic peoples in the frontier areas established independent regimes, including the Turks and Uighurs (Huihe, later called Huihu) in the north, the Tubo and Nanzhao in the southwest, and the Bohai in the northeast.

translations.zh: 中原王朝执行了较为开明的民族政策，各民族间的交往空前频繁。
translations.en: As a result of the open ethnic policy adopted by the Sui and Tang rulers, interaction between different peoples was far greater than before.

translations.zh: 边疆各族吸收了汉族先进的经济、文化成就，同时也对汉族的生活和文化产生了强烈影响。
translations.en: Frontier peoples learned from the economic and cultural achievements of the Han people and at the same time became an important influence contributing to Han lifestyle and culture.

translations.zh: 一些边疆民族政权虽然与中原王朝发生过纠纷和战争，但总体上说，各民族之间进一步融合，多民族统一国家日益发展壮大。
translations.en: Despite occasional conflicts, ethnic integration continued to strengthen the unified China as a multi-ethnic country

source.title_zh: 长安与丝绸之路的拓展
source.title_en: Chang'an and the Extended Silk Road

translations.zh: 长安是隋唐两代的首都，长安城的宏伟和繁华反映了唐代国力的强盛和文化昌明。
translations.en: Chang'an (present-day Xi'an), the capital of the Sui and Tang Dynasties, was a magnificent city that embodied the glories of the Tang Empire.

source.title_zh: 长安与丝绸之路的拓展
source.title_en: Chang'an and the Extended Silk Road

translations.zh: 长安也是国际性大都市，是当时丝绸之路的主要起点和东西方文化交流、经济贸易的中心。
translations.en: It was an international metropolis, a major starting point of the Silk Road, and a centre that connected cultures and trade traveling east and west.

source.title_zh: 长安与丝绸之路的拓展
source.title_en: Chang'an and the Extended Silk Road

translations.zh: 隋唐时期，丝绸之路达到极盛，海上交通的规模也远超前代。
translations.en: Silk Road trade peaked in the Sui and Tang along with unprecedented increase in the scale of maritime traffic.

source.title_zh: 长安与丝绸之路的拓展
source.title_en: Chang'an and the Extended Silk Road

translations.zh: 中华文明在亚洲各国广泛传播，并远达欧洲、非洲，同时也因积极吸取外来文化而更加丰富多彩。
translations.en: As Chinese culture spread throughout Asia and beyond to Europe and Africa,China was also enriched by actively embracing foreign cultures in return

translations.zh: 长安城唐长安城分宫城（皇帝起居、处理朝政之地）、皇城（衙署区）和外郭城三部分，周长36.7公里，面积84平方公里；外郭城分成居民区和作为商业区的东、西市；大明宫为唐朝主要皇宫，面积3.2平方公里，是北京明清故宫的4.5倍。
translations.en: Chang'an City Chang'an during the Tang Dynasty consisted of the palace city (emperor's residence and court), the imperial city (government office district), and the outer city (residential and market areas).

translations.zh: 长安城内居民约百万，住有各国使臣、留学生、僧侣和商人数万人。
translations.en: The entire city measured 36.7 kilometres in circumference and covered an area of 84 square kilometres.

translations.zh: 长安城的规划与建设也影响了日本、朝鲜等国家。
translations.en: Daming Palace the main royal palace—was 3.2 square kilometres in area (4.5 times the size of the Forbidden City in Beijing).

translations.zh: 中外交流隋唐时期，更多的丝绸等商品沿着横越亚洲腹地的丝绸之路，源源输往西方。
translations.en: Foreign Relations During the Sui and Tang Dynasties, silk and other products travelled along the Silk Road across Asia and further west.

translations.zh: 唐中期后，随着造船和航海技术的进步，丝绸、陶瓷等大宗商品较多地取道海上输出。
translations.en: In the middle Tang, progress in shipbuilding and navigation facilitated the transport of silk, ceramics, and other commodities by sea.

translations.zh: 唐朝优异的文化，特别是造纸、丝绸等先进工艺传布到亚欧各地，西方的文化也传入中国。
translations.en: The splendid cultural achievements of the Tang particularly papermaking and silk—spread to the rest of Asia and Europe and western culture was introduced to China as well.

translations.zh: 契丹是中国古代北方民族之一。
translations.en: Qidan (Khitan) was an ancient ethnic people in north China.

translations.zh: 10世纪初，契丹族首领耶律阿保机统一契丹各部，公元916年，阿保机称帝，建立契丹（辽）政权。
translations.en: After unifying the Qidan tribes in the early 10th century, their chieftain Yeli Abaoji proclaimed himself emperor and founded the Liao Dynasty in 916 AD.

translations.zh: 公元1125年，辽为金所灭。
translations.en: The Liao was overthrown by the Jin Dynasty in 1125.

translations.zh: 党项族是我国古代西北民族之一，属于羌族的一支。
translations.en: Dangxiang (Tangut) was an ancient people in northwest China and a branch of the Qiang people.

translations.zh: 公元1038年，元昊正式称帝，国号大夏，史称西夏。
translations.en: In 1038, the Dangxiang leader Yuan Hao proclaimed himself emperor and established the Daxia Dynasty (referred to as the Xixia).

translations.zh: 公元1227年，西夏为蒙古所灭。
translations.en: The Mongols destroyed the Xixia Dynasty in 1227.

translations.zh: 辽宋夏金元时期的经济两宋时期，经济重心转向南方。
translations.en: Economy In the Song Dynasty, China's economic centre moved to the south.

translations.zh: 租契约关系在城乡普遍推行，农民独立工商业者迅速增多，商品经济空前活跃，大城市增多，草市遍及乡镇，并出现了世界上最早的纸币。
translations.en: Tenancy contracts were common in the urban and rural areas.

translations.zh: 元朝的统一结束了以往各地区的经济分隔，农业得到恢复，工商业日趋繁荣。
translations.en: The unification of China in the Yuan Dynasty ended regional economic fragmentation, restored agricultural production, and revitalized trade and industry.

translations.zh: 女真族是我国古代东北部民族之一。
translations.en: Nüzhen (Jurchen) was an ancient people living in northeast China.

translations.zh: 12世纪初，完颜部首领阿骨打统一女真各部，公元1115年建立了金政权。
translations.en: In the early 12th century, Aguda, leader of the Wanyan tribe, unified the Nüzhen tribes and established the Jin Dynasty in 1115.

translations.zh: 公元1125和1127年，金先后攻灭辽和北宋，占领了淮河以北的广大地区，长期与南宋对。
translations.en: After overthrowing the Liao in 1125 and the Northern Song in 1127, the Jin occupied the vast region north of the Huai River and confronted the Southern Song.

translations.zh: 公元1234年，金为蒙古所灭。
translations.en: In 1234, the Jin Dynasty fell to the Mongols.

translations.zh: 种植业和纺织业的进步这一时期的农学取得较大成就，出现了一批总结生产经验的农书。
translations.en: Progress in Crop Production and Textiles From the Liao and Song to the Yuan Dynasty, achievements were made in agronomy, as demonstrated in numerous books from that time introducing agricultural production.

translations.zh: 农业科技知识得到普及和提高，种植业和纺织业取得进步，垦田面积显著增长，先进农具得到推广，南北农作物品种得到交流，提高了单位面积产量。
translations.en: The broad dissemination of agriculture techniques and knowledge was beneficial to crop production and the textile industry.

translations.zh: 纸币的广泛使用中国是世界上最早使用纸币的国家。
translations.en: Wide Circulation of Paper Currency The world's first paper currency called “Jiaozi" appeared in China in the late 10th century AD.

translations.zh: 10世纪末，民间已经出现了最早的纸币——交子。
translations.en: During the Song and Jin Dynasties, different official paper currencies were issued.

translations.zh: 两宋先后发行过钱引、会子、关子等纸币，金朝也发行过交钞。
translations.en: After unification of China in the Yuan Dynasty, government-issued “Baochao" became the only legal currency.

translations.zh: 元朝统一以后，政府发行的宝钞成为唯一合法货币。
translations.en: “Baochao" was first fixed to the value of silk and later to a silver standard, contributing to the development of a mature paper currency system.

translations.zh: 度量衡为了避免使用上的混乱，宋、元政府都制定了严格的度量衡制度，严禁民间私造。
translations.en: Weights and Measures The Song and Yuan governments had strict control over weights and measures and prohibited private participation.

translations.zh: 宋代由中央直接制作和管理度量衡器，元代则是由中央颁发标准器，省级行政单位负责制作和管理。
translations.en: During the Song Dynasty, the production and administration of instruments for weights and measures was directly under central control.

translations.zh: 商业标识的应用商品经济的日趋繁荣使市场竞争更为激烈，出现了中国现存最早的广告和商标。
translations.en: Trademarks Increased prosperity in the commodity economy led to greater competition and the emergence of advertising and branding.

translations.zh: 商业标识在商业活动中被广泛应用，标志着社会经济发展进入了新的阶段。
translations.en: The wide use of trademarks signalled a new stage of economic development.

translations.zh: 日常用具在城市中，商品经济的繁盛刺激和影响了社会风尚，人们普遍追求更为精致和奢华的生活方式，由此带动了手工业的发展，日常用品种类丰富，工艺日益精湛。
translations.en: Daily Utensils The flourishing commodity economy had considerable influence on urban lifestyle.

translations.zh: 辽宋夏金元时期的社会生活城市的发展对这一时期的社会生活产生重大影响，市民阶层逐渐壮大，带动了商品市场和城市文化的繁荣发展。
translations.en: Daily Life The growth of cities had a great impact on society and lifestyle during the period from the Liao and Song to the Yuan Dynasty.

translations.zh: 人们对生活消费提出了更高要求，衣食住行与市场形成了前所未有的紧密关系，日常用品趋于精致华美，种类十分丰富。
translations.en: The rise in city residents accelerated a boom in urban commerce and culture.

translations.zh: 在精神生活领域，娱乐活动逐渐走向商业化、平民化，宗教信仰呈现多元化的局面。
translations.en: Higher standards for everyday consumption linked the market to daily necessities and a demand for more exquisite and diverse products.

translations.zh: 饮食文化经济的进步、城市的兴起和教育的普及促进了饮食文化的发展，国内各民族的饮食风俗互相交流，发达的中外交通又带来了其他国家和地区的影响。
translations.en: Eating and Drinking Economic progress, the rise of cities, and the spread of education contributed to the development of food culture.

translations.zh: 制瓷业的发展这一时期，名窑名瓷驰名中外，生产技术和产量都超过前代。
translations.en: Porcelain Production The Liao and Song to Yuan Dynasty period is noted for famous kilns and fine porcelain as well as advancements in ceramic technology and output.

translations.zh: 宋代的五大名窑、元代的青花和釉里红代表了当时制瓷业的发展水平
translations.en: The so-called “Five Famous Kilns" of the Song, together with the blue-and-white and underglaze red porcelain of the Yuan, best exemplify the outstanding achievements in the porcelain industry at that time.

translations.zh: 带有游牧文化色彩的北方地区陶瓷器辽和西夏的陶瓷受到中原技术的影响，又具有鲜明的游牧民族特色以及地方特色。
translations.en: Northern Ceramics with Nomadic Characteristics Ceramics of the Liao and Xixia Dynasties demonstrate both the influence of the Central Plains and distinctive nomadic cultural traditions.

translations.zh: 五大名窑官窑、哥窑、汝窑、定窑、钧窑被后世誉为宋代五大名窑。
translations.en: The kilns of Guan, Ge, Ru, Ding and Jun are known as the “Five Famous Kilns” of the Song Dynasty.

translations.zh: 官窑是指由中央官府开设的窑场，专门烧制御用瓷器。
translations.en: The Guan Kilns refer to those set up by the central government to produce porcelain for imperial use.

translations.zh: 哥窑相传由南宋章氏兄弟中的哥哥创立，确切窑址目前不详。
translations.en: The Ge Kilns were said to be founded in the Southern Song Dynasty by the elder brother from the Zhang family and their exact location is still unknown.

translations.zh: 汝窑因位于宋代汝州而得名，在北宋末年专为宫廷烧制瓷器，传世作品极少。
translations.en: The Ru Kilns, named after their location at Ruzhou, produced porcelain for imperial use in the late Northern Song and only a few of their products were handed down to today.

translations.zh: 定窑创烧于唐朝后期，因位于定州（今河北曲阳）而得名。
translations.en: The Ding Kilns, named after their location at Dingzhou (present-day Quyang, Hebei Province), were set up in the late Tang.

translations.zh: 钧窑位于今河南禹县，其中钧台八卦洞窑是北宋末年建立的官窑，专门烧造宫廷陈设器。
translations.en: Among the Jun Kilns (at present-day Yuxian, Henan Province), the Baguadong Kiln at Juntai was an imperial kiln established in the late Northern Song specializing in decorative objects for imperial use.

translations.zh: 医学宋代有比较完备的医药管理组织，官、私编修的医书、药书流传至今的多达30部。
translations.en: Medical Science An elaborate medical administrative system was established in the Song Dynasty and thirty medical and pharmaceutical books compiled officially or by individuals survive to today.

translations.zh: 针灸学和针灸铜人的铸造是医学上的另一突出成就。
translations.en: Acupuncture, moxibustion, and the casting of bronze figure models were another medical achievement of that time.

translations.zh: 元朝政府非常重视医学，来自阿拉伯地区和其他少数民族的理论和知识丰富了元朝的医学。
translations.en: Medical science was generously supported by the Yuan government and was enriched by medical theories and knowledge from the Arabic world and other ethnic groups.

source.title_zh: 以青花和釉里红为代表的元代瓷器
source.title_en: Blue-and-white and Underglaze Red Porcelain of the Yuan Dynasty

translations.zh: 元代的制瓷技术和装饰艺术都达到了新的高度，用釉下彩技术烧制的青花和釉里红瓷器在中国陶瓷发展史上具有重要地位。
translations.en: In the Yuan Dynasty, porcelain manufacturing techniques and decorative designs reached a higher level.

source.title_zh: 以青花和釉里红为代表的元代瓷器
source.title_en: Blue-and-white and Underglaze Red Porcelain of the Yuan Dynasty

translations.zh: 枢府窑是元朝时景德镇烧制官府定制瓷器的一个窑口，有“枢府”二字得名；
translations.en: A new technique in which colour was applied under glaze, as found in blue-and-white and underglaze red porcelain, constitutes a major achievement in the history of Chinese ceramics.

source.title_zh: 以青花和釉里红为代表的元代瓷器
source.title_en: Blue-and-white and Underglaze Red Porcelain of the Yuan Dynasty

translations.zh: 元代龙泉窑的地位更加突出，影响浙江、福建、江西等省许多成品上的制瓷业形成特有的青瓷窑系，产品远销到东亚、东非、阿拉伯各国。
translations.en: The Shufu Kilns set up at present-day Jingdezhen, Jiangxi Province in the Yuan Dynasty produced porcelain tailored for the government.

translations.zh: 娱乐生活在这一时期的都市中，出现了表演戏曲、曲艺、杂技等艺术形式的场所——瓦舍、勾栏。
translations.en: Entertainment During the period from the Liao and Song to the Yuan Dynasty, public places appeared where the audience could watch the performing arts like xiqu (Chinese opera), quyi (local-flavoured talking and singing), and acrobatics.

translations.zh: 从宋杂剧和金院本发展而来的元杂剧是中国第一种成熟的戏剧形式，是中国戏剧史上的里程碑。
translations.en: Yuan Dynasty zaju (poetic drama set to music) is the earliest mature form of drama in China and a milestone in the history of Chinese drama.

translations.zh: 印刷术的普及与火药、指南针的应用北宋时期雕版印刷得到普及，同时出现了活字印刷；火药、指南针在这一时期被广泛应用。
translations.en: Printing Technology, Gunpowder, and Compass In the Northern Song Dynasty, block-printing became widespread and the more advanced movable-type printing was invented.

translations.zh: 这些发明先后传入亚、欧各国，对世界科学文化的发展起到了巨大的推进作用
translations.en: Gunpowder and the compass were also in wide use.

translations.zh: 中外交通与海外贸易这一时期，海外贸易和中外交通得到空前发展，加强了我国与亚、欧、非各国的经济、文化交流，增进了各国人民间的友谊。
translations.en: Foreign Trade and Transportation The period from the Liao and Song to the Yuan Dynasty witnessed unprecedented expansion in overseas trade and foreign relations that strengthened economic and cultural connections between China and other Asian, European, and African countries.

translations.zh: 宗教活动这一时期，各种宗教都非常活跃，尤其在进入元代后，由于统治者采取兼容并蓄政策，推动了各种宗教的发展。
translations.en: Religions Various religions were active in China during the period spanning the Liao and Song to the Yuan Dynasty.

translations.zh: 汉传佛教和道教仍然在中原和南方地区占据主要地位，藏传佛教得到统治者的大力弘扬，伊斯兰教逐渐趋于本地化，基督教也得到传播。
translations.en: The Yuan court's policy of religious tolerance encouraged the expansion of many religions.

translations.zh: 天文与算学宋代曾进行过五次天文观测，并绘制成星图。
translations.en: Astronomy and Mathematics In the Song Dynasty, five astronomical observations were conducted and star charts were made.

translations.zh: 水运仪象台集观测、记录、报时为一体，遥遥领先于世界。
translations.en: China's water-powered astronomical clock tower for observation, record-keeping, and time measurement surpassed the rest of the world at that time.

translations.zh: 元代天文学的规模和学术性都超越前代，阿拉伯天文学在元代也有一定影响。
translations.en: In the Yuan Dynasty, the scale and level of astronomical activity were unprecedented and Arabic astronomy was influential.

translations.zh: 这一时期出现了众多知名的数学家，其成果为后世所景仰
translations.en: This period also produced many famous mathematicians whose remarkable achievements influenced later generations.

translations.zh: 交通与地理学的发展海外贸易推动了对航路的探索，中国海船远航亚欧数十个国家和地区。
translations.en: Transportation and Progress in Geography Stimulated by foreign trade, Chinese ships explored new sea routes to reach countries and regions in Asia and Europe.

translations.zh: 元代在国内水陆交通要道遍设驿站，又修整京杭大运河，沟通了南北水路。
translations.en: In the Yuan Dynasty, courier stations were set up along major water and land routes and the Grand Canal was rebuilt to connect the north and the south.

translations.zh: 发达的交通带来地理学的进步，根据现存史料，中国是最早在地图上画出好望角的国家。
translations.en: Improved transportation resulted in greater knowledge about world geography.

translations.zh: 建筑这一时期，中国的木结构建筑日臻完美，建筑形式丰富，技术高超，而且吸收了一些外来建筑的技术和风格。
translations.en: Architecture During the period from the Liao and Song to the Yuan Dynasty, traditional Chinese wood-constructed architecture was perfected, exhibiting many styles and superb techniques.

translations.zh: 各民族创制的文字这一时期，少数民族在建立政权后创制了文字。
translations.en: Scripts Invented by Ethnic Peoples During the Liao, Song, Xixia, Jin, and Yuan period, some ethnic regimes established their own written languages.

translations.zh: 这些文字虽然随着政权的衰亡而逐渐消失，但对当时文化的传播和交流发挥了重要的作用。
translations.en: Although the scripts became extinct after the regimes fell, their existence played an important role in cross-cultural communication.

translations.zh: 天文与算学宋代曾进行过五次天文观测，并绘制成星图。
translations.en: Astronomy and Mathematics In the Song Dynasty, five astronomical observations were conducted and star charts were made.

translations.zh: 水运仪象台集观测、记录、报时为一体，遥遥领先于世界。
translations.en: China's water-powered astronomical clock tower for observation, record-keeping, and time measurement surpassed the rest of the world at that time.

translations.zh: 元代天文学的规模和学术性都超越前代，阿拉伯天文学在元代也有一定影响。
translations.en: In the Yuan Dynasty, the scale and level of astronomical activity were unprecedented and Arabic astronomy was influential.

translations.zh: 这一时期出现了众多知名的数学家，其成果为后世所景仰。
translations.en: This period also produced many famous mathematicians whose remarkable achievements influenced later generations.

translations.zh: 海上丝绸之路与中外贸易以农业、手工业和国内商品经济为基础，加之指南针在航海上的应用，这一时期的海外贸易通过官办和私营两种途径大大扩展，史称海上丝绸之路。
translations.en: The Maritime Silk Road and Foreign Trade With a strong domestic economy based on agriculture, handicrafts, and other commodities, in addition to the use of the compass at sea, foreign trade (governmental and private) expanded significantly along routes known as the Maritime Silk Road during this period.

translations.zh: 广州、泉州、明州(今浙江宁波)等地成为对外贸易的主要港口，并设有官方管理机构。
translations.en: Guangzhou, Quanzhou, and Mingzhou (present-day Ningbo, Zhejiang Province) became principal ports for foreign trade and were set up with government administrations.

translations.zh: 当时的对外贸易，东达朝鲜、日本，西至非洲东岸、北岸各国。
translations.en: China's trading partners included the Korean Peninsula, Japan, and countries on the east and north coasts of Africa.

translations.zh: 中外文化交流也随之更为密切。
translations.en: Closer cultural relations were established with countries overseas.

translations.zh: 宋词与元曲这一时期的文学也呈现出繁荣景象，宋词和元曲是其中最具代表性的文学形式，涌现了大批优秀作家和经典作品，在文学史上占有重要地位。
translations.en: Literature During this period, literature flourished as exemplified by two literary genres: ci (poetic rhymes in different sentence patterns set to melodies) of the Song Dynasty and qu (loose colloquial rhymes set to melodies) of the Yuan Dynasty. A proliferation of outstanding writers and classical works emerged to occupy an important place in the history of Chinese literature.

translations.zh: 史学这一时期是中国史学的又一个高峰，官方、民间修史都很活跃，对当代史的研究也很发达，产生了通鉴体、纪事本末体等新的历史编篆体例，出现了我国考古学的前身一金石学。
translations.en: Historiography The period from the Liao and Song to the Yuan Dynasty marked another high point in Chinese historiography.

translations.zh: 辽宋夏金元时期的文化宋代是文化高度繁荣的时期，元代文化则体现出多元性。
translations.en: Culture flourished in the Song Dynasty and grew increasingly diverse in the Yuan Dynasty.

translations.zh: 这一时期，哲学、文学、史学、艺术诸领域涌现出众多的名家和名作，多个民族创制了自己的文字，天文、数学、医药学、火药、印刷术、指南针、造船技术等都居于世界前列，并通过丝绸之路远播海外，对世界科学技术的发展做出了巨大贡献。
translations.en: There was a proliferation of great masters and important works in philosophy, literature, historiography, and art.

translations.zh: 理学的发端理学是由北宋的程颢、程颐、周敦颐、张载及邵雍在传统儒学基础上发展出来的新思想体系，到了南宋时期由朱熹发扬光大，从元代开始成为官方正统思想，对后世产生了极大的影响。
translations.en: The Emergence of Neo-Confucianism Lixue or Neo-Confucianism was a new system of ideas developed from traditional Confucianism first by Northern Song scholars Cheng Hao (1032-1085), Cheng Yi (1033-1107), Zhou Dunyi (1017-1073), Shao Yong (1011-1077), and Zhang Zai (1020-1078) and later enhanced by the Southern Song philosopher Zhu Xi (1130-1200).

translations.zh: 明朝的建立公元1368年，明太祖朱元璋在南京称帝，建立明朝。
translations.en: Establishment of the Ming Dynasty In 1368, Zhu Yuanzhang (later known as Emperor Taizu) established the Ming Dynasty at Nanjing.

translations.zh: 公元1421年，明成祖朱将都城迁至北京。
translations.en: In 1421, Emperor Chengzu moved the capital to Beijing.

translations.zh: 明朝建立后，朱元璋制订新律例，改革政治、军事和监察制度，集立法、行政、司法、军事和监察大权于一身，使中央集权专制统治达到前所未有的高峰。
translations.en: Upon founding the Ming, Emperor Taizu formulated new laws and introduced reforms that concentrated the legislative, administrative, jurisdictional, military, and supervisory powers in his hands.

source.title_zh: 明朝的经济与社会生活
source.title_en: Economy and Daily Life in the Ming Dynasty

translations.zh: 明朝初年，朱元璋实行安养生息的政策，使社会生产得到了恢复和发展。
translations.en: In the early Ming Dynasty, Emperor Taizu (r. 1368-1398) implemented encouraging policies to restore and develop production.

source.title_zh: 明朝的经济与社会生活
source.title_en: Economy and Daily Life in the Ming Dynasty

translations.zh: 明朝中后期，随着商品经济的发展，在某些行业内出现了新的生产方式。
translations.en: By the mid-to-late Ming, growth in the commodity economy led to new modes of production in certain industries.

source.title_zh: 明朝的经济与社会生活
source.title_en: Economy and Daily Life in the Ming Dynasty

translations.zh: 人们的生活方式和价值观念也发生若干变化，崇尚奢华、追求个性成为一时风尚。
translations.en: Lifestyles and social values began to change as the pursuit of luxury and individuality became fashionable.

translations.zh: 青花瓷青花瓷是明代瓷器的主流，其中以永乐、宣德两朝最盛。
translations.en: Blue-and-white Porcelain Blue-and-white porcelain was the mainstream porcelain during the Ming dynasty and flourished during the reign of Yongle and Xuande.

translations.zh: 釉层晶莹厚肥，青花色泽浓艳，一些新器形受到中东伊斯兰风格的影响。
translations.en: The glazes were crystal-clear and thick.

translations.zh: 青料为南洋进口的“苏勃泥青”，蓝中泛有黑斑，这种自然形成的黑斑和鲜艳的青蓝色相映成趣。
translations.en: Blue-and-white outlines showed bright colours and luster. Some new types of porcelain ware featured in elements of the Islamic style. The cobalt blue pigment was “Sumatra blue" imported from Southern Asia. It contains naturally formed black spots and sets a delightful contrast with the bright blue.

translations.zh: 农业与治河明朝初年，朱元璋采取移民垦荒，兴修水利，奖励耕织，劝课农桑，减免战乱地区百姓的租税和谣役等措施，使农业生产得到恢复和发展。
translations.en: Agriculture and Harnessing the Yellow River In the early Ming Dynasty, Emperor Taizu moved people to desolate areas to cultivate wasteland, built water conservancy works, encouraged farming and sericulture, and reduced or remitted taxation and forced labour in war-torn areas.

translations.zh: 明朝中后期，玉米、甘薯等高产农作物相继传入并得到推广，使粮食种类大为丰富。
translations.en: These measures helped to restore and foster agricultural production.

translations.zh: 明朝末年，潘季驯多次受命治理黄河。
translations.en: During the mid-to-late Ming, maize and sweet potatoes were introduced to China and widely grown.

translations.zh: 他采取“束水攻沙”和蓄清刷黄”的治河方针，取得了较好的治河效果，化水害为水利，保证了农业生产的顺利进行。
translations.en: A late Ming official named Pan Jixun successfully controlled flooding along the Yellow River and aided agricultural production.

translations.zh: 郑和下西洋西洋”是指今文莱以西的东南亚和印度洋沿岸地区。
translations.en: Voyages by Zheng He The great Chinese maritime explorer, Zheng He (1371-1434), made seven voyages in the Ming Dynasty to the Southeast Asian countries west of present-day Brunei and the coastal areas of the Indian Ocean.

translations.zh: 郑和七下西洋，体现了明朝船舶制造和航海技术的伟大成就，其规模之大，航程之远，实为世界航海史上之壮举
translations.en: His expeditions demonstrate the Ming Dynasty achievements in shipbuilding and maritime navigation in terms of scale and distance and were remarkable in the world history of navigation.

translations.zh: 明朝的对外关系公元1405-1433年，明朝派遣郑和率领庞大舰队七下“西洋”，极大地促进了中国与东南亚、南亚以及非洲各国的友好往来。
translations.en: Foreign Relations in the Ming Dynasty Between 1405 and 1433, the Ming government dispatched the famous maritime explorer Zheng He (1371-1434) and his fleet on epoch-making expeditions to the Indian Ocean.

translations.zh: 明代与朝鲜的关系密切，与日本的关系因寇的侵扰以及日本发动侵朝战争而受到破坏。
translations.en: Zheng He's expeditions resulted in friendly ties with countries in Southeast Asia, South Asia, and Africa.

translations.zh: 从16世纪开始，随着新航路的开辟，欧洲人陆续东来，中西方文明开始直接碰撞和交流，中外关系出现了新的内容。
translations.en: While China maintained close contacts with Korea, relations with Japan were impaired by Japanese pirate attacks along China's coast and Japan's wars against Korea.

translations.zh: 手工业明代蚕丝生产发展迅速，出现了许多蚕丝生产基地。
translations.en: Handicrafts In the Ming Dynasty, silk production developed rapidly and some towns became renowned for their silk products.

translations.zh: 丝织技术有所进步，工艺“巧变百出，花色日新”。
translations.en: Advances in weaving resulted in new varieties and patterns in silk textiles.

translations.zh: 棉布产量很大，松江布远销全国各地，有“衣被天下”之称。
translations.en: Cotton cloth production expanded greatly, particularly in Songjiang.

translations.zh: 用新技术、新工艺和新材料制作出来的甜白、斗彩、五彩等瓷器，造型美观，色彩丰富，无论是意境还是形式均臻于完美。
translations.en: Elegant and colourful porcelain wares manufactured with new technologies and materials-such as tianbai (sweet white), doucai (contending colours), and wucai (polychrome) attained artistic perfection.

translations.zh: 冶金技术趋于成熟，体型巨大的永乐大钟、锋利坚韧的钢质武器、配比精到的宣德铜器等均有盛名。
translations.en: Metallurgy achieved a level of maturity, resulting in the famous Grand Yongle Bell as well as strong steel weapons and the copper wares of the Xuande Era(1426-1435)

source.title_zh: 商品经济的繁荣与城乡社会生活
source.title_en: Prosperous Commodity Economy and Urban and Rural Life

translations.zh: 明代中后期，商品经济活跃，传统的工商业城市更加繁荣，新的工商业城镇不断涌现。
translations.en: A commodity economy thrived during the mid-to-late Ming Dynasty.

source.title_zh: 商品经济的繁荣与城乡社会生活
source.title_en: Prosperous Commodity Economy and Urban and Rural Life

translations.zh: 白银逐渐取代缺乏信誉的宝钞，成为重要的流通货币。
translations.en: Silver gradually replaced the less credible “Baochao" paper notes as the major currency.

source.title_zh: 商品经济的繁荣与城乡社会生活
source.title_en: Prosperous Commodity Economy and Urban and Rural Life

translations.zh: 富商大贾往来贩运，组成以地域为纽带的商帮。
translations.en: Wealthy merchants formed links with regional trading partners.

source.title_zh: 商品经济的繁荣与城乡社会生活
source.title_en: Prosperous Commodity Economy and Urban and Rural Life

translations.zh: 城乡社会生活日渐丰富，追求财富成为一种时尚。
translations.en: At the same time, life in the urban and rural areas grew increasingly prosperous and the pursuit of wealth became fashionable.

source.title_zh: 欧人东来与中外关系的新变化
source.title_en: Europeans Coming to China and Changes in Foreign Relations

translations.zh: 明朝末年，意大利耶稣会传教士利玛窦等人来华，与中国的士大夫建立了密切的关系，并把欧洲一些先进的科学技术传播到中国，对近代中国科技的发展发挥了一定的作用。
translations.en: In the late Ming Dynasty, the Italian Jesuit missionary Matteo Ricci (1552-1610) and other Europeans arrived in China.

translations.zh: 边疆的统一与巩固清朝在康熙、雍正和乾隆统治时期，先后剿灭三藩之乱，收复台湾，平定西北边疆的叛乱，采取一系列措施加强对边疆管理，坚决抵制沙俄向中国的扩张，使统一多民族的国家得到巩固和发展。
translations.en: Unifying and Consolidating Rule over the Frontiers During the reigns of the Kangxi, Yongzheng, and Qianlong Emperors (1662-1795), a separatist rebellion was quelled in the south, Taiwan was recovered, revolts in the northwest frontiers were put down, and tsarist Russia's attempt to expand its territory into China was foiled.

translations.zh: 统一多民族国家的巩固和发展清朝是由我国少数民族满族建立的最后一个帝制王朝。
translations.en: Establishment and Growth of the Qing Dynasty The Qing Dynasty, the last imperial dynasty in Chinese history, was founded by the Manchu ethnic group from northeast China.

translations.zh: 从清太祖努尔哈赤至清末宣统皇帝溥仪，历经近300年。
translations.en: The Manchus ruled for nearly 300 years from the time of the first leader Nurhachi to the last Qing emperor, Puyi.

translations.zh: 公元1644年清朝入主北京至1840年鸦片战争爆发，这一时期为清前期，是清朝从开基创业、建立中央政权到统一多民族国家空前巩固和发展的阶段。
translations.en: During the early period (from 1644 when the Qing capital was moved to Beijing until the breakout of the Opium War in 1840), the Manchu rulers established a central authority and achieved unprecedented consolidation and growth for a unified multi-ethnic China.

translations.zh: 对日、对朝关系明初，中日之间保持着朝贡贸易关系。
translations.en: Relations with Japan and Korea China and Japan maintained “tribute" and trade relations in the early Ming.

translations.zh: 明中期以后，一些日本海盗团伙与中国的海盗相勾结，侵扰中国沿海，形成“倭患”。
translations.en: Nevertheless, relations were restrained in the middle Ming when Japanese and Chinese pirates joined together and began harassing China's coastal areas.

translations.zh: 嘉靖末年，戚继光等抗击倭寇，使倭寇横行的局面得到遏制。
translations.en: By the mid-16th century, the famous general Qi Jiguang (1528-1587) counterattacked and contained the pirates.

translations.zh: 万历年间，日本两次发动侵朝战争。
translations.en: In the Wanli Era (1573-1620), Japan launched two invasive wars against Korea.

translations.zh: 中国应朝鲜国王的请求入朝，与朝鲜军民一道，击败了日本的侵略。
translations.en: Upon request from the Korean king, the Chinese army helped the Koreans defeat the Japanese invaders.

source.title_zh: 清朝的经济和各民族社会生活
source.title_en: Economy and Ethnic Cultures in the Qing Dynasty

translations.zh: 明末清初的战乱，使社会经济的发展受到阻碍和破坏。
translations.en: The early Qing government took measures to restore an economy severely damaged by the chaos of war.

source.title_zh: 清朝的经济和各民族社会生活
source.title_en: Economy and Ethnic Cultures in the Qing Dynasty

translations.zh: 随着战火平息，清政府采取一系列发展生产、恢复经济的措施，到康熙、雍正、乾隆时期，社会经济得到显著发展，超越前代。
translations.en: By the Kangxi, Yongzheng, and Qianlong Eras (1662-1795), economic development reached unprecedented heights.

translations.zh: 满族的兴起与清朝的建立公元1616年，努尔哈赤进行了统一女真各部的战争后，在赫图阿拉（今辽宁新宾)建立后金政权，年号天命；后迁盛京(今辽宁沈阳)。
translations.en: Rise of the Manchus and Founding of the Qing Dynasty In 1616, Nurhachi unified the Nuzhen tribes and founded the Later Jin regime in present-day Liaoning Province.

translations.zh: 其子皇太极即位后，改国号为清，改族称为“满洲”。
translations.en: After Nurhachi's son Huangtaiji ascended the throne, he renamed the regime Qing and changed the name of his ethnic group from “Nuzhen" to “Manchu".

translations.zh: 公元1644年清军人关，清政府迁都北京，开始建立对全国的统治，是年为顺治元年。
translations.en: Huangtaiji's son Fulin inherited the throne and became the Shunzhi Emperor.

translations.zh: 清朝的统治体制多沿袭明朝，但具有自身特点，从清初操持军政大权的议政王大臣会议，到雍正时期直接听命于皇帝的军机处，君主专制主义中央集权不断加强。
translations.en: The Qing Dynasty largely followed the Ming system of governance while gradually modifying it to strengthen central authority.

translations.zh: 清朝的军队主要是八旗军，还招降明军和地主武装，建立绿营军。
translations.en: Qing troops were comprised of the Eight Banners and the Green Standard Army.

source.title_zh: 《坤奥万国全图》
source.title_en: Kun Yu Wan Guo Quan Tu (Great Universal Geographic Map)

translations.zh: 明万历三十年（公元1602年）
translations.en: Ming Dynasty, 30th year of Wanli Era (1602)

source.title_zh: 《坤奥万国全图》
source.title_en: Kun Yu Wan Guo Quan Tu (Great Universal Geographic Map)

translations.zh: 这是耶会传教士利玛窦在中国绘制的世界地图，它以当时西洋世界地图为蓝本，使中国人首次认识了世界的全貌。
translations.en: This map was drawn in China by the Jesuit missionary Matteo Ricci (1552-1610).

source.title_zh: 《坤奥万国全图》
source.title_en: Kun Yu Wan Guo Quan Tu (Great Universal Geographic Map)

translations.zh: 此图将中国放于世界地图的最中央，顺应了中国的传统观念。
translations.en: Based on Western originals, it showed the complete map of the world to the Chinese people for the first time.

translations.zh: 农业与手工业的恢复、发展清初实行奖励垦荒的政策，大量荒地不断开垦成农田；重视兴修水利，治河导准，促进了农业生产，保证了内河航运的畅通。
translations.en: Recovery and Growth of Agriculture and Handicrafts In the early Qing, policies to encourage wasteland reclamation and water conservancy helped to restore agricultural production.

translations.zh: 水稻、小麦等粮食产量提高，番薯、玉米等外来高产农作物种植进一步推广，棉花、茶叶、烟草等经济作物的种植面积扩大。
translations.en: The Qing Dynasty saw increased rice and wheat yield, the spread of non-indigenous high-yield crops like sweet potato and maize, and expanded cotton, tea, and tobacco cultivation.

translations.zh: 清代匠籍制度的废除，推动了手工业的发展，使纺织业、制瓷业与冶铁业等行业生产规模扩大，品种增多、工艺精美，在生产关系上也出现了新的因素。
translations.en: In handicrafts, the forced hereditary craftsman system was abolished.

translations.zh: 各民族社会生活清代各民族的衣食住行、婚丧嫁娶、文化娱乐等民俗习惯表现出绚丽多彩的世态风情。
translations.en: Ethnic Cultures In the Qing Dynasty, the customs of ethnic peoples were varied and colourful, including food, dress, entertainment, weddings, and funerals.

translations.zh: 随着社会经济的发展，各地的联系空前加强，各民族间的交往与日俱增。
translations.en: With social and economic development and unprecedented regional interaction, contact between various ethnic groups increased steadily.

translations.zh: 商业的繁荣国家的统一，农业和手工业的发展，促进了商业的繁荣，北京不仅是政治、文化中心，也是商贾云集、商品荟萃之地。
translations.en: Flourishing Trade National unity and development in agriculture and the handicraft industries contributed to commercial prosperity in the Qing Dynasty.

translations.zh: 江宁（今江苏南京）、扬州、苏州、杭州、汉口(今湖北武汉)、广州都是繁华的城市，在边远的地方还出现了乌鲁木齐（今新疆乌鲁木齐）、打箭炉（今四川康定）等新兴的商业中心。
translations.en: Beijing, the political and cultural centre, was increasingly a hub for merchants and commerce.

source.title_zh: 明清时期的文化
source.title_en: Culture in the Ming and Qing Dynasties

translations.zh: 明清之际，随着商品经济的发展和新的生产方式的萌芽，出现了一批具有早期启蒙思想的哲学家、讲求经世致用的科学家和极具个性的文学家、艺术家。
translations.en: In the context of a growing commodity economy and new modes of production, the late Ming and early Qing saw the emergence of a number of early enlightenment philosophers, pragmatic scientists, and highly individualistic writers and artists.

source.title_zh: 明清时期的文化
source.title_en: Culture in the Ming and Qing Dynasties

translations.zh: 当时，一些欧洲传教士来到中国，带来了西方先进的科技，对中国近代科技的发展起到一定的促进作用。
translations.en: At the same time, European missionaries came to China, bringing advanced Western knowledge that contributed to the development of modern Chinese science and technology.

source.title_zh: 清朝的对外往来
source.title_en: Foreign Relations in the Qing Dynasty

translations.zh: 清初实行闭关政策，严格控制中外通商和民间贸易往来。
translations.en: The early Qing government adopted a closed-door policy and strict controls over foreign and domestic trade.

source.title_zh: 清朝的对外往来
source.title_en: Foreign Relations in the Qing Dynasty

translations.zh: 康熙年间统一台湾后，清朝开始择地开放沿海通商口岸，又设立“公行”，专管对外贸易。
translations.en: During the Kangxi Era (1662-1722), some coastal cities were designated as trading ports and a government-approved company was set up for foreign trade.

source.title_zh: 清朝的对外往来
source.title_en: Foreign Relations in the Qing Dynasty

translations.zh: 自此至19世纪初，中国的生丝、茶叶、瓷器等大量出口，远销欧美，并长时间保持出超；与朝鲜、日本、越南、柬埔寨、印度等周边国交往频繁。
translations.en: Up until the early 19th century, China exported raw silk, tea, and porcelain in large quantities and enjoyed a trade surplus with Western countries.

source.title_zh: 清朝的对外往来
source.title_en: Foreign Relations in the Qing Dynasty

translations.zh: 18世纪以后，英、法、美等西方国家先后进入工业革命阶段，乾隆帝并没有意识到中国与西方先进国家正在拉开差距，清朝处于“落日的辉煌”之中。
translations.en: Nevertheless, as the Western world began to embrace the Industrial Revolution in the 18th century, the Qianlong Emperor was still unaware of the widening gap between China and the West.

translations.zh: 哲学从明朝中后期开始，王守仁、李贽等人开始冲破程朱理学束缚、创立了具有初步民主思想和人文因素的新的哲学流派。
translations.en: Philosophy Beginning in the mid-to-late Ming Dynasty, Wang Shouren (1472-1529) Li Zhi (1527-1602), and other scholars challenged the limitations of the Song Dynasty lixue learning (or Neo-Confucianism) and advocated a new philosophical school that featured early democratic and humanistic thinking.

translations.zh: 明末清初三大家黄宗羲、顾炎武和王夫之，哲学上具有朴素的唯物主义思想，政治思想带有反对专制主义的民主色彩。
translations.en: Three well-known philosophers of the late Ming and early Qing—Huang Zongxi(1610-1695), Gu Yanwu(1613-1682), and Wang Fuzhi (1619-1692) promoted naive materialism and anti-autocracy democratic political thought that significantly influenced later generations.

translations.zh: 科学技术明清时期，随着社会经济的发展和西方科学技术知识的传入，涌现出李时珍、宋应星、朱载堉、徐光启、方以智、明安图、王清任等集大成的科学家，他们撰写了在当时处于世界先进水平的科技名著。
translations.en: Science and Technology With social and economic development and the introduction of Western science and technology during the Ming and Qing Dynasties, a number of important scientists emerged in China and wrote advanced scientific works that were at world-leading level at that time.

source.title_zh: 小说和戏曲
source.title_en: Novels and Chinese Opera

translations.zh: 明清时期，小说的创作空前繁荣，《西游记》、《三国演义》、《水浒传》和《红楼梦》并称“四大古典小说”。
translations.en: The Ming and Qing Dynasties were a prolific age for literature as represented by the Four Classic Novels: Journey to the West, Romance of Three Kingdoms, Outlaws of the Marsh, and A Dream of Red Mansions.

source.title_zh: 小说和戏曲
source.title_en: Novels and Chinese Opera

translations.zh: 《聊斋志异》、《金瓶梅》、《儒林外史》以及晚清的“谴责小说”在文学史上具有很高的地位。
translations.en: Other works also achieved greatness in the history of Chinese literature such as Plum in a Golden Vase, Strange Tales of Liaozhai and the Unofficial History of the Scholars as well as some late Qing novels critical of society.

source.title_zh: 小说和戏曲
source.title_en: Novels and Chinese Opera

translations.zh: 明清戏曲也有所发展，其中昆曲的成就令世人瞩目。
translations.en: Chinese opera also made great strides in this period with kunqu opera capturing most attention.

translations.zh: 绘画与工艺品明代出现了许多著名的画家，其中以“吴门四大家”沈周、唐寅、文徵明和仇英的影响最大。
translations.en: Painting and Decorative Arts The most influential Ming Dynasty painters were the “Four Masters of Wumen School": Shen Zhou, Tang Yin, Wen Zhengming, and Qiu Ying.

translations.zh: 清朝画坛流派较多，风格各异，取得值得后人称道的艺术成就。
translations.en: The Qing Dynasty brought a flowering of diverse painting schools and styles.

translations.zh: 清初有以摹古为主旨的正统派画家“四王”(王时敏、王鉴、王翚、王原祁)；也有一反传统，张扬个性的改革派画家“四僧”（弘仁、髡残、石涛、朱耷)；清中期有供奉宫廷的画家焦秉贞、冷枚、金廷标等，也有以“扬州八怪”为代表的“扬州画派”等。
translations.en: The most representative early-Qing painters were the orthodox masters Wang Shimin, Wang Jian, Wang Hui, and Wang Yuanqi (the “Four Wangs") and the non-traditional individualists Hongren, Kuncan, Shitao, and Zhu Da (the “Four Monks").

translations.zh: 这一时期的手工艺品种类繁多，铜胎画珐琅、玉器、雕漆器等表现出高超的制作技艺，异彩纷呈。
translations.en: By the mid-Qing, court painters like Jiao Bingzhen, Leng Mei, and Jin Tingbiao emerged, as well as the unorthodox Yangzhou School.

translations.zh: 晚清的经济和文化1840年鸦片战争后，中国的经济和文化发生了前所未有的变化。
translations.en: Economy and Culture in the Late Qing Dynasty After the Opium War in 1840, China witnessed unprecedented economic and cultural change.

translations.zh: 从十九世纪下半叶起，为了“求强”、“求富”，洋务派官僚和早期的民族资本家购买外国机器设备、聘请外国技师，兴办了轮船、铁路、机器矿冶、机器纺织、电报、电话、银行、邮政、水电等新兴事业，新式学堂、博物馆、公共图书馆和出版社也开始出现。
translations.en: Motivated to strengthen China in the mid-19th century, a group of pro-Westernization Chinese officials and early nationalist industrialists began importing foreign machinery, employing foreign technicians, and establishing new industries like shipbuilding, railway, mechanized mining and textile production, telegraph, telephone, banking, postal services, and hydraulic electricity.

translations.zh: 在文学上，讽刺官场和洋人相勾结的遣责小说盛行一时，林纾、严复等人翻译的世界名著使人耳目一新。
translations.en: At the same time, new schools, museums, public libraries, and publishing houses emerged.

translations.zh: 介绍数理化和声光电的近代科技书籍也大为流行。
translations.en: In literature, novels that satirized collusion between officials and foreigners were popular, as well as foreign classics translated by Lin Shu (1852-1924) and Yan Fu (1854-1921) and books on modern science and technology

translations.zh: 农民画根源于古老的民间艺术，被认为从二十世纪中期开始成规模的出现，并在时代的演变中慢慢形成了自己的艺术语言。
translations.en: Introduction Rooted in ancient vernacular artistic traditions, farmer paintings are recognized as having emerged on a significant scale from the mid-20th century.

source.title_zh: 推翻帝制建立共和
source.title_en: From the Qing Empire to the Founding of the Republic of China

translations.zh: 自19世纪40年代起，列强连续发动了鸦片战争、第二次鸦片战争、中法战争、中日战争和八国联军侵华战争，迫使中国签订了一系列不平等条约，中国的主权和领土完整受到严重侵犯，清朝日益衰败。
translations.en: The 1840s saw the beginning of the Qing Empire's decline with successive wars launched by imperialist powers the Opium War (1840-1842), Second Opium War (1856-1860), Sino-French War (1883-1885), Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), and the invasion of the eight-nation allied forces in 1900.

source.title_zh: 推翻帝制建立共和
source.title_en: From the Qing Empire to the Founding of the Republic of China

translations.zh: 为了救亡图存，中国人民开展了反帝反封建的斗争。
translations.en: As a result, China was compelled to sign a series of unequal treaties.

source.title_zh: 推翻帝制建立共和
source.title_en: From the Qing Empire to the Founding of the Republic of China

translations.zh: 1911年，革命党人在武昌发动起义，得到了全国的响应，南方各省相继光复。
translations.en: In an effort to save the nation, the Chinese people stood up and initiated the “anti-imperialism and anti-feudalism campaign.

source.title_zh: 推翻帝制建立共和
source.title_en: From the Qing Empire to the Founding of the Republic of China

translations.zh: 1912年元旦，中华民国临时政府在南京宣布成立，宣告清朝统治的结束，也意味着帝制时代的结束。
translations.en: The Revolution of 1911 and the establishment of the provisional government of the Republic of China at Nanjing in early 1912 signalled the end of the Qing Dynasty.

source.title_zh: 推翻帝制建立共和
source.title_en: From the Qing Empire to the Founding of the Republic of China

translations.zh: 中国历史进入了一个新纪元。
translations.en: As the Chinese monarchy collapsed, a new chapter opened in the history of China.

translations.zh: 大地
translations.en: CARVED WOOD 900mm x 75cm

translations.zh: 叙民俗中国农村有着丰富的民间习俗，从日常生活、生产劳动到岁时节日、人生仪礼，渗透到乡村生活的方方面面。
translations.en: Narrating Folklore China's rural communities possess a profound wealth of folk customs.

translations.zh: 根植于农村的农民画，其创作灵感正是源自身边的人、事、物，作品描绘的是农民画家最熟知、最亲切的场景，是他们的家乡记忆，也共同组成了丰富多彩的民间文化图景。
translations.en: These traditions permeate every aspect of village life-from daily routines and agricultural labor to seasonal festivals and life-cycle rituals.

translations.zh: 展覧农事农民以自然为生、与自然为伴。
translations.en: Visions of Agrarian Life Farmers subsist in symbiosis with nature, their lives intrinsically bound to the earth.

translations.zh: 四季更替造就了多彩的视觉景观，天南地北滋养出多样的生物形态，一方水土养育一方人，勤劳造就了物阜民丰。
translations.en: The cyclical rhythm of the seasons yields a kaleidoscope of visual spectacles, while diverse geographical terrains foster a multitude of biological forms.

translations.zh: 农民画家用画笔勾勒出来自家乡的生态环境与耕耘劳作，呈现了中华大地的锦绣山河，也讲述着人与自然的和谐共生。
translations.en: As the ancient adage suggests,"the local soil and water nurture its people'and through diligent labor, prosperity and abundance are achieved.Farmer painters delineate the ecological environments and cultivation practices of their native regions with their brushes, presenting the resplendent landscapes of the Chinese continent and articulating narratives of harmonious coexistence between humanity and the natural world.

translations.zh: 焕新貌新时代、新农村、新生活，国家发展让农村发生了翻天覆地的变化，农业科技化、农村城镇化、生活现代化，城乡结合越发紧密、人员往来越发频繁、经济互联越发多样，这些都实实在在地影响着农民的生活，身处其中的农民画家敏锐地记录了农村的发展、节日的欢庆与生活的变化。
translations.en: Embracing Renewal The advent of a new era heralds a new countryside and new lifestyles.

translations.zh: 焕新貌新时代、新农村、新生活，国家发展让农村发生了翻天覆地的变化，农业科技化、农村城镇化、生活现代化，城乡结合越发紧密、人员往来越发频繁、经济互联越发多样，这些都实实在在地影响着农民的生活，身处其中的农民画家敏锐地记录了农村的发展、节日的欢庆与生活的变化。
translations.en: Renewal Embracing the advent of a new era heralds a new countryside and new lifestyles.

translations.zh: 青铜胃战国内蒙古赤峰美丽河出土
translations.en: Bronze Helmet Warring States Period(403-221BC) Unearthed at Meilihe, Chifeng, Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region

translations.zh: 北宋基本结束了五代十国的分裂局面。
translations.en: The Northern Song ended the era of political fragmentation in the Five Dynasties and Ten Kingdoms period.

translations.zh: 为防止藩镇割据重演，统治者把地方的军权、用人权、财权、司法权收归中央，加强了中央集权。
translations.en: To prevent division and strengthen central authority, Northern Song rulers took control over local military matters, official appointments, financial decisions, and judicial powers.

translations.zh: 面对北宋中期的社会危机，一批有忧患意识的士大夫发起了改革。
translations.en: In the middle Northern Song, a social crisis arose and was responded to by reforms called for by a group of scholar-officials.

translations.zh: 公元1127年，北宋为金所灭。
translations.en: In 1127, the Northern Song was overthrown by the Jin Dynasty.

translations.zh: 中国是栗、稻两种主要农作物的发源地，也是最早驯化犬、猪、鸡等家畜家禽的地方，距今4千年前后我国还从西亚等地引进了羊、牛、马、小麦等。
translations.en: The Land of Plenty China was the birthplace of two main crops: millet and rice.

translations.zh: 由此，中国人多种粮食加肉食的饮食格局，早在史前时代便已形成。
translations.en: It was also the earliest region to domesticate livestock and poultry such as pigs, dogs and chickens.

translations.zh: 相较于西方肉食为主的食物结构而言，中国人的杂食型食物结构更为科学合理，它能使人体从各类食物中获取丰富而均衡的营养成分，也充分体现了中华饮食文化多样而统一的特征。
translations.en: Around 4,000 years ago, sheep, cattle, horses and wheat were introduced to China from West Asia.

translations.zh: 五谷原指五种主要的粮食作物，一般认为包括稻、黍、稷、麦、菽，分别指水稻、黄米、小米、麦类、豆类。
translations.en: Grains as Staple Food “Five grains" originally referred to five main crops, which were generally considered to include rice, proso millet, millet, wheat and beans.

translations.zh: 稷即粟，在中国古代被称为五谷之神，与土神合称“社稷”，成为国家的代称。
translations.en: Millet was also called “ji" in Chinese, which meant“the god of the five grains" in ancient China.

translations.zh: 随着作物品种增多，五谷逐渐演化成粮食作物的统称。
translations.en: Combined with “she", which meant "the god of the earth", the term “she ji" referred to the “state".

translations.zh: 现代比较重要的粮食作物是稻、麦、玉米、甘薯、大豆等。
translations.en: Major food crops in modern times are rice, wheat, sweet corn, sweet potato and soybean.

translations.zh: 其中，玉米和甘薯原产于美洲，明朝中期开始在我国种植，到了清朝前期，已经遍布我国大部分地区。
translations.en: Among them, corn and sweet potatoes were from Americas and began to be planted in China during the mid-Ming dynasty.

translations.zh: 出自徐光翼编：《出土壁画全集》宰猪场景（甘肃嘉峪关魏晋墓出土）
translations.en: Scene of Pig Slaughtering (Unearthed from Wei and Jin dynasties tombs in Jiayuguan, Gansu Province)

translations.zh: 六畜一般指马、牛、羊、猪、狗、鸡，是古人摄食肉类的主要来源。
translations.en: Livestock and Poultry “Six domesticated animals" generally refer to horses, cattle, sheep, pigs, dogs and chickens, which were the main source of dietary meat for the ancients.

translations.zh: 马主要用于运输，属于重要的物资，用作肉食的机会相对较少。
translations.en: Horses were mainly used for transportation.

translations.zh: 牛、羊、猪用于祭祀时，称为“三牲”。
translations.en: They were important resources and therefore were rarely used as meat.

translations.zh: 牛是古代的高规格肉食，《礼记》中有“诸侯无故不杀牛”的规定。
translations.en: Cattle, sheep and pigs were often used for sacrificial ceremonies, and therefore were called the “three sacrificial animals."

translations.zh: 《史记》记载，有一位名叫魏尚的将军抵御匈奴时，为了激励士气，五天杀一头牛给军士吃。
translations.en: Cattle were regarded as high-standard dietary meat in ancient times.

translations.zh: 于是，军士奋勇杀敌，以致“匈奴远避，不近云中之塞”
translations.en: In the Book of Rites, there is a stipulation that "princes shall not slaughter cattle without a sound reason".

translations.zh: 我国饮酒和饮茶的历史悠久，酒和茶作为中华饮食文化中的两朵璀璨奇葩，在漫长的历史长河中熠熠生辉，让古人的饮食生活更具艺术化色彩。
translations.en: The Rhyme of Tea and Wine China has a long history of drinking wine and tea As two brilliant traditions in Chinese food culture, wine and tea have been greatly appreciated throughout history,and brought colors to the lives of the ancient people.

translations.zh: 酒使人沉醉，而茶使人清醒，所谓‘酒如豪士，茶如隐逸，新茶陈酒可以给饮者带来不同的美的享受，也满足了人们的精神需求。
translations.en: Wine is intoxicating while tea is refreshing. It is said that wine is bold like a hero, and tea is recluse like a hermit.

translations.zh: 文人墨客书写的关于酒和茶的诗文词曲，也共同构成了博大宏富的中华酒文化和中华茶文化。
translations.en: Fresh tea and aged wine not only can bring enjoyment , but also can meet different spiritual needs Poems and songs about wine and tea written by literati have also enriched the already broad and profound tea culture an

translations.zh: 酒的出现不是人类的发明，而是天工的造化。
translations.en: The emergence of wine is not a human invention, but a natural creation.

translations.zh: 最早的酒应是落地野果自然发酵而成的。
translations.en: The earliest wine probably was the natural fermentation of wild fruits.

translations.zh: 中国人工酿酒的历史十分悠久，可以追溯至新石器时代。
translations.en: The history of artificial winemaking in China could be traced back to the Neolithic Age.

translations.zh: 自夏之后，至于唐宋，皆是以果、粮蒸煮，加曲发酵，压榨成酒。
translations.en: From the Xia to the Tang and Song dynasties, people made wine by cooking fruits and grains and fermenting them with qu (dried fermentation starter).

translations.zh: 元代出现了蒸馏酒，而后逐步普及。
translations.en: Distilled spirits appeared in the Yuan dynasty and was gradually popularized nationwide.

translations.zh: 中华酒文化的内涵极为丰富，不仅包括高超的酿造技艺，还有琳琅满目的精美酒具以及不同地域和民族的酒礼酒俗。
translations.en: The connotation of Chinese wine culture is extremely rich, which includes not only superb brewing skills, but also a dazzling array of exquisite wine vessels, rituals and customs from different regions and nationalities.

translations.zh: 饮食不仅是人类赖以生存的物质条件，也是社会发展进步的重要标志。
translations.en: Preface Food is not only a basic need of human beings but also a manifestation of social development.

translations.zh: 饮食文化是中华传统文化的重要组成部分，从茹毛饮血到炊煮熟食，从大羹玄酒到佳肴美馔，中国古人的餐桌见证了上万年的饮食革命和文化流变。
translations.en: Chinese food culture, as an important part of the country's fine tradition, dates back to the primitive society.

translations.zh: 吃饭不仅是为了果腹与生存，更成为一种生活方式的集中表达，调羹弄膳之间，处处流露着生活智慧和生命尊严。
translations.en: From raw food to cooked food, from bland dishes to exquisite offerings, the Chinese nation has created a rich and colorful food history over ten thousand years.

translations.zh: 此次中国国家博物馆面向公众推出“中国古代饮食文化”专题展览，就是要深入贯彻落实习近平总书记“让文物说话”“让历史说话”的重要指示精神，系统阐释中国古代饮食的发展变迁与文化内涵，引导广大观众细细品味“民以食为天”的中国味道，深刻感知中华民族的血脉与生趣。
translations.en: Following President Xi Jinping's important instructions of “let the cultural relics speak” and “let the history show itself”, the National Museum of China launched this exhibition entitled Ancient Chinese Food Culture to comprehensively display the development, changes and cultural connotations of ancient Chinese food culture, and lead the visitors to a better understanding of the Chinese old saying “food is the first necessity of the people” and apprehend the nation's cultural inheritance.

translations.zh: 中国古代饮食文化绵长而厚重，在其长达数千年的历史积淀中，不仅包含了造型精美的饮食器具、自成体系的烹饪技艺以及浩如烟海的典籍制度，还由此衍生出一系列影响中华文明发展进程的哲学观念、政治智慧和科学思想，同时也为传统音乐、舞蹈、绘画、雕塑、诗歌等诸多文艺创作提供了不竭源泉。
translations.en: Chinese food culture has a long and rich history and has formed its own characteristics over the centuries, including exquisite eating utensils, sophisticated cooking skills, and a vast collection of classics documenting various cuisines.

translations.zh: 本次展览共汇聚
translations.en: This exhibition is divided into five parts, namely, The Land of Plenty, The Rhyme of Tea and Wine, Utensils for Cooking and Dining, The Evolving Kitchen, and Food and Rituals.

translations.zh: 蔬果自古以来就是人们饮食结构中的重要组成部分。
translations.en: Fruits and Vegetables Fruits and vegetables have been an important part of the human diet since ancient times.

translations.zh: 秦汉时期延续并发展了春秋战国时期的蔬果种植格局，努力将野生蔬果转化为人工栽培的蔬果，蔬果的专业化经营和商品化程度大大增强。
translations.en: During the Qin and Han dynasties the cultivation of fruits and vegetables built from the experiences gained during the Spring and Autumn Period and the Warring States Period, and continued to develop.

translations.zh: 秦汉以后至明清时期，随着大一统王朝的建立和中外交往的日益紧密，异域的蔬果不断被引入内地，成为古代中国蔬果的重要来源。
translations.en: Efforts were made to transform wild fruits and vegetables into cultivated fruits and vegetables, and the degree of professional management and commercialization was Qing dynasties, with the establishment of a unified state as well as fruits and vegetables were introduced and became an important source of fruits and vegetables in ancient China.

source.title_zh: 汉代壁画中的女性醉酒图
source.title_en: Drunken Females in a Han Dynasty Mural

translations.zh: 河南师汉代壁画中的醉酒女性形象反映出汉代宴饮礼俗的一大特点，即女性可以在公开场合中与男性一同宴饮。
translations.en: The images of drunken females in Han dynasty murals unearthed in Yanshi, Henan Province reveal that in banquets of that time, women could dine and drink together with men in public.

source.title_zh: 方岳方鉴盛酒铜冰鉴冰鉴内部结构与冰镇制冷原理（战国，中国国家博物馆藏）

translations.en: This set is composed of a square ice container jian and a square wine container fou.

source.title_zh: 方岳方鉴盛酒铜冰鉴冰鉴内部结构与冰镇制冷原理（战国，中国国家博物馆藏）

translations.zh: 方鉴与方岳间留有较大的空隙，用以放冰。
translations.en: Ice could be placed in the space between the two parts.

source.title_zh: 方岳方鉴盛酒铜冰鉴冰鉴内部结构与冰镇制冷原理（战国，中国国家博物馆藏）
source.title_en: Internal structure and Bronze Bingjian (ritual wine cooler) principle of cooling

translations.zh: 古人曾长期饮用凉酒，使用冰鉴能够制作出冰凉可口的美酒。
translations.en: The ancients used to drink cold wine for a long time and bingjian was used to cool wine.

source.title_en: Gourd-shaped Silver Ewer

translations.en: The Tang dynasty saw a prosperous economy and strong national power, which led to rapid development of the gold and silver wares.

source.title_en: Gourd-shaped Silver Ewer

translations.zh: 皇室贵族对金银器具非常偏爱，宴饮时经常使用。
translations.en: The imperial court and aristocracy favored Tang dynasty (618-907 CE) gold and silver utensils, and often used them at the banquets.

translations.en: Unearthed in Shaanxi Province

translations.zh: 茶是中国对世界文明所作的重要贡献之一。
translations.en: The Scent of Tea Tea is one of China's important contributions to world civilization.

translations.zh: 中华茶文化在形成和发展的过程中，逐渐由物质上升到精神文化的范畴，是博大精深的中华饮食文化的一个重要分支。
translations.en: In the process of formation and development, Chinese tea culture gradually rose from material to spiritual culture, and became an important branch of the broad and profound Chinese food culture.

translations.zh: 早在西汉时期，巴蜀地区就有饮茶的记载。
translations.en: As early as the Western Han dynasty, there were records of tea drinking in the Bashu area, which was located in modern Sichuan province.

translations.zh: 茶文化的形成始自魏晋南北朝时期，唐宋时期达到鼎盛，明清时期又有进一步的发展。
translations.en: The formation of tea culture began in the Wei, Jin, Southern and Northern dynasties.

translations.zh: 自唐代起，饮茶用具从酒器、食器中分离出来，并自成体系。
translations.en: It reached its peak during the Tang and Song dynasties and further developed during the Ming and Qing dynasties.

translations.zh: 不同时期的茶具也呈现出不同的特点，造型优美的各类茶具除具有实用价值外，也有颇高的艺术价值。
translations.en: Since the Tang dynasty, tea sets formed a distinct category which was separated from wine and food containers.

translations.zh: 饼茶草茶茶末置盒罗茶碾茶碎茶搅拌茶末←点茶（注汤入盏）←置茶托
translations.en: Tea cake Herbal tea Storing tea dust Sieving Grinding Crushing in a container Scooping tea dust Pouring hot water into Whisking Placing the tea bowl into the tea bowl (Diancha) on the tea saucer

translations.zh: 宋代点茶流程图
translations.en: Flowchart of Diancha in the Song Dynasty

translations.zh: 唐代煎茶法被宋人摒弃，点茶法成为时尚。
translations.en: In the Tang dynasty, the Jiancha method prevailed, which takes tea cake or dust tea as ingredients and pays great attention to the temperature of hot water.

translations.zh: 点茶法是将茶叶末放在茶碗里，注入少量沸水调成糊状，然后再注入沸水，或者直接用茶瓶向茶碗中注入沸水，同时用茶匙搅动。
translations.en: Later, it was replaced by Diancha in the Song dynasty.

translations.zh: 陶器的发明，使人类真正告别了“污尊坏饮”的时代，揭开了人类饮食史上崭新的一页。
translations.en: With the invention of pottery vessels, people gave up the primitive way of drinking, which turned over a new page in the history of the human diet.

translations.zh: 作为食具使用的陶器，伴随人类饮食生活的时间最长。
translations.en: The pottery vessels are the longest-used dinnerware in human history.

translations.zh: 新石器时代的先民们广泛制作和使用陶制食具。
translations.en: The ancestors of the Neolithic Age made and used pottery extensively, yet food vessels were often the most exquisite products, and embodied the ingenuity of the ancestors.

translations.zh: 红银里三清茶铺茶锺即茶盏。
translations.en: Red-lacquered Silver Tea Bowl Engraved with Poem Sanqing Cha Qing dynasty(1644-1911)

translations.zh: 中间部分剔刻的御制诗题作《三清茶》，题下自注云：“以雪水沃梅花、松实、佛手啜之，名曰三清。”
translations.en: Tea bowl is a small tea cup without handle.

translations.zh: 雪夜烹清（1644-1911年）茶，茶名三清，乾隆以此举为清雅，不仅自己吟咏不辍，且以“三清茶”为题，命群臣联句，而成一时盛事。
translations.en: The poem Sanqing Cha by Emperor Qianlong of Qing dynasty was engraved on the outer wall of tea bowl.

translations.zh: 三清茶盏的制作，始自乾隆时期，以瓷器为多，也有玉器和漆器。
translations.en: The Emperor Qianlong brewed plum blossom, pine nut and fingered citron with boiled snow water (sanqing cha) and regarded the behavior as a manifestation of elegance.

translations.zh: 中国漆器工艺是中华文化宝库中一颗璀璨夺目的明珠。
translations.en: The Beauty of Lacquerware Chinese lacquerware was a dazzling pearl in the treasure house of Chinese culture.

translations.zh: 从新石器时代开始，人们就认识了漆的性能并用以制器。
translations.en: Growing familiarity with the properties of lacquer led to the creation of utensils early in the Neolithic age.

translations.zh: 战国时期，开始流行漆木制饮食器具，其制作工艺十分精湛，在器型和纹饰上，都显示出纤巧、活泼、清新的审美风格。
translations.en: During the Warring States period, lacquered wooden tableware became popular.

translations.zh: 商周至战国时期是中国古代青铜文化的鼎盛时期。
translations.en: The Power of Bronzeware The era from the Shang and Zhou dynasties to the Warring States Period was the heyday of ancient Chinese bronze culture.

translations.zh: 考古发掘中出土了大量的青铜饮食器具，这些青铜饮食器具的器型多样、纹饰繁缛，尤其是狰狞的兽面纹，体现出一种神秘和庄严之美，是当时社会等级森严的象征。
translations.en: A large number of bronze vessels have been unearthed through archaeological excavations.

translations.zh: 在中国古代社会，金银制和玉制饮食器具多为社会上层使用的奢侈品，使用范围相对狭窄。
translations.en: In ancient China, gold, silver and jade wares for cooking and dining were mostly articles of luxury for the upper class, with a relatively limited scope of use.

translations.zh: 唐代金银业有较大的发展，加之外来风气的影响，使得这一时期金银饮食器具的制造达到鼎盛时期。
translations.en: During the Tang dynasty, the gold and silver industry had a great development, coupled with the influence of foreign customs, made the manufacture of gold and silver eating utensils reach its heyday during this period.

translations.zh: 宋元明清时期，玉制饮食器具种类增多，大多属于宫廷用品，一些器皿的用途发生改变，变成用于陈设的艺术品。
translations.en: During the Song, Yuan, Ming and Qing dynasties, the variety of jade dinnerware increased, most of which belonged to the royal court.

translations.zh: 饮食器具是中国古代饮食文化的重要组成部分。
translations.en: Utensils for Cooking and Dining Utensils for cooking and dining was an important part of ancient China's food culture.

translations.zh: 从新石器时代出现最初的食器，到历代发明的陶质、金属质、瓷质饮食器具，无一不见证了中华文明的发展历程。
translations.en: From the earliest food utensils during the Neolithic Age, to the pottery, metal, and porcelain utensils invented through centuries, food utensils have witnessed the development of Chinese civilization.

translations.zh: 中国历代饮食器具在讲求实用的同时，还始终贯穿着人们的审美观念。
translations.en: While the food utensils of the past had practical functions, they also of painted pottery,the elegance of porcelain,the solemnness of bronze, the exquisiteness of lacquerware, the brilliance of gold and silverware, and the luminescence of jade,all provide their users a wonderful enjoyment.

translations.zh: 彩陶的古朴之美，瓷器的清雅之美，铜器的庄重之美，漆器的秀逸之美，金银器的辉煌之美，玉器的莹润之美，都给使用者带来美好的享受，美食配美器”，此之谓也。
translations.en: Therefore it is said delicious food need beautiful containers

translations.zh: 瓷器的发明是中华民族对世界文明的伟大贡献之一。
translations.en: The Charm of Porcelain The invention of porcelain was one of the great contributions of China to world civilizations.

translations.zh: 早在商代，中国就出现了原始瓷器。
translations.en: As early as the Shang dynasty, primitive porcelain wares appeared in China.

translations.zh: 汉代完成了原始瓷器向标准瓷器的过渡，此后制瓷工艺水平和产量不断提高，为后来瓷制饮食器的盛行奠定了基础。
translations.en: The Han dynasty completed the transition from proto-porcelain to porcelain.

translations.zh: 由于瓷制饮食器具有经久耐用、便于清洗、外观华美、成本较低等特点，所以它很快取代其他材质的饮食器具而成为中国人饮食生活中的主要用器。
translations.en: Since then, the level of porcelain-making techniques and production were steadily improving, which laid the foundation for the popularity of later porcelain-made dinnerware.

translations.zh: 中国古代烹饪技法包括蒸、煮、炒、脍、炙、煎、熬、羹、炮、爆、脯、腊等，多达数十种，可谓世界之最。
translations.en: Methods of Ancient Cooking Ancient Chinese cooking techniques include steam, boil, stir-fry, fillet, grill, pan-fry, simmer, chowder, roast, fry at high heat, dry, preserve, mince, etc.

translations.zh: 其中，蒸和炒，都是中国人的独创。
translations.en: There were dozens of cooking techniques in ancient China, the largest number in the world.

translations.zh: 近代西方人有了蒸汽锅炉以后，也利用蒸汽来蒸熟食物。
translations.en: Among them, steaming and stir-frying were invented by the Chinese people.It was only after modern Westerners had steam boilers, they began to use steam to cook food.

translations.zh: 但是炒法，至今仍为中国人所独有。
translations.en: Today, stir frying still remains as a uniquely Chinese cooking technique.

translations.zh: 前言。
translations.en: Preface development.

translations.zh: 饮食出精选文物240余件（套），从食材、器具、技艺、礼仪等不同角度出发，全面呈现玄酒到佳中国古代饮食文化的历史变迁，真实刻画古代劳动人民充满烟火气息的日常生活，不仅是为深刻表达中华民族对丰衣足食的美好生活的憧憬和信心。
translations.en: different perspectives, such as ingredients, utensils, techniques, etiquettes, etc.

translations.zh: 充分体现习近平总书记指出，“如果没有中华五千年文明，哪里有什么中国特色？如果不是中国特色，哪有我们今天这么成功的中国特色社会主义道路？我们要特别重视挖掘中华五千年文明中的精华，弘扬优秀传统文化，把其中的精华同马克思主义立场观点方法结合起来，坚定不移走中国特色社会主义道路。”

translations.zh: 中国国家博物馆作为代表国家收藏、研究、展示、阐释能够充分反映中华优秀传统文化、革命文化和社会主义先进文化代表性物证的最高机构，历来特别重视挖掘中华五千年文明中的精华，从历史和现实、理论和实践相结合的角度深入阐释和弘扬优秀传统文化。
translations.en: As China's supreme establishment that collects, researches, is the first revolutionary culture and advanced socialist culture, the National Museum of China attaches great cs overthe nofclassics doms, and history and the reality, both the theory and the practice.

translations.zh: 衷心希望广大观众通过本次展览能够更加深入了解中国古代饮食文化，深刻感受优秀传统文化的独特魅力，增强做中国人的骨气和底气，以更大的信心和勇气汇聚起建设社会主义现代化强国、实现中华民族伟大复兴中国梦的磅礴力量。
translations.en: We sincerely hope that this exhibition will help provides a our visitors gain a deeper understanding of ancient Chinese food culture, give them an opportunity to painting, enjoy the unique charm of China's fine traditional culture, and make them more confident and assured in e Rhyme of their identity as Chinese people.

translations.zh: 粥”的篆字：“米”字下面一个隔，两边的“弓”，表现的是水汽弯弯曲曲的形状。
translations.en: Chinese Character for "Porridge" in Seal Script sides symbolize rising vapor:

translations.zh: 饭蒸煮熟了，打开盖子，β里的高压水蒸汽腾空而起。
translations.en: When rice is cooked and the lid of the cooking vessel is lifted, the high-pressure water vapor inside soon rises into the air.

translations.zh: 陶鬶[jia]新石器时代的鬶底面多有烟，腹内有残存的水垢，说明其应是煮水煮粥的炊具而不是专用的酒具。
translations.en: Pottery Jia There were traces of soot at the bottom and scale formation in the belly of most of the Neolithic jia vessels, indicating that they were used for heating water or cooking porridge rather than holding wine.

translations.zh: 进入夏代后，鬶逐渐以盛酒、温酒为主。
translations.en: It was not until the Xia dynasty that jia vessels began being used for holding and warming wine.

translations.zh: 新石器时代仰韶文化（约公元前5000年一前3000年）
translations.en: Neolithic Age, Yangshao Culture (c.5000-3000BCE)

translations.zh: 1957年河南陕县庙底沟出土
translations.en: Unearthed from the Miaodigou Site in Shanxian

translations.zh: 鼎中之变火的使用使远古先民脱离了“茹毛饮血”的饮食生活，从生食到熟食的转化是人类发展史上一个重要的里程碑，可以说是人类饮食文化的起点。
translations.en: The Evolving Kitchen The invention of fire ended the primitive life of eating animals' raw flesh.

translations.zh: 俗话说“水火不容”，但智慧的中国古代先民却在烹饪上实现了“水火相成”：只要让水、火之间有一层薄薄的隔离，它们就能共存相成。
translations.en: The transformation from raw food to cooked food was a milestone in the history of human development, and it can be regarded as the starting point of human food culture.

translations.zh: 釜、鼎、甄等首批被发明出来的炊具决定了中华民族数千年来的烹饪技法以蒸、煮为主。
translations.en: It is said that "water and fire are not compatible, but the wise ancient Chinese people managed to achieve "harmony between water and fire" in cooking: as long as there is a thin layer of separation between water and fire, they can coexist and complement each other.

translations.zh: 汉代是中华饮食文化发展史上的重要时期，其在粮食储藏和加工、主食制作、菜肴烹调、饮食习惯等诸多方面都奠定了后世两千多年的基本饮食格局。
translations.en: The first invented cooking utensils, such as Fu, Ding, Li and Zeng, determined the cooking techniques of the Chinese nation focusing on steaming and boiling for thousands of years.

translations.zh: 不同民族的饮食文化在传播过程中不断与中原饮食文化互相吸收，融会贯通，逐渐形成了世界上独树一帜的中华饮食文化。
translations.en: The Han dynasty was an important period in the history of the Chinese food culture.

translations.zh: 由于地理和气候的差异，早在新石器时代，南北方主食已有分野，到了商周时期，由于副食生产条件的不同，南北方饮食习俗的差异更加明显。
translations.en: Due to the differences in geography and climate, those dwelled in southern and northern China ate different staple food as early as the Neolithic age.

translations.zh: 先秦、秦汉时期的食谱大都已经佚失，只能从传世和出土文献中窥知一鳞半爪。
translations.en: During the Shang and Zhou dynasties, such dietary differences were even more obvious due to the different production conditions of non-staple food.

translations.zh: 魏晋南北朝以后，以《齐民要术》为代表的中国古代食谱，堪称历代饮食文化精华的实录，反映了当时社会的烹饪水平和饮食特色。
translations.en: Most of the recipes from the pre-Qin, Qin and Han dynasties were lost, and only a few remained through the handed down or unearthed documents.

translations.zh: 中国传统思想在饮食中有着深刻的反映和体现。
translations.en: Chinese traditional thoughts are deeply reflected and embodied in Chinese diet.

translations.zh: 古代许多思想家和政治家都善于运用饮食之道阐发自己的政治见解或处世哲学。
translations.en: Many ancient thinkers and politicians were good at elucidating their political views or life philosophies by comparing them to dining.

translations.zh: 饮食文化在长期的发展过程中，与中国传统思想相互影响、相得益彰，从而形成了独树一帜的中华饮食思想。

translations.en: In the minds of the ancients, the meaning of feasting was far beyond food.

translations.zh: 通过宴饮活动联络宾客,敦睦亲属，亲善友谊，自古以来就成为中国人团结群体、整合关系的重要方式。

translations.zh: 现代宴饮场合的礼仪、规范、习俗等方面仍保留部分的古代遗风。

translations.zh: 古代的饮食活动中，人们普遍遵循着礼的规范，处处体现着尊卑等级的差别，这对谦恭礼貌、尊贤敬老风气的形成有着显著的作用。
translations.en: Dining etiquette revealed social hierarchy and played a significant role in the formation of a culture that emphasized modesty and courtesy, and respect for the virtuous and elderly.

translations.zh: 一些进食礼仪如吃饭时长者优先、讲究吃相、用筷姿势规范等优良传统一直沿袭至今。

translations.en: The custom of worshipping ancestors and gods before eating originated in the Neolithic Age and was intensified during the Shang and Zhou dynasties.
