translations.zh: 观象授时中国是世界上天文学发展最早的国家之一早在新石器时代，先民们就开始了对日、月等天象的观察。
translations.en: Ancient Chinese Astronomy China is among one of the ancient countries that developed astronomy.

translations.zh: 随着社会的进步，天文学得到迅速发展，不但创造出简仪等先进的天文观测仪器，还留下了世界最早的日食、太阳黑子、哈雷彗星、超新星等天象记录，制订了世界现存最早的恒星表，编制出先进的历法，长期处于世界领先地位。
translations.en: As early as the Neolithic Age, ancient Chinese people started observing the sun, the moon, and other celestial phenomena.

translations.zh: 科技是国家强盛之基，创新是民族进步之魂，科技自立自强是国家发展的战略支撑。
translations.en: For a nation, science and technology are the foundation of its strength, innovation leads to its overall progress, and scientific and technological self-reliance and self-improvement give strategic support to its development.

translations.zh: 自古以来，科学技术就以种不可逆转、不可抗拒的力量推动着人类社会向前发展。
translations.en: Since ancient times, science and technology have been the irresistible driving force behind the progress of humanity.

translations.zh: 中华民族曾创造了灿烂的古代文明，取得了辉煌的古代科技成就，为世界科技进步作出重大成就贡献；也经历过落后于时代的曲折，在学习先进科学技术的过程中艰难地走向复兴；新中国成立以来特别是改革开放以来，中国的科技发展取得举世瞩目的伟大成就，建立起系统完整的现代工业体系，走过了发达国家几百年的工业化历程，创造了人类发展史上的奇迹，充分证明科学技术是第一生产力。
translations.en: In China, its people contributed greatly to the world's scientific and technological progress with brilliant achievements from the ancient times.

translations.zh: 中国国家博物馆充分发挥体系化收藏的突出优势，深入挖掘馆藏资源，举办此专题展览，就是要让文物说话、让历史说话，系统展示中华民族勇于创新、善于创造的壮阔历程，突出展现科学技术进步与经济社会发展的内在联系，深刻阐释创新是中华民族最深沉的民族禀赋。
translations.en: So This exhibition is presented by the National Museum of China by selecting exceptional objects out of its rich science and technology collections.

translations.zh: 本次展览内容上起甲骨文中的日食记录和干支表，下至“墨子号”量子科学实验卫星等当代科技成就，是中国国家博物馆推出的首个中国科学技术通史专题展览，也是在特定专业领域系统展示中华优秀传统文化、革命文化和社会主义先进文化代表性物证的重要探索。
translations.en: Being the National Museum of China's first exhibition on the general history of Chinese science and technology, the exhibition stands as an important exploration of the physical evidence that comes from a specific field and is representative of fine traditional Chinese culture, revolutionary culture, and advanced socialist

translations.zh: 春种秋收中国是世界农作物起源中心地之一。
translations.en: Ancient Chinese Agriculture China is one of the countries where crops were first grown.

translations.zh: 中国先民最先培育出水稻、粟等粮食作物，并在长期的农业耕种实践中，不断改进耕作技术、改良农具，发明了楼车、水确等先进的农业生产和加工工具，并将几千年农耕积累的丰富经验归纳总结，留下《汜胜之书》《齐民要术》《王祯农书》《农政全书》等著名农学著作，对世界农业发展产生了深远影响。
translations.en: Ancient Chinese people were the first to cultivate rice, millet and other crops. Over the thousands of years of farming, they had kept improving crop cultivation techniques and farming tools, invented advanced farming and grain processing tools, such as seed plough and water-powered trip hammer, and put together the rich farming experience gained throughout the long-term practices in such famous works on agriculture as Fan Sheng Zhi Shu (The Book of Fan Sheng-Chih on Agriculture), Qi Min Yao Shu (Essential Techniques for the Peasantry), Wang Zhen Nong Shu (Wang Zhen's Book of Agriculture), and Nong Zheng Quan Shu (Complete Treatise on Agricultural Administration).These classics have profound impacts on the agricultural development in the world.

translations.zh: 悬壶济世中医药具有悠久的历史传统，神农尝百草的传说证明我们的远祖已经在与自然灾害、疾病的斗争中开始了医疗保健活动。
translations.en: Ancient Chinese Medicine Traditional Chinese medicine has a long history and tradition.

translations.zh: 至先秦两汉时形成以“整体观念”和“辩证论治”为特点的医学体系。
translations.en: The legend of Shennong（“Divine Husbandman”) tasting herbs proves that the distant ancestors in China had practiced medical care in their struggle against natural disasters and diseases.

translations.zh: 又经历数代不断的充实和发展，在基础理论、药物学、方剂学、针灸学等方面取得了重要的成就。
translations.en: From the pre-Qin period to the Han dynasty, a medical system featuring a "holistic approach" and “dialectical treatment" was formed.

translations.zh: 一般认为，中医的治疗体系主要有两种形式，一是以“神农一草药”为主的药物治疗法，二是以“黄帝一针砭”为主的针灸治疗法。
translations.en: With further development in later generations, it has made important achievements in basic theory, pharmacology, prescription science, acupuncture and moxibustion, and other aspects.

translations.zh: 唐以后，中国医药学理论和诊疗方法外传到高丽、日本、中亚、西亚等地，成为人类医学宝库的共同财富。
translations.en: It is generally believed that the treatment system of traditional Chinese medicine has two main forms: herbal therapy based on Shennong's herbal medicine and acupuncture based on Huangdi's stone needle therapy.

translations.zh: 在数千年的悠长岁月里，中国古代先民为满足自身物质生活与精神需要，锐意创新，磨砺出精湛的技艺，孕育出众多载入史册的发明创造，在农耕、纺织、冶铸、陶瓷、造纸与印刷等领域取得了重要的技术创新。
translations.en: Chinese Technology and Innovation In the thousand years of history, in order to meet their material and spiritual needs, the ancient Chinese people made great efforts to innovate and develop exquisite skills, culminating in numerous invaluable inventions and creations that are recorded in the annals of history.

translations.zh: 这些发明创造不仅改变了古代中国的历史面貌，滋养了华夏文明，为中国古代政治、经济、文化发展奠定了技术和物质基础，同时还远播到世界各地，或为当地人们直接采用，或激发他们进行相关研究并产生自己的发明，推动了世界近代历史的进程。
translations.en: Many important technological innovations were made in farming, textile, casting, porcelain, paper making and printing.

translations.zh: 蚕桑纺织中国是世界上最早养蚕织丝的国家。
translations.en: Sericulture and Textile China was the first country in the world to raise silkworms and weave silk.

translations.zh: 早在新石器时代，植桑和养蚕已成为原始生业的重要内容。
translations.en: Mulberry planting and silkworm rearing had become an important part of primitive textile production as early as the Neolithic Age.

translations.zh: 秦汉以后，中国丝织技术获得充分发展，汉代已广泛使用斜织机、提花机，织成精美的绮、锦。
translations.en: Chinese silk weaving technique was fully developed after the Qin and Han dynasties.

translations.zh: 唐宋以后，中国纺织机械及纺织工艺日趋完善，印染、刺绣等工艺使丝绸更加绚丽多彩。
translations.en: Inclined looms and pattern looms were widely used for weaving exquisite silk and brocades in the Han dynasty.

translations.zh: 精美的丝绸搭起连接中西的桥梁，丝绸之路成为中西文化交流的重要通道。
translations.en: After the Tang and Song dynasties, China's textile machinery and weaving technique became increasingly advanced, and printing, dyeing, embroidery and other processes made stunning and glamorous silk.

translations.zh: 金属冶铸中国是世界上铜铁冶铸技术最为发达的地区之一。
translations.en: Metal Smelting and Casting China is one of the most developed regions in the world in terms of bronze and iron smelting and casting techniques.

translations.zh: 异于西亚和欧洲地区以锻造为主制作兵器、工具等的传统，通过块范法铸造青铜礼器，成为中国青铜时代最为突出的技术特征。
translations.en: Unlike the tradition of forging weapons and tools in West Asia and Europe, casting bronzes by the piece-mold process has become the most prominent technical feature of the Bronze Age in China.

translations.zh: 中国很早就发明了生铁冶炼技术并以其为基础，发展出一整套独特且先进的钢铁冶炼和加工工艺。
translations.en: China invented the pig iron smelting technique long ago and developed a series of unique and advanced steel smelting and processing techniques on this basis.

translations.zh: 以青铜和钢铁为代表的中国古代金属冶铸技术大大提高了社会生产力，为古代社会的发展进步奠定了深厚的技术和物质基础，为世界文明的发展做出了重要贡献。
translations.en: The ancient Chinese smelting and casting techniques represented by bronze and steel greatly improve social productivity, laid a profound technical and material foundation for the development and progress of ancient society, and made important contributions to the development of world civilization.

translations.zh: 造纸与印刷书籍，是人类文明的重要载体。
translations.en: Papermaking and Printing books are an important carrier of human civilization.

translations.zh: 书籍质量的提升，有赖于造纸与印刷术的发明与提高。
translations.en: The improvement of the quality of books has relied on the invention and development of papermaking and printing.

translations.zh: 西汉时期，中国发明了造纸术。
translations.en: Papermaking was first invented in the Western Han dynasty.

translations.zh: 东晋时期，纸张逐渐取代简帛，成为主要的书写材料，并开始向世界各地广为传播。
translations.en: During the Eastern Jin dynasty, paper gradually replaced bamboo and silk slips as the main writing material, and began to spread all over the world.

translations.zh: 至迟在唐代初年，中国发明了雕版印刷术，并在宋代达到鼎盛。
translations.en: By the beginning of the Tang dynasty, China invented woodblock printing, which reached its peak in the Song dynasty.

translations.zh: 11世纪中叶，毕昇发明活字印刷术。
translations.en: Bi Sheng invented movable type printing in the middle of the 11th century.

translations.zh: 印刷术传承典籍与文化，对世界文化的传播、交流与发展起了巨大的推动作用
translations.en: Printing has allowed for the documentation of ancient classics and culture, greatly promoting the spread, exchange and development of world culture.

translations.zh: 营造法式工程是人类对科学的智慧应用，是人类物质文明重要的组成部分。
translations.en: Engineering and Architecture Engineering is the intelligent application of science by humankind and an important part of human civilization.

translations.zh: 在几千年的历史长河中，中国古代先民在农业生产、水利、建筑等领域创造了许多令人惊叹的伟大工程：都江堰、长城、大运河、紫禁城等，展示了中国古人的智慧和无穷的创造力，极大地促进了中国物质文化和社会经济的发展，也对世界文明的进步做出了重大贡献。
translations.en: Over thousands of years, Chinese people have made amazing contributions to agricultural production, water conservancy, architecture and other fields, such as the Dujiangyan Irrigation System, the Great Wall, the Grand Canal, and the Forbidden City.

translations.zh: 瓷名天下中国是瓷器的故乡。
translations.en: The World of porcelain China is the homeland of porcelain.

translations.zh: 早在商周时期，先民就创造了原始瓷。
translations.en: Proto-porcelain was being made in China as early as the Shang and Zhou dynasties.

translations.zh: 东汉晚期以越窑为代表的南方青釉瓷烧制成功，此后制瓷技术不断发展，唐时期形成南方地区以烧造青釉瓷器、北方地区以烧造白釉瓷器为主的“南青北白”的瓷器生产新格局。
translations.en: In the late Eastern Han dynasty, the southern green wares represented by the Yue kiln techniques were successfully made.

translations.zh: 宋元时期形成以耀州窑、定窑、磁州窑、钧窑、景德镇窑、龙泉窑、建窑为主体的七大窑系。
translations.en: Since then, porcelain techniques have been continuously developed.

translations.zh: 元代青花、釉里红及颜色釉的烧制技术日臻成熟。
translations.en: During the Sui and Tang dynasties, a new production trend of “southern green and northern white” was formed, with green wares being dominant in south China and white porcelain being dominant in north China.

translations.zh: 明清景德镇成为全国制瓷业中心，烧制出多样的彩绘瓷器，颜色釉、釉上彩、釉下彩瓷器异彩纷呈。
translations.en: During the Song and Yuan dynasties, seven main kilns were founded namely Yaozhou kilns, Ding kilns, Cizhou kilns, Jun kilns, Jingdezhen kilns, Longquan kilns and Jian kilns.

translations.zh: 中国瓷器从唐代起逐渐外销到亚洲以外其他地区，明清时达到顶峰，身影遍布欧洲、非洲、亚洲、美洲，对世界陶瓷发展贡献巨大。
translations.en: The firing technique of blue and white porcelain, underglaze-red porcelain and colored glaze had become matured gradually.

translations.zh: 指南针与航海指南针，又称磁罗盘或罗盘针，是由人工磁化的磁针和方位刻度盘构成的指示方位的仪器，它的发明是确定方位的长期实践过程中的产物。
translations.en: Compass and Navigation Compass, also known as a magnetic compass or compass needle, is an instrument that indicates the direction by an artificial magnetized needle and an azimuth dial.

translations.zh: 战国末期，古人已发现磁石能够指示南北。
translations.en: It is the product of a long-term practical process of determining the direction.

translations.zh: 北宋始，磁性指南工具进一步发展：人工磁体代替了天然磁石，制成水浮式指南鱼和水浮法、缕悬法、指甲法、碗唇法指南针。
translations.en: At the end of the Warring States period, ancient Chinese people discovered that magnets could indicate north and south.

translations.zh: 宋元时期，随着指南针在航海中的应用，航海活动范围空前扩大，明朝郑和船队七下“西洋”，是中国古代航海技术伟大成就的集中体现。
translations.en: At the beginning of the Northern Song dynasty, compasses were further developed.

translations.zh: 大约在13世纪时指南针先后传入亚、欧各国，增进了各国人民之间的文化交流与贸易往来，对世界经济、文化的发展起到巨大的推动作用。
translations.en: Artificial magnets replaced natural magnets, with the emergence of floating south-pointing fish and four types of compasses with the needle floating on water, suspended with silk fiber, rotating on nails, and rotating on bowl lips.

source.title_zh: 火药与火器
source.title_en: Gunpowder and Firearms

translations.zh: 火药在世界军事史、化学史中具有重要意义。
translations.en: Gunpowder is of great significance in world military history and chemical history.

source.title_zh: 火药与火器
source.title_en: Gunpowder and Firearms

translations.zh: 中国古代火药是以硝石、硫黄和木炭（或其他易碳化的有机物）按照一定比例组成的混合物，因其点火后迅速爆炸生成黑色烟焰，西方称之为黑火药。
translations.en: Gunpowder in ancient China was a mixture of saltpeter, sulfur and charcoal (or other easily carbonized organic materials) in a certain ratio.

source.title_zh: 火药与火器
source.title_en: Gunpowder and Firearms

translations.zh: 中国古代火药的发明与炼丹术密切相关，至晚于9世纪初，炼丹家发明了火药。
translations.en: The invention of gunpowder in ancient China is closely related to alchemy.

source.title_zh: 火药与火器
source.title_en: Gunpowder and Firearms

translations.zh: 五代至北宋初期，火药已经用于军事。
translations.en: Since the Five Dynasties and early Northern Song dynasty, gunpowder had been used in the military.

source.title_zh: 火药与火器
source.title_en: Gunpowder and Firearms

translations.zh: 1044年成书的《武经总要》记载了三个军用火药配方，是世界上最早的军用火药配方。
translations.en: Wu Jing Zong Yao (The Comprehensive Essentials from the Military Classics) written in 1044 records the three earliest military gunpowder formulas in the world.

source.title_zh: 火药与火器
source.title_en: Gunpowder and Firearms

translations.zh: 13世纪，中国的火药技术传入阿拉伯地区，14世纪初经阿拉伯人传到欧洲。
translations.en: China's gunpowder technology was introduced to the Arab world in the 13th century and was spread to Europe by the Arabs in the early 14th century.

source.title_zh: 火药与火器
source.title_en: Gunpowder and Firearms

translations.zh: 李约瑟指出，14世纪火炮的第一次轰鸣，敲响了城堡的丧钟，因而也敲响了西方的军事贵族封建制的丧钟。
translations.en: Joseph Needham pointed out that the first boom of artillery in the 14th century sounded the death knell of the castle, and thus also sounded the death knell of the feudal system of military aristocracy in the West.

translations.zh: 引入西方科技近代科技的传入始于明末清初，主要以对西方科技经典的翻译为主。
translations.en: Introduction of Western Technology The introduction of modern science and technology into China can be dated back to the late Ming and early Qing dynasties, mainly through the translation of Western science and technology classics.

translations.zh: 鸦片战争后，中国又一次出现向西方学习的新热潮。
translations.en: After the end of the First Opium War, there was an upsurge in learning from the West in China.

translations.zh: 西方科技的传入，加速了中国社会的转型
translations.en: The introduction of Western science and technology accelerated the transformation of Chinese society.

translations.zh: 明朝中以后，规模空前的海上航行使中国与世界的联系更加紧密，产生于欧洲的近代科学技术进入中国，对中国的天文历法、舆图地志产生了重要影响。
translations.en: Learning from the West After the mid-Ming dynasty, unprecedented maritime navigation connected China more closely with the world.

translations.zh: 鸦片战争以后，几代有识之士通过翻译科学著作、派遣留洋学生、发展新式教育、设立科研机构、创办新式工业等方式学习西方科技、寻求国家富强。
translations.en: The introduction of modern science and technology from Europe had an important influence on China's astronomical calendar and maps.

translations.zh: 在20世纪上半叶，我国科技教育与科研事业初具规模，现代工业则在动荡中艰难前行。
translations.en: Since the end of the First Opium War, generations of people of vision have devoted themselves to learning Western science and technology, improving national prosperity by translating scientific works, sending students studying abroad, developing new education patterns, setting up scientific research institutions, and establishing new industries.

translations.zh: 译著新学（各类近代科技知识通过译著不断传入中国，冲击着中国传统思维模式、生活方式）。
translations.en: Translation of Western Books Comprehensive modern scientific and technological knowledge has been spread to China through translation.

translations.zh: 大规模的翻译主要有两次：一是明末清初由耶稣会士主导的翻译；二是19世纪下半叶规模更大的翻译活动，中外合作、官私并行。
translations.en: This had a huge impact on the traditional ways of thinking and lifestyles of Chinese people.

translations.zh: 兴办科教事业进入20世纪，随着改革学制、确立现代教育制度，以及海外留学生的归来，科技界知识分子群体逐渐成型，开始探索现代科技在中国实现本土化的道路，创建科研机构，组织科技团体，开展学术交流，推进制度建设。
translations.en: Development of Science and Education In the 20th century, with the establishment of a modern educational system through reform, and the return of Chinese overseas students, an intellectual science and technology community gradually formed.

translations.zh: 20世纪20至40 年代，科学技术对中国社会的影响力不断扩大，科学教育体系逐步完善，科学团体和科研机构陆续创建，具有本土化特征的中国科学文化体系逐步建立起来。
translations.en: They endeavored to explore ways to localize modern science and technology in China.

translations.zh: 兴办大学新式教育的发展为兴办现代大学提供了基础。
translations.en: Establishment of Universities The development of new education laid a solid foundation for establishing modern universities.

translations.zh: 壬戌学制颁布后，许多专门学校升格为大学，到1926年，教育部备案的专门以上学校共计92所。
translations.en: Following the promulgation of the Renxu School System, many specialized schools were upgraded to universities.

translations.zh: 南京国民政府成立后，对大学进行整顿，到1936年，全国备案的专科以上高校有110所，其中大学42所、独立学院38所、专科学校30所。
translations.en: There were a total of 92 specialized schools, colleges and universities registered with the Ministry of Education in 1926. The universities underwent adjustment by the Nanjing National Government who came to power in 1927. By 1936, there were 110 specialized schools, colleges and universities on record nationwide, including 42 universities,38 independent colleges and 30 specialized schools

translations.zh: 结语科技兴则民族兴，科技强则国家强。
translations.en: Afterword When science and technology are soundly developed, the nation will prosper, and the country will be stronger.

translations.zh: 在绵延五千多年的文明发展进程中，中华民族创造了举世闻名的科技成就，也经历了近代以后屡次与科技革命失之交臂的深重苦难。
translations.en: China achieved world-renowned scientific and technological achievements over the past 5,000 years, but also suffered miserable fate in its modern history because of missing the opportunities brought by technological revolutions.

translations.zh: 新中国成立特别是改革开放以来，我国科技创新取得举世瞩目的伟大成就。
translations.en: Since the founding of the People's Republic of China in 1949, especially after the reform and opening-up that began in the late 1970s, China has made great achievements in scientific and technological innovation, which have attracted worldwide attention.

translations.zh: 从“向科学进军”到“科学技术是第一生产力”，从实施科教兴国战略到建设创新型国家，从全面实施创新驱动发展战略到建设世界科技强国，我国科技实力正在从量的积累迈向质的飞跃、从点的突破迈向系统能力提升。
translations.en: From rising to challenges in scientific researches to regarding science and technology as the primary productive forces, from the strategy of reinvigorating China through science and education and the innovation-driven development strategy to building China into a country of innovation and a global leader in science and technology, China's scientific and technological strength has achieved a leap from quantity to quality.

translations.zh: 站在世界新一轮科技革命和产业变革同我国转变发展方式的历史性交汇期，科技创新正在加速推进，并广泛渗透到人类社会的各个方面，成为重塑世界格局、创造人类未来的主导力量。
translations.en: At the historical intersection of a new round of scientific and technological revolution and industrial transformation, and China's own transformation of growth model, innovation in science and technology is picking up speed and penetrating into every aspect of society, and has become a leading force to reshape the world landscape and create the future of humanity.

translations.zh: 科学技术从来没有像今天这样深刻影响着国家前途命运，从来没有像今天这样深刻影响着人民生活福祉。
translations.en: Never before have science and technology had such a profound impact on the future of a country and on people's well-being.

translations.zh: 中国国家博物馆将继续收藏和展示好反映科技发展的代表性物证，引领广大观众深入了解科技发展的蓬勃伟力，不断增强文化自信，为实现中华民族伟大复兴汇聚磅礴力量。
translations.en: The National Museum of China will take continued efforts to collect and display material evidence representative of the development of science and technology and help the general public know more about the power of science and technology.

translations.zh: 中华人民共和国成立，中国的科学技术事业获得空前的重视与发展，科技实力伴随经济发展同步壮大，在满足国防需要、服务经济建设、改善人民生活等方面发挥了重要作用，中国也成为具有重要影响的世界科技大国。
translations.en: Towards Rejuvenation Since the People's Republic of China was founded in 1949, science and technology have been given unprecedented attention.

translations.zh: 在科技进步的强力推动下，中国成功走出了一条中国特色的新型工业化发展道路，建立起完整的现代工业体系，实现了从农业大国向世界性工业大国的历史性转变和跨越发展。
translations.en: China's scientific and technological strength is growing with its economy and has contributed significantly to the national defense, economic development, and improvements in livelihood.

translations.zh: 创办新式工业19世纪60年代，中国近代工业在谋求富国强兵的洋务运动中逐渐萌生。
translations.en: Establishment of new Industries In the 1860s, China's modern industry started to grow amid the Self-Strengthening Movement for developing China into a prosperous country with a strong military.

translations.zh: 此后数十年经过官私资本积累，近现代工业的若干门类逐步建立，且曾在国内外形势较缓和的若干时期得以快速发展。
translations.en: In the decades that followed, different kinds of modern industries were set up due to the accumulation of official and private capital and maintained rapid growth when the domestic and international situation became stable enough.

translations.zh: 因社会动荡、基础薄弱，直至20世纪中叶，中国尚未建成独立完整的工业体系，在国际分工中处于弱势，且地域、行业发展极不均衡，技术水平较低。
translations.en: The social unrest and weak industrial foundations made it difficult for China to put a complete industrial system in place until the middle of the 20th century.

translations.zh: 新中国新科技新中国成立以来，科技事业得到有组织、有计划的发展和建设。
translations.en: Scientific and Technological Development after 1949 After the founding of the People's Republic of China in 1949, the country saw a development in science and technology in a carefully planned way.

translations.zh: 科技体制逐步建立和完善。
translations.en: Scientific and technological systems were established and improved, and national investments were expanded.

translations.zh: 国家对科技事业的投入持续增加，科研条件不断改善，重大科技成果不断涌现，中国科技事业与世界先进水平逐渐从跟跑走向并跑甚至在某些领域开始领跑。
translations.en: With better conditions for scientific research and increasing major scientific and technological achievements, China's scientific and technological development was reaching advanced world level.

translations.zh: 切为了人民新中国成立后，加强生产技术研究、正确选择技术，形成合理的技术结构，加强工农业生产一线的技术开发和科研成果推广，科技事业为促进经济发展、满足人民生活需要作出重要贡献。
translations.en: All for the People After the People's Republic of China was founded in 1949, great efforts have been made to researches on productive technologies, by selecting the right technologies, building a reasonable technological structure, and encouraging technological development at the frontiers of industry and agriculture.

translations.zh: 农业科技和纺织工业发展解决了人民的吃饭穿衣问题，医药卫生事业进步将人口平均预期寿命提高了一倍以上，电信、印刷等领域的跨越式发展极大改善了人民生活。
translations.en: Technological advances have made major contributions to economic development and have improved the living conditions in China.

translations.zh: 强国基石新中国成立后，确立了工业现代化、农业现代化、国防现代化和科学技术现代化的战略目标。
translations.en: Cornerstones of National Strength Soon after 1949, China set the strategic goals of modernizing industry, agriculture, national defense, and science and technology.

translations.zh: 经过70多年的发展，中国的基础设施建设水平全面跃升、基础工业迅速发展、国防工业成就斐然，为提升综合国力、保障国家安全、建设世界强国奠定坚实基础。
translations.en: After more than seventy years of endeavor, outstanding achievements have been made in China's infrastructure construction, basic industry, and national defense industry.

translations.zh: 走向太空从东方红号卫星发射成功，到北斗导航卫星全球组网基本系统完成部署；从长征一号火箭首飞，到长征系列火箭实现480余次发射；从第一艘神舟飞船升空，到12次载人飞行把20名航天员送入太空。
translations.en: China's aerospace science and technology industry has made remarkable progress from the successful launching of Dongfanghong-1 satellite to the deployment of the Beidou navigation satellite global networking system; from the first flight of the Long March-1 rocket to over 480 launches of the Long March series rockets; and from the ascension of the first Shenzhou manned spacecraft to twelve manned space missions that sent twenty Chinese astronauts (taikonauts) into space.

translations.zh: 中国航天科技工业的发展，为推动国家经济社会发展、国防现代化建设和科学技术进步作出卓越贡献。
translations.en: These achievements have contributed to national economic and social development, the modernization of national defense, and scientific and technological progress.

translations.zh: 扫一扫，观看手语讲解视频午门紫禁城正门。
translations.en: Gate Meridian Gate (Wu men) The main gate of the Forbidden City, the Meridian Gate was built in 1420 in the early Ming dynasty.

translations.zh: 建成于明永乐十八年（1420年），通高37.95米，是紫禁城四座城门中最雄伟高大的一座。
translations.en: An overall height of 37.95 metres makes it the tallest of the four city gates.

translations.zh: 午门的平面呈“凹”字形，该造型从古代城门前的“双阙”演变而来。
translations.en: Viewed from above, it resembles the Chinese character '凹', a design derived from the ancient city entrances, which were often decorated by que towers on either side.

translations.zh: 午门共有五个门洞，正中开三门，两侧各有一处掖门，俗称“明三暗五”。
translations.en: A total of five passages lead through the Meridian Gate: three central passages and two side passages.

translations.zh: 中门通常专供皇帝出入，当皇帝大婚时，皇后乘坐的凤舆从中门进宫。
translations.en: The central passage was reserved for the emperor. The only exceptions were the empress, who would enter through it once in her lifetime on the day of her wedding,

translations.zh: 此外，通过殿试选拔的状元、榜眼、探花，在宣布殿试结果后从中门出宫。
translations.en: and the top three successful candidates of the Palace Examination, who could exit from the imperial palace through the central passage after the examination results were announced.

translations.zh: 正面东侧门供文武官员出入，西侧门供宗室王公出入。
translations.en: The gate on the eastern side was used by civil and military officials, while members of the imperial family and aristocrats used the western gate.

translations.zh: 两门只在举行大型庆典活动时开启。
translations.en: The two side gates were opened only during grand celebrations.

translations.zh: 每年十月初一，在午门举行颁布次年历书的“颁朔”典礼。
translations.en: Each year on the first day of the tenth lunar month, the lunar calendar for the following year was issued in a ceremony at the Meridian Gate.

translations.zh: 遇有重大战争，大军凯旋时，要在此举行向皇帝进献战俘的“受俘礼”。
translations.en: In times of war, the ceremony of presenting captives to the emperor would also be held here to mark the army's triumphant return.

translations.zh: 明代皇帝处罚大臣的“廷杖”也曾在此施刑。
translations.en: Moreover, in the Ming dynasty, the Meridian Gate was the site of tingzhang, a corporal punishment imposed by the emperor on high officials by flogging with a stick.

translations.zh: 前言中国是享誉世界的文明古国，在漫长的历史进程中，创造了丰富灿烂的物质和精神文化。
translations.en: INTRODUCTION Throughout its long history, China has seen the creation of a wealth of material and spiritual culture.

translations.zh: 陶瓷无愧于其中的杰出代表。
translations.en: Ceramics stand as a shining example of these riches.

translations.zh: 早在距今约两万年前，我们祖先就发明了制陶术，使我国成为世界上最早制作和使用陶器的国家之一。
translations.en: As early as 20,000 years ago, China was one of the first places to produce and use pottery.

translations.zh: 在距今三千多年前的夏、商之际，我国已能烧造原始瓷，到距今一千八百多年前的东汉，又创烧出真正意义上的瓷器，在人类文明史上写下光辉一页。
translations.en: Proto-porcelain was first made at the turn of the Xia (c. 21st century BCE-16th century BCE) and Shang (c. 16th century BCE-11th century BCE) dynasties, prior to the development of true porcelains in the Eastern Han Dynasty (25-220).

translations.zh: 从红陶、灰陶、彩陶、黑陶、白陶到原始瓷、青瓷、黑瓷、白瓷，以及五光十色的颜色釉瓷和色彩缤纷的釉下彩、釉上彩瓷等，中国陶瓷层出不穷的品种和源远流长的历史，堪称世界工艺史上的奇迹。
translations.en: The use of red, grey colour-painted, black, and white pottery in China's ancient cultures was followed by proto-porcelain, which in turn gave rise to techniques for producing celadon, black porcelain, white porcelain, and coloured porcelain.

translations.zh: 中国陶瓷自唐代开始大量远销海外，其卓越的制瓷技术和辉煌的艺术成就，对世界上许多国家产生过广泛而深远的影响，极大地推动了世界陶瓷文化的发展，充分证明中国是名副其实的“瓷国”。
translations.en: As time passed, magnificent underglaze and overglaze porcelain came into being.

translations.zh: 武英殿始建于明初，前殿武英殿，后殿敬思殿与前殿形制略似，两殿间以穿廊相连，东西配殿为凝道殿和焕章殿。
translations.en: First built in the early Ming Dynasty, the Hall of Martial Valour is the front hall, with the Hall of Respectful Thoughts (Jingsi dian) at the rear.

translations.zh: 明代皇帝曾于此斋居及召见大臣。
translations.en: Ming Dynasty emperors practiced ritual abstinence and held audiences with government officials in the Hall of Martial Valour.

translations.zh: 越的制多国家世界明末农民军领袖李自成于崇祯十七年（1644年）攻在一百十六万谓自成入紫禁城，曾在武英殿举行即位仪式。
translations.en: When Li Zicheng, leader of a peasant uprising in the late Ming Dynasty, entered the Forbidden City in 1644, he held his enthronement ceremony in this hall.

translations.zh: 清兵入关展品之初，摄政王多尔衮以此作为理政之所。
translations.en: After the Qing troops entered Beijing, Prince Regent Dorgon made the Hall of Martial Valour his office, handling political affairs here.

translations.zh: 康熙八年（1669年）因太和殿、乾清宫等处维修，康熙帝曾一度移居武英殿。
translations.en: In 1669, the Kangxi Emperor moved his residence to this hall because the Hall of Supreme Harmony (Taihe dian) and the Palace of Heavenly Purity (Qianqing gong) were under restoration.

translations.zh: 而后，又于武英殿纂辑、刊校书籍，所刊行图书称为“殿本”。
translations.en: Later, the hall was also used for compiling and publishing books known as 'palace editions'.

translations.zh: 民国初期，其先紫禁城外朝部分被辟为古物陈列所，将武英殿用作文物展厅。
translations.en: In the early years of the Republic of China, when the outer court of the Forbidden City was converted into the National Museum of Art (Guwu Chenliesuo), the Hall of Martial Valour served as an exhibition hall for the imperial collections.

translations.zh: 渐失韵味的清代晚期粉彩瓷清代晚期粉彩瓷多沿袭乾隆朝已有品种，除白地粉彩瓷以外，也有各种色地粉彩瓷。
translations.en: Gradual Decline: Famille-rose Porcelains of the Late Qing Dynasty Famille-rose porcelains of the late Qing Dynasty generally imitated those of the Qianlong reign.

translations.zh: 其突出特点是在画面中大面积使用近似藕荷色的紫彩，通常称之”“同治年制”等款、光绪“巨德堂制”等款、同治朝为皇帝大婚特制的署“燕喜同和”“吉祥如意”为“雪青彩”。
translations.en: In addition to white, many other colours were used as the ground.

translations.zh: 晚清粉彩瓷以道光朝署“慎德堂制”“体和殿制”等款的产品最为精致。
translations.en: The finest Famille-rose porcelains of this era include those and "tihedian zhi" inscriptions made exclusively for the use of the Empress Dowager Cixi in the Guangxu reign.

translations.zh: 品种锐减的清代晚期颜色釉瓷名政治二十年清代晚期颜色釉瓷多沿袭康熙、雍正、乾隆朝已有的部分品种，鲜有创新。
translations.en: Falling Away: Colour-glazed Porcelains of the Late Qing Dynasty No breakthroughs were made in colour-glazed porcelains of the late Qing Dynasty.

translations.zh: 与康熙、雍正、行过考察乾隆三朝御窑颜色釉瓷相比，造型显得笨拙，胎体趋于厚重，釉色欠纯正，工艺水平日渐低下。
translations.en: Compared with those made in the Kangxi, Yongzheng, and Qianlong reigns, the colour-glazed porcelains of this period were thick and heavy in shape and inferior in colour and craftsmanship.

translations.zh: 出任经历八十年代三十年间瓷业人才又在反复民国四奖，醴陵清内府色绘浇黄釉盖罐纸样清内府色绘浇黄釉刻划折枝菊花牡丹纹长方花盆和盆托纸样

translations.zh: 承前绪的清代晚期青花瓷清代晚期景德镇御窑青花瓷在造型方面多沿袭前朝，少有创新。
translations.en: Successors:Blue-and-white Porcelains in the Late Qing Dynasty

translations.zh: 产品胎质疏松、胎釉结合不够紧密，青花赏瓶（俗称“赏瓶”）、玉壶春瓶、杏圆瓶、琮式瓶等大运瓷器中的传统品种，历朝延续烧造。
translations.en: called gift vases), yuhuchun vases, xingyuan vases, and cong-shaped vases, as traditional shapes, were produced throughout the late Qing Dynasty.

translations.zh: 品种锐减的清代晚期颜色釉瓷多沿袭康熙、乾隆三朝御窑颜色釉瓷相比，造型显有时代特征的精品，主要有釉、窑变釉、青釉、紫金釉、厂官釉等，与当时盛行的仿古瓷精品难辨。
translations.en: No breakthroughs were made in colour-glazed porcelain during the Republican Period.

translations.zh: 日用瓷主要有釉、窑变釉、青釉、紫金釉、厂官釉等，与当时盛行的仿古瓷精品难辨。
translations.en: Colour-glazed porcelains of this period were mainly divided into two categories: those made for daily use and those made for display.

translations.zh: 熊希龄（1870～1937年），字秉三，湖南省凤凰县人，近代著名政治家、实业家。
translations.en: Xiong Xiling (1870-1937), a native of Fenghuang County, Hunan Province, was a modern statesman and industrialist.

translations.zh: 光绪三十年（1904年）受湖南巡抚端方委派，赴日本考察实业，到过东京、大阪等地，并特意到日本瓷厂进行过考察。
translations.en: Xiong was sent by Duanfang, the Grand Coordinator of Hunan, on an investigation tour to Japan in 1904 (the thirtieth year of the Guangxu reign).

translations.zh: 光绪三十一年，在他的发起下，于姜湾创办瓷业学堂，熊氏出任经理，聘日本技师为教师，培养制瓷技术人才。
translations.en: On his tour, Xiong made inspections in Tokyo and Osaka, and established the Hunan Porcelain School in 1905 in Jiangwan and was appointed the director.

translations.zh: 光绪三十二年，又创建瓷业公司，聘请景德镇名师向工人传授烧造细瓷之技艺。
translations.en: The following year, he established the Hunan Porcelain Company and invited ceramic artists from Jingdezhen to train his workers.

translations.zh: 自此，醴陵瓷业才由乡村发展到城市，由粗瓷发展为细瓷。
translations.en: Ceramics thus developed from the rural area to the cities, and craftsmanship improved greatly.

translations.zh: 湖南瓷业公司的突出成就是在反复试验下，创烧出前所未有的釉下五彩瓷器。
translations.en: Their most significant production was an innovative polychrome underglaze decoration, which required numerous trials.

translations.en: The purple-clay pottery of Yixing, Jiangsu Province, developed rapidly and gained popularity, as literati involved themselves in production and connoisseurship.

translations.en: Numerous renowned potters emerged in the Qing Dynasty.

translations.en: The Qianlong Emperor, a lifelong tea lover who was very particular about tea utensils, had purple-clay pottery items made to order in Yixing.

translations.zh: 景德镇御窑仿钧釉瓷钧窑瓷器独特的釉色对后世影响深远，明、清至今，许多瓷窑均视其为样板进行仿制。
translations.en: Porcelain in Imitation of Jun Ware in The unique colours of Jun glaze have exerted a profound influence on later generations.

translations.zh: 景德镇御窑自明宣德年间已开始仿烧钧釉瓷。
translations.en: From the Ming and Qing dynasties to the present day, many kilns have produced porcelain in imitation of Jun ware.

translations.zh: 清代雍正时期，宫廷收藏的钧窑瓷器还被发往御窑厂照样仿烧，故而仿品在尺寸、造型、釉色等方面与宫廷藏品基本一致，几可乱真。
translations.en: The imitations produced by the Jingdezhen Imperial Kiln during the Yongzheng Emperor's reign seemed so authentic that it proved difficult for people to differentiate them from the genuine Jun wares.

translations.zh: 清代景德镇御窑在仿烧基础上不断创新，烧造出新紫釉、窑变釉、炉钧釉瓷等新品种。
translations.en: The Imperial Kiln of the Qing dynasty also made continuous innovations and invented new varieties such as the sky-blue glaze with purple-red splashes, flambe glaze, and robin's egg glaze in new than those of the kilns

source.title_zh: 余辉闪耀清代晚期、民国瓷器（公元1796~1949年）
source.title_en: Afterglow Porcelains of the Late Qing Dynasty and Republican Period

translations.zh: 清代道光二十年（1840年）鸦片战争以后，随着内忧外患接踵而至，清王朝日趋衰败，景德镇制瓷业总体上呈现逐渐衰退的局面。
translations.en: After the Opium War of 1840 (the twentieth year of the Daoguang reign), the Qing Dynasty went into decline, wracked by internal disturbance and foreign aggression.

source.title_zh: 余辉闪耀清代晚期、民国瓷器（公元1796~1949年）
source.title_en: Afterglow Porcelains of the Late Qing Dynasty and Republican Period

translations.zh: 但清代晚期御窑瓷器仍然有闪光点，例如专为同治皇帝大婚和慈禧皇太后万寿批量烧造的成套用瓷，有如故宫博物院诚如天边一抹晚霞，闪耀余辉。
translations.en: However, the Emperor's wedding and Empress Dowager Cixi's birthday, forming an afterglow of the kilns' former glories.

source.title_zh: 余辉闪耀清代晚期、民国瓷器（公元1796~1949年）
source.title_en: Afterglow Porcelains of the Late Qing Dynasty and Republican Period

translations.zh: 在洋务运动的影响下，熊希龄（1870~1937年）在湖南醴陵姜湾创办瓷业公司和瓷业学堂，聘请景德镇和日本技师担任讲师，培养了一批制瓷技术人才。
translations.en: Inspired by the Westernisation Movement, Xiong Xiling (1870-1937) established the Porcelain Company and Porcelain School in Jiangwan, Liling, Hunan Province, first made.

source.title_zh: 余辉闪耀清代晚期、民国瓷器（公元1796~1949年）
source.title_en: Afterglow Porcelains of the Late Qing Dynasty and Republican Period

translations.zh: 这是中国现代高温釉下五彩瓷器的滥觞，醴陵瓷器从此名扬天下。
translations.en: Liling porcelains since became widely known.

source.title_zh: 熊希龄乱中求变的民国瓷器
source.title_en: Innovating in Turbulence: Porcelains of the Republican Period

translations.zh: 熊希龄（1870～1937年），字秉三，实业家、实业家。
translations.en: Xiong Xiling (1870-1937), courtesy name Bingsan, was statesman and industrialist.

source.title_zh: 熊希龄乱中求变的民国瓷器
source.title_en: Innovating in Turbulence: Porcelains of the Republican Period

translations.zh: 光绪十八年（1892年）参加。
translations.en: Xiong was sent by Duanfang to Japan in 1904 (the thirtieth year of the Guangxu reign.

source.title_zh: 熊希龄乱中求变的民国瓷器
source.title_en: Innovating in Turbulence: Porcelains of the Republican Period

translations.zh: 通常所说的民国系指1912年1月1日中华民国成立至1949年10月1日中华人民共和国成立这段时间。
translations.en: The Jingdezhen kilns remained the major porcelain manufacturers in China during the Republican period which lasted from 1 January 1912, when the Republic of China was founded, to the founding of the People's Republic on 1 October 1949.

source.title_zh: 熊希龄乱中求变的民国瓷器
source.title_en: Innovating in Turbulence: Porcelains of the Republican Period

translations.zh: 期间制作的瓷器，仍以景德镇窑产品为主，大致可分为仿古瓷和日用瓷两大类。
translations.en: Porcelains manufactured over this period chiefly fall into two categories: antique-imitating wares and daily utensils.

source.title_zh: 熊希龄乱中求变的民国瓷器
source.title_en: Innovating in Turbulence: Porcelains of the Republican Period

translations.zh: 光绪三十一年，在他的发起下，于湖南瓷业公司里，聘日本技师为教师，培养制瓷技术人才。
translations.en: He established the Hunan Porcelain School in 1905 in Jiangxi.

source.title_zh: 熊希龄乱中求变的民国瓷器
source.title_en: Innovating in Turbulence: Porcelains of the Republican Period

translations.zh: 公司，聘请景德镇名师向工人传授烧造技艺。
translations.en: He established the Hunan Porcelain Company and invented underglaze polychrome porcelain.

source.title_zh: 熊希龄乱中求变的民国瓷器
source.title_en: Innovating in Turbulence: Porcelains of the Republican Period

translations.zh: 总体来说，民国瓷器在产量、质量和艺术性方面，均已走下坡路，但毋庸置疑，这一时期确实也出现一些具有时代特征的精品。
translations.en: Overall, porcelain-making in these four decades saw a decline in terms of production scale, quality, and artistic merit.

source.title_zh: 熊希龄乱中求变的民国瓷器
source.title_en: Innovating in Turbulence: Porcelains of the Republican Period

translations.zh: 试验下，创烧出前所未有的釉下五彩瓷器。
translations.en: At the same time, however, the period gave rise to some fine and distinctive works, such as the porcelains made by the Jiangxi Porcelain Company, porcelains inscribed with "Jurentang zhi" made for President Yuan Shikai (1859-1916) under the supervision of Guo Baochang (1867-1942) at Jingdezhen, porcelains made by eight renowned Jingdezhen potters, antique-imitating porcelains of the early Republic, and light-coloured porcelains made by master potters.

source.title_zh: 熊希龄乱中求变的民国瓷器
source.title_en: Innovating in Turbulence: Porcelains of the Republican Period

translations.zh: 陶瓷业由乡村发展到城市，由粗瓷发展为细瓷。
translations.en: Ceramics thus developed from the rural area to the urban area, from coarse porcelain to fine porcelain.

translations.zh: 景德镇御窑钧窑瓷器独特的喜爱，促使这镇御窑自明宣德年、邵大亨等精样仿烧，故而有一批御用紫砂茶器在仿烧基础上又别具一格的德化窑瓷器。
translations.en: Very Unique in Style: Porcelain of the Dehua Kilns The unique colours of the Dehua kilns in production and day, many kilns have Yongzheng Emperor's particular about tea Imperial Kiln of the splashes, flambé glaze.

translations.zh: 清代德化窑仍以烧造白瓷为主，产品在继承明代风格的基础上，又有新的发展，各种瓶、壶、罐、香炉、笔筒、笔山、笔洗等日用器物比明代显著增多，装饰技法有模印贴花、刻花、印花、镂空、雕塑等。
translations.en: In the Qing Dynasty, the Dehua kilns chiefly produced white porcelains.

translations.zh: 瓷塑作品继续烧造，以观音、罗汉、达摩像等最为常见。
translations.en: Qing Dehua wares followed Ming precedents while taking on new features.

translations.zh: 雕塑水平虽不及明代，但也能做到形神兼备，仍体现出较高的艺术水平。
translations.en: The products featured more daily utensils, such as vases, ewers, jars, censers, brush pots, penholders, and brush washers, than those in the Ming.

translations.zh: 清代德化窑除烧造白瓷外，还烧造青花、五彩、粉彩和颜色釉瓷等。
translations.en: Decorations were applied by carving, impressing, moulded appliqué, hollow engraving and sculpting.

translations.zh: 叶罐
translations.en: In the Qing the Dehua kilns also manufactured blue-and-white, famille-verte, famille-rose and colour-glazed products.

source.title_zh: 郎窑红釉瓷
source.title_en: Lang Kiln Red-glazed Porcelains

translations.zh: 郎窑红釉瓷是高温颜色釉瓷名品之一。
translations.en: Lang Kiln Red-glazed Porcelains One of the famous high-temperature colour-glazed porcelains, Lang kiln red-glazed porcelain was named after Lang Tingji (1663-1715) the Grand Coordinator of Jiangxi.

source.title_zh: 郎窑红釉瓷
source.title_en: Lang Kiln Red-glazed Porcelains

translations.zh: 它是在模仿明代宣德朝鲜红釉瓷器的基础上创烧的一种高温铜红釉瓷，系因康熙四十四年（1705年）至五十一年（1712年）江西巡抚郎廷极（1663～1715年）在景德镇设窑窑器署烧造、进贡朝廷而得名。
translations.en: Lang was in charge of Jingdezhen imperial kiln between 1705 and 1712.

source.title_zh: 郎窑红釉瓷
source.title_en: Lang Kiln Red-glazed Porcelains

translations.zh: 郎窑红釉瓷以氧化亚铜胶体粒子为主要着色剂，在生坯挂釉后，入窑经1300℃以上的高温，在强还原气氛中焙烧而成。
translations.en: Colloidal particles of cuprous oxide served as the major red colourant, and the glazed article was reduction fired at a temperature above 1300°C.

source.title_zh: 郎窑红釉瓷
source.title_en: Lang Kiln Red-glazed Porcelains

translations.zh: 景德镇因烧成时釉中氧化铜对窑内的气氛、温度等要求极为严格，故成品率极低，常常是百里挑一甚至千里挑一。
translations.en: This technique had such strict requirements for temperature and imperial environment in the kiln, that for every successful product there were a hundred or even a thousand defective ones.

translations.zh: 五光十色的颜色釉瓷清代景德镇御窑颜色釉瓷在仿古的基础上大量创新，不但釉色更加丰富、呈色更超稳定，而且制作工艺亦比明代精细。
translations.en: Colourful and Brilliant: Colour-glazed Porcelains In the Qing Dynasty, Jingdezhen-made colour-glazed porcelains saw more and purer colours as well as improved craftsmanship.

translations.zh: 从文献记载和传世品看，清代景德镇御窑烧造的颜色釉瓷品种多达数十种，其中以康熙、雍正、乾隆三朝品种最多、产量最大，质量亦最高。
translations.en: Historical records and surviving items show that the Jingdezhen imperial kiln manufactured dozens of colour-glazed porcelain types in the Qing Dynasty.

translations.zh: 郎廷极郎廷极（1663～1715年），字紫衡、紫垣，号北轩。
translations.en: Lang Tingji (1663-1715), courtesy name Ziheng and Ziyuan and alternatively called Beixuan, was born in Guangning, Fengtian (present-day Beizhen, Liaoning Province).

translations.zh: 奉天广宁（今辽宁北镇）人。
translations.en: From 1705 to 1712, during the Kangxi reign, he served as the Grand Coordinator of Jiangxi and subsequently established new kilns at Jingdezhen, which have been historically known as the Lang kilns.

translations.zh: 康熙朝官吏、学者。
translations.en: These kilns are famous for imitating Ming porcelains, especially those from the Xuande and Chenghua reigns, producing copies that are difficult to distinguish from the genuine articles.

Among existing articles today, there are some inscribed with the hall mark "Imperially-named Chunyitang", or with the hall mark "From the Collection of Imperially-named Chunyitang" and reign mark "Made in the Kangxi reign of the Great Qing" appearing on the same article.

translations.zh: 据郎廷极同时代人刘廷玑撰写的《在园杂志》和许谨斋诗稿，郎窑的主要成就是擅仿明代各朝御窑瓷器，所仿宣德、成化朝产品，水平高超，足以乱真。
translations.en: This type of porcelains were undoubtedly made in the Lang kilns, since the hall name "Chunyitang" was given to Lang Tingji by the Kangxi Emperor.

translations.zh: 康熙皇帝曾御赐郎廷极“纯一堂”的堂号，传世瓷器中郎窑瓷署“御赐纯一堂”款或署“御赐纯一堂珍藏”和“大清康熙年制”双款者，当属郎窑制品，代表了康熙晚期景德镇窑的制瓷水平。
translations.en: Once being presented to the court as tributes, Lang kiln products are considered the highest quality porcelains of the late Kangxi reign.

translations.zh: 博采众长的粉彩瓷粉彩瓷是康熙晚期在烧造五彩瓷的基础上，受琅彩工艺影响，由景德镇制瓷工匠创烧的釉上彩瓷新品种。
translations.en: Elegant and Soft-coloured: Famille-Rose Porcelains Famille-rose (fencai) porcelain falls into the category of overglaze-colour porcelain.

translations.zh: 因使用法琅料按照西洋绘画技法描绘纹饰，故曾被称作“洋彩”。
translations.en: It was painted with enamels using Western painting techniques, and hence known as"Western painted porcelain".

translations.zh: 粉彩瓷自康熙晚期出现以后，至雍正朝已取代五彩瓷成为景德镇釉上彩瓷中最主要的品种，此后历朝盛烧不衰，尤以雍正朝产品受到的评价最高。
translations.en: Famille-rose porcelains were first made in the late Kangxi reign.

translations.zh: 其所绘花卉，草虫等典型纹饰，颇得画家辉寿平（1633~1690年），邹一桂（1686～1772年）作品神韵，可谓“前无古人，后无来者，鲜妍夺目，工致殊常”（寂园叟《陶雅》）。
translations.en: By the Yongzheng reign, famille-rose had replaced famille-verte as the dominant type of overglaze-colour porcelains produced at Jingdezhen.

translations.zh: 色彩素雅的杂釉彩和素三彩瓷清代景德镇御窑杂釉彩和素三彩瓷是在明代产品基础上发展而来，工艺上既有继承又有创新。
translations.en: Simple but Elegant:Miscellaneous-glazed and Plain Tri-colour Porcelains Miscellaneous-glazed and plain tri-colour porcelains of the imperial kiln at Jingdezhen retained the techniques adopted in the Ming Dynasty, but made further technical breakthroughs.

translations.zh: 其中康熙朝产量最大，质量最精，创新品种亦最多。
translations.en: Production reached its zenith in the Kangxi reign, in terms of quantity, quality,and variety.

translations.zh: 特别是康熙朝黑地素三彩和“虎皮三彩”瓷器，颇受欧洲人青眯，清末民国时期，欧洲人曾来华大肆搜求。
translations.en: Black-ground plain tri-colour and "tiger-skin" tri-colour porcelains, in particular, were popular with Europeans, who later came to search for these items in China in the late Qing and the republican period

translations.zh: 唐英唐英（16821756年）字俊公（亦作隽公），又字叔子，号蜗寄。
translations.en: Tang Ying Tang Ying (1682-1756), courtesy name Jungong and Shuzi and also called Woji, was born in Fengtian (present-day Shenyang, Liaoning Province).

translations.zh: 奉天（今辽宁沈阳）人。
translations.en: He was born to a Han Chinese family which was part of the Plain White Banner and worked as domestic servant at a Manchu mansion.

translations.zh: 出身满族家奴，隶汉军正白旗。
translations.en: In 1697 (the thirty-sixth year of the for over twenty years.

translations.zh: 康熙三十六年（1697年），年仅16岁的唐英开始供役于宫中养心殿，从圣祖康熙皇帝20余年。
translations.en: In 1723 (the first year of the Yongzheng reign), the 42-year-old former retainer was appointed the Head of the Imperial Household Department, in charge of servant and artisan personnel issues.

translations.zh: 雍正元年（1723年），42岁的唐英授内务府员外郎衔，负责每月稽查内务府造办处伙计房各作当差匠役。
translations.en: In the eighth lunar month of the sixth year of the Yongzheng reign (1728), Tang was dispatched to Jingdezhen to work as the assistant of Nian Xiyao (?-1739) who was then responsible for the administration of Jingdezhen's Imperial Kilns.

translations.zh: 因办事千练，雍正六年（1728年）八月，47岁的唐英被派驻景德镇，协助时任内务府总管、管理淮安关务、监管景德镇御窑厂务的年希尧（？～1739年）督理御窑厂务。
translations.en: From 1736 (the first year of the Qianlong reign), Tang worked as the superintendent of Huai'an Pass and subsequently Jiujiang Pass, and was concurrently responsible for the reign were called the Tang kilns.

translations.zh: 从乾隆元年（1736年）开始，唐英先后任准安关、九江关监督，并监理景德镇御窑厂务。
translations.en: The Imperial Kilns at Jingdezhen achieved great success in Tang's tenure, making him one of the most successful ceramics administrators in history

translations.zh: 熠熠生辉的矾红彩和金彩瓷矾红彩和金彩瓷均属于传统品种，其工艺最迟可上溯至宋、金时期瓷器装饰，元、明时期景德镇窑产品均有使用，至清代工艺更加精细，还经常被用在同一件器物上。
translations.en: Dazzling and Magnificent:Iron-red and Gold-painted Porcelains Iron-red and gold-painted porcelains date back at least as far as the Northern Song and Jin dynasties.

translations.zh: 矾红彩系用青矾（FeSO4·7HO）加热分解得到超细的氧化铁粉末与其他原料配合而成，烧成后纹饰呈鲜艳醒目的红色。
translations.en: These techniques were both applied on Jingdezhen wares produced in the Yuan and Ming dynasties, but the Qing products were more exquisite in their craftsmanship.

translations.zh: 金彩使用的是纯金研磨成的超细粉末，烧成后需用玛瑙棒打磨，方能熠熠生辉。
translations.en: Iron red and gold paints were usually applied together on the same piece.

translations.zh: 金属于贵金属，金彩瓷器制作成本较高，非御窑或具有一定实力的民窑，难以问津。
translations.en: However, only the imperial kiln or financially strong private kilns could afford to manufacture costly gold-painted porcelains.

translations.zh: 精描细画的斗彩瓷清代斗彩瓷在继承明代传统的基础上，有很多新的发展，主要表现在器物造型更加多样，装饰题材愈显丰富，绘画技法越发精细。
translations.en: Delicate and Detailed: Doucai Porcelains Clashing-colour (doucai) porcelains of the Qing Dynasty were more diverse in shape and decorative pattern and more delicate in painting, yet retained the traditional techniques of the Ming Dynasty.

translations.zh: 特别是雍正朝以后的斗彩瓷，在传统五彩瓷的基础上，融合粉彩和琅彩瓷装饰的工艺技法，不但色彩种类和纹饰层次比五彩瓷丰富，画面柔和，物象更显生动，给人以耳目一新之感。
translations.en: Doucai porcelains saw a new development in the Yongzheng reign by integrating famille-rose and painted-enamel techniques, thus taking on an entirely new look.

translations.zh: 乾隆及其以后各朝斗彩瓷器，流行描金装饰，画面显得富丽华贵，风格又为之一变。
translations.en: From the Qianlong reign onwards, doucai porcelain took on another new and more extravagant style with extensive use of gold paint

translations.zh: 画风苍劲的五彩瓷与明代相比，清代五彩瓷在瓷质、造型、色彩、纹饰等方面，都有较大发展。
translations.en: Vigorous and Expressive:Famille-verte Porcelains of the Kangxi Reign Famille-verte (wucai) porcelains of the Qing Dynasty featured better texture, shape, colour, painting,and pattern designs compared to those of the Ming Dynasty.

translations.zh: 尤其是康熙朝产品，在继承明代和顺治朝五彩瓷的基础上，不断创新，造型愈显多样，装饰更加丰富。
translations.en: Products of the Kangxi reign were more diverse in shape, decorative pattern, and colour, yet retained the traditions of the Ming Dynasty and the preceding Shunzhi reign.

translations.zh: 釉上蓝彩的发明和恰到好处地运用黑彩、金彩，使所绘物象愈发逼真。
translations.en: The painted designs looked more lifelike, with overglaze blue accented with black and golden paints.

translations.zh: 康熙朝以后，随着法琅彩和粉彩瓷的盛行，五彩瓷的烧造逐渐衰落。
translations.en: However, famille-verte porcelain making declined after the Kangxi reign, as painted-enamel and famille-rose porcelains gained popularity

translations.zh: 清雍正青花釉里红松竹梅图竹叶藏诗梅瓶雍正年间瓶身纹饰中以竹叶组成如下诗句：岁寒竹有擎天势，苍松耐岁寒。
translations.en: Meiping Vase with Underglaze Blue and Red Patterns of Pine, Bamboo and Plum Blossom and Poem with Characters Formed by Bamboo Leaf Strokes, Yongzheng Reign Period.

translations.zh: 梅花魁万卉，三友四时欢。
translations.en: Bamboos stand firm, as if holding up the sky.

translations.zh: 清代康熙、雍正、乾隆时期，景德镇御窑工匠熟练掌握了釉里红、青花釉里红瓷器的制作技术，不但产量提高，而且产品纹饰线条清晰、发色纯正，质量上乘。
translations.en: craftsmanship in these two types in the Kangxi (1662-1722), Yongzheng (1723-1735), and Qianlong (1736-1795) reigns.

translations.zh: 康熙朝还在青花釉里红瓷上增加釉下豆青色，创烧出“釉里三色”瓷，进一步增强了瓷器上物象的表现力。
translations.en: A pea-green colour was added to underglaze blue-and-red porcelain during the Kangxi reign.

source.title_zh: 明、清两代青花瓷的演进
source.title_en: Development of Blue-and-white Porcelains in the Ming and Qing Dynasties

translations.zh: 青花瓷是明、清两代景德镇窑的主流产品。
translations.en: Blue-and-white porcelain generally features underglaze decoration drawn with pigment made from natural cobalt, but its style varied from period to period.

source.title_zh: 明、清两代青花瓷的演进
source.title_en: Development of Blue-and-white Porcelains in the Ming and Qing Dynasties

translations.zh: 永乐、宣德青花之凝重，成化、弘治青花之素雅，嘉靖、隆庆、万历青花之艳丽，康熙青花之亮丽明翠。
translations.en: In the Ming Dynasty, blue-and-white wares were characterized by heavy colour in the Yongle and Xuande reigns, soft colour in the Chenghua and Hongzhi reigns, and vivid colour in the Jiajing and Wanli reigns.

source.title_zh: 明、清两代青花瓷的演进
source.title_en: Development of Blue-and-white Porcelains in the Ming and Qing Dynasties

translations.zh: 虽风格迥异，却有异曲同工之妙。
translations.en: In the Qing Dynasty, the blue-and-white porcelains of the Kangxi reign were known for their bright blue colour. These differences, however, do not eclipse their similarities.

source.title_zh: 慕古为新的雍正、乾隆、嘉庆朝青花瓷
source.title_en: New from the Old: Blue-and-white Porcelains of the Yongzheng, Qianlong, and Jiaqing Reigns

translations.zh: 雍正、乾隆、嘉庆三朝青花瓷，素以造型多样、做工精细、图案规整和善于仿古而著称于世。
translations.en: Blue-and-white porcelains of the Yongzheng, Qianlong, and Jiaqing reigns were renowned for their diverse shapes, exquisite craftsmanship, fine patterns, and designs recreating antiquity.

source.title_zh: 慕古为新的雍正、乾隆、嘉庆朝青花瓷
source.title_en: New from the Old: Blue-and-white Porcelains of the Yongzheng, Qianlong, and Jiaqing Reigns

translations.zh: 所仿明代永乐、宣德、成化、嘉靖、万历等朝青花瓷，颇具匠心，造型和纹饰逼肖原型，不署款者常使人难以辨别。
translations.en: They included superb imitations of Yongle, Xuande, Chenghua, Jiajing, and Wanli blue-and-white porcelains which are virtually indistinguishable from the genuine articles.

source.title_zh: 亮丽明翠的康熙朝青花瓷
source.title_en: Bright and Glossy: Blue-and-white Porcelains of the Kangxi Reign

translations.zh: 康熙朝制瓷工匠将明代崇祯至清代顺治青花瓷运用的“分水”（景德镇称“混水”）画法推向极致，可以得心应手地用来装饰各种器物，使青花纹饰有规律地呈现阴阳向背、浓淡深浅的层次变化，具有中国画“墨分五色”的效果，所绘物象呈现很强的立体感。
translations.en: The fen shui (also known as hun shui at Jingdezhen) painting method (creating different hues of blue with paints of different concentration of cobalt pigment) emerged in the late Ming Dynasty and was applied to blue-and-white porcelains from the Chongzhen reign in the Ming to the Shunzhi reign in the Qing.

source.title_zh: 亮丽明翠的康熙朝青花瓷
source.title_en: Bright and Glossy: Blue-and-white Porcelains of the Kangxi Reign

translations.zh: 康熙朝青花瓷最显著的特点是造型挺拔、胎体坚硬、釉面莹亮，俗称“紧皮亮釉”，青花发色亮丽明翠，被推为清代青花瓷器之冠。
translations.en: The technique was further enhanced in the Kangxi reign, producing designs resembling traditional Chinese ink paintings on paper.

translations.zh: 清康熙青花十二月花卉图题诗句杯杯上所题诗句分别为：
translations.en: Blue-and-white Cups with Flowers of the Months and Poetry, Kangxi Reign Flower poems by month.

translations.zh: 一月迎春花：金英翠萼带春寒，黄色花中有几般。
translations.en: Winter jasmine for January

translations.zh: 二月杏花：清香和宿雨，佳色出晴烟。
translations.en: Apricot blossom for February

translations.zh: 三月桃花：风花新社燕，时节旧春农。
translations.en: Peach blossom for March

translations.zh: 四月牡丹花：晓艳远分金掌露，暮香深惹玉堂风。
translations.en: Peony for April

translations.zh: 五月石榴花：露色珠帘映，香风粉壁遮。
translations.en: Pomegranate flower for May

translations.zh: 六月莲花：根是泥中玉，心承露下珠。
translations.en: Lotus for June

translations.zh: 七月兰花：广殿轻香发，高台远吹吟。
translations.en: Orchid for July

translations.zh: 八月桂花：枝生无限月，花满自然秋。
translations.en: Osmanthus for August

translations.zh: 九月菊花：千载白衣酒，一生青女香。
translations.en: Chrysanthemum for September

translations.zh: 十月月季花：不随千种尽，独放一年红。
translations.en: Chinese rose for October

translations.zh: 十一月梅花：素艳雪凝树，清香风满枝。
translations.en: Plum blossom for November

translations.zh: 十二月水仙花：春风弄玉来清昼，夜月凌波上大堤。
translations.en: Daffodil for December

source.title_zh: 登峰造极清代康熙、雍正、乾隆朝景德镇窑及清代地方窑陶瓷（公元1662~1795年）
source.title_en: The pinnacle Ceramics in the Kangxi, Yongzheng, and Qianlong Reigns

translations.zh: 随着康熙、雍正、乾隆三朝盛世的到来，景德镇陶瓷烧造也达到鼎盛。
translations.en: Porcelain production at Jingdezhen reached its heyday during the Kangxi, Yongzheng, and Qianlong reigns.

source.title_zh: 登峰造极清代康熙、雍正、乾隆朝景德镇窑及清代地方窑陶瓷（公元1662~1795年）
source.title_en: The pinnacle Ceramics in the Kangxi, Yongzheng, and Qianlong Reigns

translations.zh: 由于这三朝皇帝均对瓷器烧造表现出浓厚兴趣，加之督陶官减应选（生卒不详）、郎廷极（1663～1715年）、年希尧（？～1739年）、唐英（1682～1756年）等苦心竭力经营，遂使景德镇御窑在仿古的基础上，又创烧出大量新品种。
translations.en: The management of the imperial kiln at Jingdezhen was overseen by dedicated officials, such as Zang Yingxuan (b. and d. unknown), Lang Tingji (1663-1715), Nian Xiyao (?-1739), and Tang Ying (1682-1756).

source.title_zh: 登峰造极清代康熙、雍正、乾隆朝景德镇窑及清代地方窑陶瓷（公元1662~1795年）
source.title_en: The pinnacle Ceramics in the Kangxi, Yongzheng, and Qianlong Reigns

translations.zh: 雍正十三年（1735年）唐英《陶成纪事》罗列当时仿古和创新的瓷器多达57个品种。
translations.en: According to Taocheng Jishi (Record of Ceramic Making), authored by Tang Ying in the thirteenth year of the Yongzheng reign (1735), there were as many as 57 types of porcelain products.

source.title_zh: 登峰造极清代康熙、雍正、乾隆朝景德镇窑及清代地方窑陶瓷（公元1662~1795年）
source.title_en: The pinnacle Ceramics in the Kangxi, Yongzheng, and Qianlong Reigns

translations.zh: 德化窑、石湾窑和宜兴窑等地方窑场也沿袭明代风格，继续烧造传统品种的陶瓷。
translations.en: The Dehua, Shiwan, and Yixing kilns also continued to produce traditional products.

translations.zh: “转型期”五彩瓷可分为两大类，即青花五彩和纯釉上五彩。
translations.en: Famille-verte Porcelain in the Transitional Period can be divided into two categories: those with underglaze blue paints and those with only the latter.

translations.zh: 天启、崇祯朝五彩瓷造型见有花觚、盖罐、碗、盘、碟等，其中一部分是专门为适应日本市场需求而烧造。
translations.en: Porcelains from the Tianqi and Chongzhen reigns at the end of the Ming included gu goblets, lidded jars, bowls, plates, and saucers, some of which were tailor-made for the Japanese market.

translations.zh: 顺治至康熙早期五彩瓷装饰题材流行山水、花鸟和人物故事图，如朵兰怪石、锦鸡牡丹、独占鳌头以及文王访贤、柳毅传书、西厢记故事等。
translations.en: In the early Qing, from the Shunzhi reign to the early Kangxi reign, famille-verte porcelains were usually painted with landscapes, flowers, birds, human figures, and historical stories.

translations.zh: 画面布局疏朗，物象生动传神，部分器物上题写有隶书体或楷书体诗句或唱曲。
translations.en: Some featured lines of poems or songs in official or regular script, and in some the article's rim was coated with brown glaze.

translations.zh: “转型期”青花瓷画意清新的据文献记载，由于在青料选和提炼方面有重大技术改进，即由以往的水洗法改为烧法，使得这一时期的典型青花瓷纹中有一幅神饰发色亮丽，给人以清新雅致之美感。
translations.en: According to historical records, blue-and-white porcelain was painted with indigenous cobalt pigments in the transitional period.

translations.zh: 在器物造型方面，除了常见的盘、碗外，较为特殊的器形是筒形瓶花云龙纹筒（亦称“象腿瓶”）、莲子形罐、笔筒和五供等。
translations.en: The cobalt pigment from Zhejiang, called "zheliao", was thought to be the finest.

translations.zh: 在装饰图案方面，较少使用龙、凤、缠枝花、折枝花、八云间，身被风格，龙头吉祥等御窑瓷器上常见的规矩纹饰，而代之以山水、花鸟、戏曲故事和神话传说等。
translations.en: Cobalt selecting and refining techniques were significantly enhanced, with cobalt pigment made by calcining, instead of washing.

translations.zh: 特别是在体现唐人诗意表现出飞龙画谱可能内容的青花瓷上，首次出现诗、书、画、印相结合的文人画风格，使人耳目一新。
translations.en: This made patterns on the blue-and-white porcelains from this period bright in colour, refreshing and elegant.

source.title_zh: 清新雅致明末清初景德镇窑瓷器（约公元1607～1681年）
source.title_en: Refined and Elegant Jingdezhen Porcelains of the Late Ming and Early Qing Dynasties (c.1607-1681)

translations.zh: 明末清初，随着农民起义愈演愈烈，明王朝最终走向灭亡，清朝入主中原坐稳江山，中国社会发生剧烈变革。
translations.en: Chinese society witnessed dramatic changes during the late Ming and early Qing dynasties.

source.title_zh: 清新雅致明末清初景德镇窑瓷器（约公元1607～1681年）
source.title_en: Refined and Elegant Jingdezhen Porcelains of the Late Ming and Early Qing Dynasties (c.1607-1681)

translations.zh: 从明代万历三十五年（1607年）到清代康熙二十年（1681年）的70多年时间里，作为全国制瓷中心的景德镇，其瓷器制造业也经历了一次重大转变。
translations.en: As the centre of porcelain production, Jingdezhen also underwent a significant transformation over the seven decades from 1607 (the thirty-fifth year of the Wanli reign in the Ming) to 1681 (the twentieth year of the Kangxi reign in the Qing).

source.title_zh: 清新雅致明末清初景德镇窑瓷器（约公元1607～1681年）
source.title_en: Refined and Elegant Jingdezhen Porcelains of the Late Ming and Early Qing Dynasties (c.1607-1681)

translations.zh: 人们习惯于将景德镇制瓷业在17世纪发生变化的这一时期称作“转变期”或“转型期”。
translations.en: This period is historically known as the "transitional period" in Jingdezhen's history.

translations.zh: 因地制宜的其他地方窑陶瓷明代江苏宜兴窑和广东佛山石湾窑均烧造具有地方特色的陶瓷，二者并驾称雄。
translations.en: Diverse Ceramics from Other Kilns In the Ming Dynasty,the Yixing kilns in Jiangsu and Shiwan kilns in Guangdong were both known for their Jun ware imitations.

translations.zh: 所烧造仿钧釉陶器，宜兴产者，俗称“宜钧”；石湾产者，俗称“广钧”或“泥钧”。
translations.en: Products of the former were known as"Yi Jun"and those of the latter"Guang Jun"or"Ni Jun".

translations.zh: 明代中期以后，随着“冲泡”饮茶方式的普及，宜兴窑紫砂茶具逐渐流行。
translations.en: Yixing-made purple-clay (zisha) tea wares gained popularity from the mid-Ming as the habit of steeping tea leaves spread.

translations.zh: 明代龙泉窑仍烧造传统青瓷，明初曾受命烧造宫廷用瓷，产量很大，产品造型、纹饰与景德镇御窑产品风格一致。
translations.en: The Longquan kilns continued to produce traditional celadon in the Ming Dynasty.

translations.zh: 河北彭城窑仍在烧造以白地黑花瓷为代表的传统瓷器品种，并曾受命为宫廷烧造酒坛。
translations.en: In the early Ming, the Longquan kilns were commanded to manufacture porcelains exclusively for imperial use, producing items identical to those of Jingdezhen in terms of shape and pattern.

translations.zh: 五颜六色的颜色釉瓷颜色釉瓷是明代景德镇御窑烧造的主要品种之一，无论高温、中温还是低温釉瓷，制作均精益求精，呈色纯正美观，品种多达20余种。
translations.en: Resplendent and Colourful: Colour-glazed Porcelains Colour-glazed porcelain was a major product of the Jingdezhen imperial kilns in the Ming Dynasty.

translations.zh: 其中以永乐，宣德朝鲜红、祭蓝、甜白釉瓷，弘治朝浇黄釉瓷，正德朝孔雀绿釉瓷，嘉靖朝瓜皮绿釉瓷，万历朝淡茄皮紫釉瓷等最受人称道。
translations.en: Whether baked at a high, medium, or low temperature, a colour-glazed porcelain produced at Jingdezhen was always of superb craftsmanship and pure in colour.

translations.zh: 特别是永乐、宣德朝的鲜红、祭蓝、甜白釉瓷，被后人誉为当时颜色釉瓷中的“三大名品”，对后来颜色釉瓷的发展产生深远影响。
translations.en: Of over twenty types, the most remarkable were: the sacrificial red, sacrificial blue, and sweet-white porcelains of the Yongle and Xuande reigns; the yellow-glazed porcelain of the Hongzhi reign; the turquoise-glazed porcelain of the Zhengde reign; the watermelon green-glazed porcelain of the Jiajing reign; and the light aubergine-glazed porcelain of the Wanli reign

source.title_zh: 如脂似玉的德化窑白瓷
source.title_en: Cream and Jade: White Porcelain of the Dehua Kilns

translations.zh: 福建德化地区瓷器烧造历史悠久，最迟可上溯至商周时期的原始瓷，唐、宋、元时期生产快速发展，盛烧于明、清两代。
translations.en: The Dehua kilns in Fujian may date back to the proto-porcelain production of the Shang and Zhou dynasties.

source.title_zh: 如脂似玉的德化窑白瓷
source.title_en: Cream and Jade: White Porcelain of the Dehua Kilns

translations.zh: 德化窑素以烧造独具特色的白瓷而名扬天下，其产品胎质洁白细腻，釉质乳白似脂，胎釉浑然一体，透光度极佳，深受人们喜爱，行销国内，远销海外。
translations.en: Manufacture developed rapidly through the Tang, Song, and Yuan dynasties, and the kilns reached their pinnacle during the Ming and Qing.

source.title_zh: 如脂似玉的德化窑白瓷
source.title_en: Cream and Jade: White Porcelain of the Dehua Kilns

translations.zh: 国人誉之“猪油白”“象牙白”，法国人则赞其“鹅绒白”“中国白”。
translations.en: They were famous for their distinctive white porcelain wares, featuring a fine-textured white body, cream-like white glaze, and extraordinary translucency.

source.title_zh: 如脂似玉的德化窑白瓷
source.title_en: Cream and Jade: White Porcelain of the Dehua Kilns

translations.zh: 产品见有碗、杯、盒等日用器皿，还有仿青铜器造型的炉、、鼎、尊等，尤以雕塑最为著名。
translations.en: Dehua wares were popular in both domestic and overseas markets.

source.title_zh: 如脂似玉的德化窑白瓷
source.title_en: Cream and Jade: White Porcelain of the Dehua Kilns

translations.zh: 作品多为观音、达摩等宗教人物，有些塑像的背部戳印有工匠姓名印记，如“何朝宗”“林朝景”“陈伟”“张寿山”等。
translations.en: Dehua whiteware was known to the Chinese as "lard white" and "ivory white" and to the French as "goose-down white" and "Chinese white".

translations.zh: 巧夺天工的像生瓷和镂雕瓷乾隆朝景德镇御窑制瓷技术达到历史上的顶峰，娴熟的工艺，造就了千姿百态的器形和严谨繁缛的装饰。
translations.en: Incredible Craftsmanship: Porcelain Objects with Trompe-L'oeil Effects and Pierced Porcelain Porcelain-making techniques reached their pinnacle in Jingdezhen imperial kiln during the Qianlong reign, with superb craftsmanship shown in all kinds of designs and elaborate decorations.

translations.zh: 尤其是各种模仿动物、植物以及漆器、木器、铜器、石器等工艺品的瓷器，均惟妙惟肖，酷似实物，体现出高超的制瓷水平。
translations.en: Porcelain objects with Trompe-L'oeil effects vividly depicted animals and plants, and articles imitating lacquerware, wood, bronzes, and stoneware, which could hardly be distinguished from the genuine ones.

translations.zh: 各种镂空转心瓶、转颈瓶、套瓶等，构思巧妙，颇具匠心，透过外瓶镂空，可以看到内瓶上的装饰图案，堪称鬼斧神工。
translations.en: Various pierced revolving vases, which revolved in the interior or at the neck, showed great ingenuity

translations.zh: 色彩缤纷的杂釉彩、素三彩和法花瓷明代彩瓷除斗彩、五彩瓷以外，尚有金彩、矾红彩、绿彩、酱彩、黄地绿彩、黄地紫彩、黄地红彩瓷但不含或基本不含红彩的瓷器，俗称“素三彩瓷”。
translations.en: Miscellaneous-glazed, Plain Tri-colour, and Fahua Porcelains Apart from doucai and wucai, the Ming Dynasty featured many other colour-glazed porcelains, such as gold-painted, iron red-painted, green-painted, dark red-brown-painted, green-painted yellow-ground, purple-painted yellow-ground, and red-painted yellow-ground porcelains.

translations.zh: 杂釉彩和素三彩均属于低温釉彩。
translations.en: These are collectively known as miscellaneous-glazed porcelains.

translations.zh: 另外，明代景德镇窑还烧造一种瓷胎花器，系模仿山西陶胎花器而创烧的新品种。
translations.en: A new type of glazed porcelain emerged in the Chenghua reign, applying three or more colours on the same porcelain piece, with little or no red tint.

translations.zh: 五彩瓷和斗彩瓷的区别五彩瓷按工艺技法可分为两类：一类是纯釉上五彩瓷，另一类是釉下青花和釉上诸彩相结合的青花五彩瓷。
translations.en: Famille-verte (wucai) and Clashing-colour (doucai)Porcelains Famille-verte (wucai) porcelains can be divided into two categories: overglaze famille-verte and underglaze blue with overglaze famille-verte.

translations.zh: 斗彩瓷也是釉下青花与釉上诸彩相结合的一种彩瓷，从广义上说，亦属于青花五彩范畴，但二者又有区别。
translations.en: For clashing-colour (doucai) porcelains, a design is outlined with cobalt pigment on an unfired body, while blue-and-white wucai porcelain, in contrast, involves spreading cobalt pigment on the unfired body to form part of the design.

translations.zh: 画风朴拙的嘉靖、万历朝五彩瓷五彩是瓷器彩绘技法之一，可分为青花五彩和纯釉上五彩两大类。
translations.en: Bold SimplicityDesigns:Famille-verte Porcelains of the Jiajing and Wanli Reigns Famille-verte (wucai) is a color painting technique divided into two sub-categories: those with both underglaze blue and overglaze color paints and those with only the latter.

translations.zh: 所用釉上彩料多透明，常见有红、草绿、孔雀绿、黄、紫、黑彩等，彩烧温度在800～1000℃左右。
translations.en: These items were baked at a temperature between 800°C and 1000°C, and commonly seen overglaze pigments include red, grass green, turquoise, yellow, purple, and black.

translations.zh: 因采用单线平涂技法施彩，故而图案无深浅浓淡层次变化。
translations.en: A famille-verte design lacks a sense of depth due to the flat spreading of paints.

translations.zh: 小巧玲珑的成化朝斗彩瓷斗彩属于瓷器装饰技法之一。
translations.en: Elegant Workmanship:Doucai Porcelains of the Chenghua Reign Clashing-colour (doucai) is a porcelain decorating technique.

translations.zh: 系指先在成型后的胎体上以青料勾勒图案轮廓（有的还在此基础上描绘出图案局部），经高温烧成后，再在釉上按烧成温度高低依次施以各种釉上彩，然后入炉经一次或多次（按温度由高到低）低温焙烧而成。
translations.en: A design is first produced in outline (or in some cases in detail) with cobalt pigment on the porcelain body, before being glazed and baked at a high temperature.

translations.zh: 因纹饰系由釉下青花与釉上诸彩拼而成，各种色彩争奇斗艳，故称“斗彩”。
translations.en: Paints are then applied on the glazed surface according to their firing temperatures before the painted piece is baked at least once more at a low temperature.

translations.zh: 斗彩技法萌发于明代宣德朝，发展于正统至天顺朝，成熟于成化朝，正德、嘉靖、隆庆、万历等朝均有烧造，其中以成化朝产品最负盛名。
translations.en: The technique is named for the fact that the underglaze cobalt pigment and overglaze colour paints seem to compete with each other.

translations.zh: 其造型均为小巧的瓶、罐、盒、盘、碗、杯、碟等，釉质温润如玉，色彩搭配协调，绘画工艺精湛，颇显隽秀典雅，给人以委婉含蓄之美感。
translations.en: Created in the Xuande reign, the technique developed further in the Zhengtong to Tianshun reigns and came to maturity in the Chenghua reign.

translations.zh: 成化斗彩瓷自明代晚期以来即博得很高声誉，仿品不断出现，堪称中国陶瓷发展史上的经典之作。
translations.en: Doucai porcelains were produced throughout the Zhengde, Jiajing, Longqing, and Wanli reigns, although those of the Chenghua reign became the most renowned.

translations.zh: 变化多端的成化至万历朝青花和釉里红瓷
translations.en: Kaleidoscope: Blue-and-white and Underglaze Red Porcelains from the Chenghua to the Wanli Reigns

translations.zh: 明代成化、弘治、正德、嘉靖、隆庆、万历各朝，青花瓷仍是景德镇窑的主流产品。
translations.en: Throughout the Chenghua (1465-1487), Hongzhi (1488-1505), Zhengde (1506-1521), Jiajing (1522-1566), Longqing (1567-1572), and Wanli (1573-1620) reigns, blue-and-white porcelains remained the mainstay of production at Jingdezhen.

translations.zh: 但由于各朝皇帝审美趣味和所用青花料来源不同，使得这几朝御窑青花瓷呈现不同的风貌。
translations.en: However, products from different reigns varied greatly, as they were made to satisfy emperors' different tastes and painted with different cobalt pigments.

translations.zh: 如典型成化朝御窑青花瓷，造型隽秀、纹饰疏朗，使用国产“平等青”料描绘纹饰，色调清新淡雅。
translations.en: For instance, the blue-and-white porcelains from the Chenghua reign were delicately shaped and sparsely painted, with the indigenous pingdeng cobalt pigment producing a refreshing and elegant colour.

translations.zh: 这几朝御窑青花瓷虽各具特色，但御窑产品用料考究、造型规范、画有所宗、笔法娴熟等，是其共同风格。
translations.en: Despite stylistic differences, blue-and-white porcelains from the Imperial Kilns of these reigns were all made of choice materials with superb craftsmanship.

translations.zh: 由于釉里红瓷烧造难度极大，因此，宣德朝以后即少有烧造，偶有所见，纹饰发色大都不太纯正。
translations.en: Due to technical difficulties, few underglaze red porcelains were made after the Xuande reign, and of those that were, the red colour was not pure.

translations.zh: 端庄文雅的永乐、宣德朝青花和釉里红瓷永乐、宣德朝景德镇御窑曾大量烧造青花瓷，造型端庄、纹饰优美、做工精湛，被后人评为明代青花瓷之冠。
translations.en: Blue-and-white porcelains produced by the Jingdezhen imperial kiln during the Yongle (1403-1424) and Xuande (1426-1435) reigns have been admired as the best of their kind in the Ming.

translations.zh: 其绘画所使用的青料既有国产料，亦有进口料，但以使用进口“苏麻离青”料描绘的产品最具时代特征。
translations.en: Both indigenous and imported pigments were used, with the best known being wares painted with the imported cobalt pigment.

translations.zh: 永乐朝御窑青花瓷目前仅见压手杯内底署青花篆体“永乐年制”四字双行款，宣德朝御窑青花瓷则基本均署年款，但落款位置不固定，或署于内、外底部，或署于器身其他部位，故素有。
translations.en: seal script, reading "Made in the Yongle Reign" (four characters in two lines of two). During the Xuande reign, by contrast, blue inscriptions of date could be found at any place on the body.

translations.zh: 由于釉里红瓷烧造难度极大，因此永乐、宣德朝釉里红和青花釉里红瓷传世很少。
translations.en: technically hard to make.

translations.zh: 宣德朝景德镇御窑创烧了一种在器身局部剔填高温铜红釉的瓷器，亦称“釉里红”瓷，纹饰主要是三鱼、三果纹，烧成难度亦极大。
translations.en: A kind of underglaze red design was created in the Jingdezhen imperial kiln during the Xuande reign. The design was first cut out in the body, and high-temperature flambé glaze was poured into the cutout to create the design. Three-fish and three-fruit designs were the most frequently seen.

translations.zh: 古朴敦厚的洪武朝青花和釉里红瓷由于洪武朝瓷器较多继承元代风格，因此曾长期被视为元代产品，后来随着研究的不断深入，才逐渐被辨认出来。
translations.en: Robust but Elegant: Blue-and-white and Underglaze Red Porcelains of the Hongwu Reign

translations.zh: 洪武朝青花和釉里红瓷以大件器物居多，造型敦厚，装饰繁缛，画风古朴洒脱，纹饰呈色多较浅淡或灰暗，工艺较为粗糙，时代特征鲜明。
translations.en: Broadly following the styles of the preceding Yuan Dynasty, the blue-and-white and underglaze red porcelains of the Hongwu reign (1368-1398) at the start.

translations.zh: 装饰题材以各种花卉纹为主，少见云龙纹。
translations.en: The style is likewise distinctive

source.title_zh: 承上启下的正统、景泰、天顺朝青花瓷
source.title_en: Between Old and New: Blue-and-white Porcelains of the Zhengtong, Jingtai, and Tianshun Reigns

translations.zh: 明代正统、景泰，天顺三朝历时29年，天灾人祸不断，加之迄今为止，尚未发现署这三朝正规年款的御窑瓷器，因此，这三朝曾被称作中国明代陶瓷发展史上的“空白点”“空白期”或“黑暗期”。
translations.en: The Zhengtong (1436-1449), Jingtai (1450-1456), and Tianshun (1457-1464) reigns were plagued by incessant natural calamities and social turbulence, and to date no imperial porcelains have been found with inscriptions dating them to these reigns.

source.title_zh: 承上启下的正统、景泰、天顺朝青花瓷
source.title_en: Between Old and New: Blue-and-white Porcelains of the Zhengtong, Jingtai, and Tianshun Reigns

translations.zh: 从明代文献记载看，这三朝无论御窑还是民窑，均未停止烧造。
translations.en: Thus, the period is known as a "blank" or"dark" period in the history of Ming ceramics.

source.title_zh: 承上启下的正统、景泰、天顺朝青花瓷
source.title_en: Between Old and New: Blue-and-white Porcelains of the Zhengtong, Jingtai, and Tianshun Reigns

translations.zh: 随着考古发掘所获得实物资料的不断增多和研究的逐步深入，人们对这三朝瓷器的认识愈来愈清晰。
translations.en: Nonetheless, according to Ming documents, neither imperial nor private kilns stopped production in this period.

source.title_zh: 承上启下的正统、景泰、天顺朝青花瓷
source.title_en: Between Old and New: Blue-and-white Porcelains of the Zhengtong, Jingtai, and Tianshun Reigns

translations.zh: 从传世和出土实物资料看，这三朝烧造的瓷器品种主要有青花、青花加矾红彩、矾红彩、绿彩、五彩、斗彩、白釉、青釉等，产量非常可观，质量也不逊于明代其他各朝。
translations.en: Archaeological discoveries and studies have given us an ever clearer picture of porcelain-making, with both imperial and private kilns producing considerable quantities.

source.title_zh: 承上启下的正统、景泰、天顺朝青花瓷
source.title_en: Between Old and New: Blue-and-white Porcelains of the Zhengtong, Jingtai, and Tianshun Reigns

translations.zh: 而且这三朝御窑瓷器在造型、纹饰、制作工艺等方面均有特点，如大量烧造的青花大缸、大花盆、大绣墩等，其形体之大，在明代可谓绝无仅有；成批出现的单独以海水纹作主题纹饰的青花瓷；青花瓷上所绘从海水怪石中长出的松竹梅“岁寒三友”等。
translations.en: The products were primarily blue-and-white, iron red-painted blue-and-white, iron red-painted, green-painted, famille-verte (wucai), clashing-colour (doucai), white-glazed, and green-glazed porcelains, and were not inferior to porcelains from other reigns of the dynasty.

translations.zh: 而将高岭土加入瓷胎，则使景德镇的瓷胎由单一的瓷石改为瓷石加高岭土的“二元配方”，成为景德镇瓷业发展的一个新里程碑。
translations.en: In the Yuan Dynasty, the discovery and use of kaolin clay-a milestone in the development of ceramics at Jingdezhen-added a second component to the original single-ingredient porcelain clay.

translations.zh: 元代景德镇窑成功烧造出青花、釉里红、卵白釉、蓝釉瓷等新品种，显示出非凡的创造力，促使全国陶瓷生产中心逐渐向景德镇转移。
translations.en: Potters at Jingdezhen demonstrated their extraordinary creativity with new types, such as blue-and-white, underglaze red, egg-white-glazed and blue-glazed porcelain, shifting the centre of manufacture towards Jingdezhen.

translations.zh: 浑厚朴实的元代其他窑陶瓷元代除景德镇窑以外，其他较著名的瓷窑有龙泉窑、钧窑、磁州窑、德化窑、霍县窑等。
translations.en: Unaffected Simplicity: Porcelain from Other Yuan Kilns Other famous Yuan kilns included those at Longquan, Jun, Cizhou, Dehua, and Huoxian.

translations.zh: 龙泉窑和钧窑仍继续烧造传统品种，质量虽不及宋代产品精致，但生产规模却进一步扩大，产品行销国内外。
translations.en: The Longquan and Jun kilns continued to manufacture traditional wares, while Cizhou wares were primarily porcelains with black design on a white ground.

translations.zh: 磁州窑仍在烧造人们喜闻乐见的以白地黑花瓷为代表的产品，以满足国内市场需求。
translations.en: The white porcelains of the Dehua kilns were largely exported.

translations.zh: 元代德化窑主要为适应外销而烧造青白瓷和白瓷，为明代“鹅绒白”瓷器的出现奠定了基础。
translations.en: The Huoxian kilns in Shanxi produced white porcelain imitating Ding wares albeit with distinctive local elements.

translations.zh: 山西霍县窑仿定窑产品，造型精巧，胎质细腻，颇具地方风格。
translations.en: Wares coated with liuli glaze and mounting-pattern fahua glaze were also distinctive products of Shanxi

source.title_zh: 繁荣昌盛明代景德镇窑和地方窑陶瓷（公元1368~1644年）
source.title_en: Days of Blossoms Porcelain from Jingdezhen and Other Kilns in the Ming Dynasty

translations.zh: 明代景德镇窑分为御窑和民窑两种。
translations.en: In Ming Dynasty porcelain production at Jingdezhen can be divided into the products of imperial and private kilns.

source.title_zh: 繁荣昌盛明代景德镇窑和地方窑陶瓷（公元1368~1644年）
source.title_en: Days of Blossoms Porcelain from Jingdezhen and Other Kilns in the Ming Dynasty

translations.zh: 洪武二年（1369年）朝廷在景德镇设“陶厂”，建文四年（1402年）更名为“御器厂”，专门烧造宫廷用瓷。
translations.en: In 1369 (the second year of the Hongwu reign), the Ming court set up Jingdezhen imperial kiln to manufacture porcelains exclusively for imperial use.

source.title_zh: 繁荣昌盛明代景德镇窑和地方窑陶瓷（公元1368~1644年）
source.title_en: Days of Blossoms Porcelain from Jingdezhen and Other Kilns in the Ming Dynasty

translations.zh: 此后，历朝沿袭这种制度，源源不断地为宫廷烧造了大量至精至美、品种丰富的瓷器，直至万历三十五年（1607年）停烧。
translations.en: This system remained in operation until 1607 (the thirty-fifth year of the Wanli reign).

source.title_zh: 繁荣昌盛明代景德镇窑和地方窑陶瓷（公元1368~1644年）
source.title_en: Days of Blossoms Porcelain from Jingdezhen and Other Kilns in the Ming Dynasty

translations.zh: 这些瓷器主要被用作日常饮食、陈设、祭祀、赏赐等。
translations.en: Large numbers of exquisite ceramics in various designs were produced for the court, serving as everyday utensils, ornaments, sacrificial vessels, and imperial gifts.

source.title_zh: 繁荣昌盛明代景德镇窑和地方窑陶瓷（公元1368~1644年）
source.title_en: Days of Blossoms Porcelain from Jingdezhen and Other Kilns in the Ming Dynasty

translations.zh: 御窑的发展带动了民窑的逐渐兴盛，至明代晚期，景德镇从事瓷器生产的工匠已达十余万人，遂成为全国的制瓷中心、世界的瓷都。
translations.en: Private kilns also thrived.

source.title_zh: 繁荣昌盛明代景德镇窑和地方窑陶瓷（公元1368~1644年）
source.title_en: Days of Blossoms Porcelain from Jingdezhen and Other Kilns in the Ming Dynasty

translations.zh: 永乐、宣德、成化三朝的青花瓷，永乐、宣德朝的鲜红釉、祭蓝釉、甜白釉瓷，成化朝的斗彩瓷，弘治朝的浇黄釉瓷，嘉靖朝的瓜皮绿釉瓷，万历朝的淡茄皮紫釉瓷，嘉靖、隆庆、万历朝的五彩瓷等，均为明代瓷器中的著名品种，堪称中国乃至世界陶瓷史上永恒的经典之作，备受后人推崇。
translations.en: In the late Ming Dynasty, more than one hundred thousand people in Jingdezhen were engaged in porcelain-making, making Jingdezhen the "Porcelain Capital".

source.title_zh: 繁荣昌盛明代景德镇窑和地方窑陶瓷（公元1368~1644年）
source.title_en: Days of Blossoms Porcelain from Jingdezhen and Other Kilns in the Ming Dynasty

translations.zh: 明代早期，朝廷还在具有雄厚窑业基础的今浙江省龙泉市设置专门烧造宫廷用瓷的窑场，所产青瓷的造型和纹饰均与当时景德镇御窑瓷器如出一辙。
translations.en: Another official kiln site was established in the early Ming at Longquan County, Zhejiang Province.

source.title_zh: 繁荣昌盛明代景德镇窑和地方窑陶瓷（公元1368~1644年）
source.title_en: Days of Blossoms Porcelain from Jingdezhen and Other Kilns in the Ming Dynasty

translations.zh: 明代晚期，福建德化窑白瓷别具一格，以何朝宗为代表的瓷雕大师所创作的白瓷雕像最负盛名。
translations.en: In the late Ming, white wares from the Dehua kilns won fame, with white porcelain sculptures made by He Chaozong the most prestigious among them.

source.title_zh: 繁荣昌盛明代景德镇窑和地方窑陶瓷（公元1368~1644年）
source.title_en: Days of Blossoms Porcelain from Jingdezhen and Other Kilns in the Ming Dynasty

translations.zh: 明代江苏宜兴窑和广东石湾窑烧造的仿钧釉陶器，分别俗称“宜钧”“广钧”，名噪一时。
translations.en: Meanwhile, the Yixing kilns in Jiangsu and Shiwan kilns in Guangdong imitated the glazed pottery of the Jun kilns and gained popularity.

source.title_zh: 繁荣昌盛明代景德镇窑和地方窑陶瓷（公元1368~1644年）
source.title_en: Days of Blossoms Porcelain from Jingdezhen and Other Kilns in the Ming Dynasty

translations.zh: 明代中晚期，随着冲泡饮茶习俗的流行，宜兴窑烧造的适合泡茶的紫砂茶具登上历史舞台，出现了许多能工巧匠，其中以时大彬最为著名。
translations.en: Yixing-made purple-clay pottery (zisha) tea wares grew popular in the middle and late Ming Dynasty.

translations.zh: 二元配方系指景德镇瓷业生产中将瓷石和高岭土两种矿物按适当比例配合而成的制胎原料。
translations.en: Two-ingredient formula The formula used in production at Jingdezhen mixed a proportion of china stone with kaolin to make the material for porcelain.

translations.zh: 科学检测的结果表明，元代以前景德镇瓷器采用瓷石一种原料制胎，从元代开始，因浅层瓷石和优质瓷石匮乏，采用深层瓷石或劣质瓷石单独制胎，易造成瓷器烧成后产生严重变形，于是出现了在瓷石中加入适量高岭土的所谓“二元配方”。
translations.en: Scientific testing has revealed that china stone alone was used for making porcelain bodies before the Yuan Dynasty.

translations.zh: 这是中国陶瓷发展史上的一次革命性变化。
translations.en: The two-ingredient formula was developed in the Yuan Dynasty, when a shortage of both high-quality china stone and china stone near the surface of the ground necessitated the use of material that was deep under the surface or lower in quality, which, when used alone, resulted in seriously flawed products.

translations.zh: 由于高岭土中氧化铝（Al₂O₃）的含量约为35%，将其引入瓷胎后，提高了瓷胎中氧化铝的含量，使制品的烧成温度范围拓宽，变形减少，成品率得以提高，并能烧造出颇有气势的大件器物。
translations.en: The introduction of kaolin, a revolutionary event in the history of Chinese ceramics, boosted the rate of successful products and made it possible to produce large items

source.title_zh: 瓷都奠基元代陶瓷（公元1271~1368年）
source.title_en: The Rise of China's Porcelain of the Yuan Dynasty

translations.zh: 1279年，元王朝统一中国。
translations.en: In 1279, the Yuan Dynasty unified China, and Jingdezhen in northeast Jiangxi rose as a new force in porcelain-making.

source.title_zh: 瓷都奠基元代陶瓷（公元1271~1368年）
source.title_en: The Rise of China's Porcelain of the Yuan Dynasty

translations.zh: 位于今江西省东北部的景德镇，得天时、地利、人和之便，异军突起，既继承又创新，烧造出青花、釉里红、卵白釉、蓝釉瓷等新品种，遂使景德镇一举成为全国最重要的瓷器产地之一，为明、清两代进而成为全国的制瓷中心奠定了基础。
translations.en: New types were made, including blue-and-white, underglaze red, egg-white glazed, and blue-glazed porcelain.

source.title_zh: 瓷都奠基元代陶瓷（公元1271~1368年）
source.title_en: The Rise of China's Porcelain of the Yuan Dynasty

translations.zh: 钧窑、磁州窑、龙泉窑、德化窑等继续烧造传统陶瓷品种。
translations.en: Jingdezhen thus became China's most important porcelain-making centre, setting the stage for its central role in the Ming and Qing dynasties.

translations.zh: 划花陶瓷装饰技法之一。
translations.en: Incised Decoration Incising (huahua) is one of the techniques of porcelain decoration.

translations.zh: 系指以竹、木，骨或金属锥或针在已成型的陶瓷坯体上划出图案花纹。
translations.en: It involves incising designs on the unfired body with an awl or needle made of bamboo, wood, bone, or metal.

translations.zh: 早在新石器时代，陶器上已开始出现划花装饰，此后直至今日都在使用，从未间断。
translations.en: This technique has been used to this day from its first appearance in the Neolithic Age.

translations.zh: 历史上最著名的划花瓷器有五代至北宋瓷北宋耀州窑和越窑划花青瓷以及明、清景德镇御窑划花瓷器等。
translations.en: The huahua wares made at the Yaozhou kilns and in the Five Dynasties, the Yue kilns in the Northern Song Dynasty,and the imperial kilns in the Ming and Qing Dynasties were known for the smooth hair-like lines of the incised decoration,a product of superb craftsmanship in Jing

translations.zh: 各具风格的辽、西夏陶瓷目前已发现的著名辽代陶瓷窑场有位于辽宁省辽阳市的江官屯窑、北京市门头沟区的龙泉务窑、内蒙古自治区赤峰市的缸瓦窑和林东窑等。
translations.en: Distinctive Ceramics of the Liao and Western Xia Dynasties Kilns under the Liao regime produced white-glazed, black-glazed, and tea-dust porcelains, as well as low-temperature yellow-glazed, low-temperature green-glazed, and tri-colour pottery.

translations.zh: 烧造陶瓷品种主要有白釉、黑釉、茶叶末釉瓷和低温黄釉、绿釉、三彩釉陶等。
translations.en: Products from kilns under the Western Xia regime included black-glazed, brown-glazed, white-glazed, green-glazed, tea-dust, and ginger-glazed porcelains.

translations.zh: 目前已发现的著名西夏陶瓷窑场有位于宁夏回族自治区灵武市的磁窑堡窑和回民巷窑、贺兰县的插旗沟窑、海原县的天都山窑，甘肃省武威市的塔尔湾窑、平凉市的华亭窑、皋兰县的阿干镇窑，内蒙古自治区鄂尔多斯市的伊金霍洛旗窑和准格尔旗窑、阿拉善盟的额济纳旗窑等。
translations.en: Manufactured with techniques from the famous kilns of the Central Plains, the wares of the Liao (907-1125) and Western Xia (1038-1227) dynasties were characterised by Khitan and Tangut features and thus were distinctive products of their ethnic cultures, environment, and historical context.

translations.zh: 刻花陶瓷装饰技法之一。
translations.en: Carved Decoration Carving (kehua) is one of the techniques of porcelain decoration.

translations.zh: 系指以竹、木、骨或金属刀具在已成型的陶瓷坯体上通过直刀和斜刀的灵活运用刻出图案花纹。
translations.en: It involves carving patterns on an unfired body, with freely-combined vertical and slanting lines using tools made of bamboo, wood, bone, or metal.

translations.zh: 刻花技法最早见于新石器时代陶器上，以后各朝陶瓷器上均有使用，尤以宋代瓷器上应用最为普遍。
translations.en: The technique was applied throughout the ages after its first appearance in the Neolithic Age.

translations.zh: 宋代越窑、定窑、磁州窑、耀州窑、龙泉窑、景德镇窑等烧造的刻花瓷器均各具特色。
